Description: As a member of our Business Analysis team, you'll play a crucial role in identifying, improving, and developing technology solutions that drive our strategic goals. This is a tremendous opportunity to learn about high-priority initiatives and collaborate with colleagues throughout the firm. Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll sharpen your understanding of business processes and data analysis, while continuing to develop your leadership, management, and communication skills. No matter where your career ultimately takes you, you'll make a meaningful impact and lasting connections with outstanding colleagues and mentors. Our Global Technology & Digital Platform Services Workforce Strategy Team is a group of talented individuals that defines high-impact, long-term strategies to build world-class teams and an enabling culture in two of JPMC’s largest tech-centric groups, Global Technology (GT) and Digital & Platform Services (DPS). Use your data wrangling skills, creativity, and close collaboration with stakeholders at all levels to support the organization in data-driven decision making. Develop expertise in using workforce analytics to root out fundamental issues, synthesize elegant insights, and drive to clear decisions This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: - BS/BA degree or equivalent experience - A strong understanding of at least one business function in the firm, as well as a broader understanding of other areas. - Proficiency in business applications, data usage, and management - Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team - Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals - Curious to explore data and unveil insights to create a business story and to impact key business decisions - Passionate about building an innovative culture - Ability to develop, test,  and communicate  a data-driven hypothesis  or product  in a compelling manner to teammates and senior leadership in order to promote evidence-based decision-making - Generate data insights to strengthen stakeholders' data literacy and drive data-driven decision-making - Comfort in communicating with senior leaders and stakeholders across functions and levels - Ability to ensure successful execution and project management of large-scale, non-linear projects with high degree of independent time management - Ability to clean and analyze large amounts of disparate, unstructured data into valuable business insights - Articulate findings clearly and concisely through  presentations, discussions and visualizations - Interest in building new analytical and software skills in a results-driven business context - Advanced proficiency in Excel - Familiarity with statistical methods and software (R, Python, Stata) is a plus - Knowledge of Tableau, basic coding, and/or data science methods is a plus - Passion to learn new analytics tools and methodologies as part of your job Show more

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Enterprise Finance drives financial management for the company and maintains and enhances risk and financial controls. Key functions within Enterprise Finance include finance and accounting; Treasury; corporate development, mergers, and acquisitions; Data Management and Insights, the Customer Remediation Center of Excellence, Enterprise Shared Services, Business Process Management, and Corporate Strategy. Enterprise Finance informs shareholders, regulators, taxing authorities, team members, and leaders of the company's financial performance through earnings releases, investor meetings and conferences, and meetings with regulators and credit rating agencies, following appropriate reporting guidelines. They also maintain and enhance risk and financial controls and lead many of the company's shared services functions including corporate properties, security, and global services.  The Collateral Management Unit is part of Corporate Treasury within Wells Fargo Corporate Finance and is charged with analyzing enterprise collateral reporting with the intent of driving optimization efforts as well as playing a key role in governing the enterprises' Collateral positions.  In this role, the Treasury Finance Senior Consultant position will report to the group's head of stress testing and help support the creation and/or maintenance of various stress tests as well as being heavily involved in or leading specific elements relating to the automation of these tests (including related inputs). The successful candidate will gain significant responsibility for projects as a key member of a lean, dedicated team and will gain a thorough understanding of the risks of Well Fargo's on and off balance sheet exposures.  Responsibilities are varied but may include           The ideal candidate will have a background in liquidity risk at a top tier Investment Bank or Management Consulting Firm. She/he will have a demonstrated track record of attention to detail and critical thinking skills. She/he will possess excellent collaboration and organization skills, with a proven ability to develop cross-functional relationships and the capability to manage to deadlines. She/he will be able to work independently, be highly organized, able to prioritize multiple tasks and take on new challenges. She/he will have strong communication and presentation skills and is adept at building presentations and managing multiple projects simultaneously, each with a tight deadline.       550 S Tryon St - Charlotte, NC 30 Hudson Yards - New York, NY    All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Towers Crescent (12066), United States of America, Vienna, Virginia  Principal Data Analyst  At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we were a tiny startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and that little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.  Working on Eno, Capital One's intelligent assistant, as a Principal Associate of Data Analytics, you will partner cross-functionally with teams throughout the company to uncover valuable insights. You will enhance your data science, technical and analytical skills, while also working with product managers, data scientists and analyst’s to validate business strategies, experiments and modelling efforts, and may lead a team of analysts providing crucial data products to internal customers. With a network of hundreds of Data Analysts, Quants, and Data Scientists, challenging projects with an eye on the bottom line and a focus on work/life balance, we’ve created a dynamic environment with plenty of room for you to learn, grow, and realize your full potential.                Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position. Commercial Bank – Future Threats Fraud Strategy Manager Team Overview The CB Global Services Fraud function is responsible for designing and delivering the strategies to protect both the firm and its clients from losses covering all products and channels.  Within this function, the Analytics team will be driving the decision strategies to optimize fraud prevention and client experience measured against a set of KPI’s.  Our clients make a substantial volume of payments covering significant values, all of which can be attacked by external parties. Managing internal fraud losses is also within the remit of the team.   The responsibilities for the Fraud Strategy Future Threats Lead will include: - Identification of new and emerging threats - Keeping up to date with new and emerging technologies to protect the firm and clients from losses - Ensure all new products and services have been assessed for fraud risks and appropriate controls are included to mitigate risks identified - Ensuring compliance of fraud policies and controls with Governance and Change Control procedure - Engage with industry peers to ensure awareness of attack vectors Key specific accountabilities: - Build robust fraud control framework for new capabilities balancing the requirements for control and customer experience at the optimal level - Keep update knowledge of latest fraud attack vectors and design processes and controls to mitigate the risk - Work with product partners to ensure new products are fully evaluated to mitigate fraud risk with appropriate controls - Support Strategic Fraud initiatives or Bank-wide initiatives outlined by the business in relation with fraud strategy and policy rules Stakeholder management and leadership: - Engage with Senior Management on areas of fraud future threats and drive changes to mitigate the risk. - Participate in bank-wide projects and interact with external vendor as representative of Fraud Risk Management team. - Demonstrate ability to influence senior stakeholders to drive a strong control environment. Decision making and problem solving: - Knowledge and judgment to identify fraud risks through product review - Ability to carefully assess and make good judgment decisions regarding changes to changes in control frameworks - Requires good fraud instincts in development of fraud strategies anticipating the potential impact to genuine customers while preventing fraud losses. - Demonstrate knowledge of working with FinTechs and vendor to assess new fraud tools effectiveness - Ability to understand the entire authorization process flow to ensure effectiveness of fraud controls Qualifications  - Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field required - Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience - Proven ability to multi task with a sense of urgency - Able to adapt quickly - To new functional areas and/or concepts - To changing and or competing priorities  - Proven strong analytical and communication skills - Advance Microsoft Excel skills (pivot tables, macros, look-up functions, etc.) - Strong Proficiency with other Microsoft Applications (PowerPoint, Access, Visio, Word) - Articulate, confident and capable to communicate and influence Senior Executives - Problem solving, good critical thinking, and decision making skills - Experience/understanding of Business Process - High attention to detail - Self-motivated and driven to achieve targets and deliverables  Show more

Position Overview CCB Remediation and Corrections team manages the process to triage, fix, correct, and eliminate customer impact caused by a business process or operational break. CCB Correction Analytics COE team plays extremely critical function to support Analytics throughout the entire correction process, which entails to identify the impacted, calculate financial harms, execute to have customer appropriately refunded and/or notified based on various correction strategies. The CCB Correction Analytics COE was built in 2017 with a vision to have high talent Data Analysts centralized to support multiple LOB correction efforts including Consumer Banking, Business Banking, CWM and Credit Card. This COE model provides increased career mobility, better training, stronger controls and more opportunities to allow analysts to work across multiple LOBs. In order to excel in Correction Analytics, the individual needs to be highly motivated, highly analytical, extremely detail oriented, and an exceptional problem solver who take pride in being part of the correction organization that owns customer’s issues from the beginning to end, fix their problems and deliver great customer experiences. Skills/Competency Requirements - Use SQL and SAS to pull and wrangle data - Proficient coder - Able to pull data, aggregate/group by fields , and remove duplicate observations  - Proficiency with standard MS Office tools (Excel, Word, etc.) - Possess good verbal and written communication skills - Exhibit strong process adherence discipline - Throughout the life cycle of a project, specific process control procedures and documentation must be followed and completed by the CA (Corrections Analyst)  - Must be detailed and quality assurance oriented -  Willingness to ask questions to fully understand the break and correction activities - Able to deep dive and do root cause analysis - Be able to work multiple problems simultaneously -  Typically a CA will be assigned one to two cases at once - Understanding of the data infrastructure in a financial services organization will be a plus - JPMC product, data table, and/or structure knowledge preferred Knowledge/Experience/Education Requirements - Basic SQL experience – joining, filtering, and aggregating data tables - Basic SAS knowledge related to data-step programming - College degree and up to 5 years experience - MS Office experience - Experience working on multiple projects at once - JPMC Product knowledge preferred - JPMC Data knowledge preferred Show more

Wholesale Payments Operations (WPO) is part of the Digital & Platform Services organization in the Corporate & Investment Bank. WPO supports Payments, Receivables, and Trade Finance Products and acts as the payment hub for JPMorgan Chase, across the firm’s business lines. WPO consists of 5,500 employees across 60 sites and supports 142k corporations, financial institutions, governments and municipalities domiciled in over 180 countries. On average, WPO processes 30.1MM transactions daily across 122 currencies valued at $3.2T. Wholesale Payments Operations and the Payments industry as a whole are undergoing significant amounts of change and disruption – industry, technology, and organizational. It is critical to develop and execute on a strategy that will enhance the organization’s business and operational model and position it for continued success. Role Description: We are seeking an Vice President level candidate to lead diagnostics initiatives across the WPO organization. The role will report directly to the Data Science Manager within Wholesale Payments Operations – Strategy & Innovation Team. The successful candidate will build and leveraging sophisticated diagnostics toolsets, identifying insights, developing transformation opportunities across WPO. This role will interact and collaborate with Operations Leaders and their respective organizations, key partners across Digital & Platform Services including Operations Transformation, Data Science, Technology and Business colleagues.  In addition, the candidate should have  data engineering capabilities, knowledge and skills.  This role is ideal for a highly motivated individual with advanced analytics, problem solving, influencing, interpersonal and communication skills.  Responsibilities: •       Leverage diagnostic toolsets including (taxonomy, workforce discovery, digital process discovery, process mapping, manual touchpoints, and email rationalization) to gain insight into what WPO does and how it is performed. •       Lead data analysis and bring order to the various separate diagnostic datasets to connect them together to generate and deliver insights to key stakeholders. ·         Lead technology conversations as it relates to Architecture, data structures, data modeling and perform the capabilities necessary to produce the results required in order to drive successful adoption of a data driven decision making mindset. ·         Lead discussions and influence the partners to develop and successfully establish the technology foundation required for data analytics to be put into the hands of the Operations Leads, Operations Analyst using Operations friendly tools. Skills Required / Qualifications •               Strong analytics experience – Alteryx, Excel •               Strong data visualization – Tableau (Preferred) / Qlik •               Complex problem-solving skills •               High tolerance for ambiguity •               Ability to build relationships with and influence colleagues and partners •               Confident communicator with ability to provide clear and succinct verbal and written updates •               Superior execution skills •               Strong risk and control mindset •               Ability to work independently, make leadership decisions which will highlight and align to the strategic direction of the program and operations benefits •               Ability to lead team members to deliver complex solutions or through complex business problems (matrix and direct hierarchy) Show more

JPMorgan Chase & Co . (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the worlds most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com .  Consumer & Community Banking (CCB) Compliance team plays a critical role in developing and maintaining a strong compliance culture by working closely with management, Legal, Risk and Audit functions to advise on regulatory compliance matters. CCB Compliance identifies, measures, manages and controls compliance-related risks while monitoring and testing the adequacy of CCB's compliance control environment.  This role will assist in enabling the transformation of CCB Home Loans Compliance Monitoring from a manual process based organization to one that will leverage Automation, Machine Learning, Natural language processing, voice analytics, text mining, etc., to assess conformance with regulatory requirements impacting the home lending business.  This individual will work closely with the Agile team of compliance professionals, various data science and technology groups, who utilize the firm's system of record data resources to assess whether products and services offered by Chase's Home Lending business and related processes are in compliance with both the letter and spirit of applicable laws and regulations.     JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. Internal Audit: JPMC's Internal Audit Department, which is comprised of over 1,300 auditors globally, reports to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors and is further accountable to the Chairman and CEO, senior management, and the regulators. Audit is an independent risk assessment function established within the organization to evaluate, test and report on the adequacy and effectiveness of management's system of internal control.   Data Analytics: The Data Analytics Group within Internal Audit is responsible for developing and enhancing the use of data analytics techniques across the Audit function, including the use of analytical tools and capabilities as well as transformative approaches using machine learning and AI to deepen the assurance provided by Internal Audit to its stakeholders. The DAG is also responsible for raising the level of data literacy across the function, working with the respective Chief Auditors of the Lines of Businesses and Corporate Functions. JPMC Internal Audit seeks an Analytics Solutions Manager to join our Core Data Analytics team. This individual will be responsible for collaborating with Data Analytics (DA) and audit colleagues, SMEs, Audit Practices and Corporate Technology (CT) to identify, research and design opportunities for innovation and automation. This role will report to the Core DA lead. Responsibilities: ·         Identify and deliver innovative solutions, with a focus on opportunities that drive department efficiency, effectiveness and consistency ·         Perform detailed analysis on opportunities, including fact finding, applicability, viability, feasibility and sustainability ·         Define business case including approach, feasibility, research findings, cost- benefit analysis and risks or dependencies ·         Project manage the automation initiative through to deployment, partnering with CT and engaging Audit/CT staff and stakeholders as needed ·         Perform project post mortem, track ongoing feedback and usage ·         Manage relationships and communication with key stakeholders ·         Seek opportunities to simplify, consolidate and mature existing DA products to enable the best possible set of automation tools to be produced. ·         Experience with working with end users to define and design business, functional, and technical requirements, source data, develop solutions taking an iterative approach, and assist with systems selection pilots and implementation support ·         Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, end user service, and technical writing skills, coupled with strong interest in further developing and integrating operations with technology ·         Stay abreast of new tools and technologies to assist the team in creating the most efficient and effective solutions Knowledge, Skills and Experience ·         Minimum of a Bachelor's degree ·         Eight plus years of experience in financial services, internal audit, data analytics, technology, business analysis or risks/controls ·         Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills ·         Strong project management skills,  experience working with complex data sets and environments, drawing conclusions and reporting findings ·         Proven ability to oversee several tasks concurrently in an efficient and effective manner with a track record in creative and successful delivery ·         Work well in a team but also show leadership skills, manage expectations & competing priorities, be enthusiastic, have Overview: Supporting Securities Platform Services within the Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB), the Industry and Regulatory Change Management Team’s mission is to ensure operational and technical readiness and compliance of industry and regulatory related mandates and changes.  Department scope includes technology and operational enhancement initiatives, oversight and governance of resiliency program to ensure operational readiness and compliance to firm wide resiliency framework as well as management of the firm wide Resolution & Recovery (R&R) submissions to the FED and FDIC as result of Dodd-Frank Legislation.  The Role: Candidate will have the opportunity to support a multitude of workstreams within the Industry and Regulatory Change Management department, including Resiliency program management, launching and managing process improvements and strategic enhancement projects related to industry and regulatory changes as well as the related regulatory submissions.    The Resiliency Program encompasses several aspects, including the launching and implementation of the new firmwide resiliency framework to ensure adherence to regulator and government agencies requirements and mandates.  In crisis events, candidate will assist in planning and administering crisis management and communications as well as governance and oversight of periodic resiliency testing to evidence operational readiness.    As part of the broader industry and regulatory change program, the role will support DPS wide manual touch point reduction program with streamline and process change projects to improve efficiency.  The role will interface with many cross functional teams and partners in Securities Operations, CIB and Corporate level program teams.  Candidate requires an understanding of the securities operations functions and their processes, knowledge of the functional groups involved to support deliveries and working knowledge of securities products.  Candidate should be able to demonstrate good program management and technical skills, a self-starter contributing more broadly across the team’s mission and deliveries.  Responsibilities:  - Management of a sustainable firmwide resiliency program to ensure operational readiness during a resiliency or crisis events, which includes: - Liaise with operations management to document, track and report of risks, impact and gap assessment  - Support in resiliency mitigation strategies via data analytics  - Build out of Crisis Management and Resiliency Event Playbooks  - Plan and host resiliency tabletop exercise to test resiliency strategies  - Organize and lead response during resiliency or crisis events.   - Drive the reduction of operational manual touchpoints: - Liaise and ensure monthly data reports for completeness and accuracy  - Partner with Operations teams to identify and deliver streamline opportunities  - Reconcile results of streamline enhancements to manual touchpoints   - Support various aspects of Resolution and Recovery submissions:   - BAU processes and monthly governance work Critical Operations Plans  - Compilation and coordination of annual resolution plans to the FED and FDIC.  - Data analysis and remediation of gaps identified relates in R&R plans and its supporting data.   Required Skills and Qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required.  - Current associates with minimum 3+ years of experience required in program/project management  - Prior experience with regulatory reporting, operations or control area.   - Excellent communication skills – comfortable in interacting with senior leaders  - Self-starter with strong matrix management skills – ability to work with cross functional teams and others outside of your direct span of control to meet deliverables.  - Excellent data analysis and presentation skills required: Advance Excel & Powerpoint, Alteryx and Tableau required  - Strong analytical skills with the ability to adapt or suggest approaches and solutions for complex and ambiguous topics and issues  - Ability to deduct action plans from ad hoc requests from Corporate oversight teams or regulators  - Ability to work in a fast paced deadline driven environment  - CIB and/or Securities processing experience preferred Show more

Summary of Responsibilities The Asset Management Distribution Intelligence & Client Analytics team uses data to optimize distribution and marketing strategies for the $1TN AUM Asset Management business. The team oversees the entire data lifecycle, from acquisition to analytics to delivery and measurement of increased ROI and sales growth. As part of this broader group, the team’s mission is to use data to identify insights that lead to direct recommendations and dialogues that shape marketing strategies. The team works closely with marketing stakeholders at all levels of the business in order to bring these strategies to life and drive this transformation. We are looking for a multi-talented, high-energy individual that will help create, coordinate and execute on our strategic priorities across digital marketing, analytics, and technology. Our ideal candidate would have: 1) Coding experience (Python, Pyspark and SQL) 2) Experience with marketing platforms (Google Analytics, 3) Familiarity and comfort with marketing initiatives 4) Experience and affinity for working with large data sets 5) Strong project management skills 6) A pragmatic view of the role digital plays in a business environment 7) Strong intellectual curiosity 8) Digital and Marketing experience The successful candidate will be part of a high-performing team with a great culture. The responsibilities of this role will include: - Construct analytic projects to solve business challenges and drive business growth, including implementation and change management - Evaluate analytic project results from both a statistical and business impact viewpoint; prioritize and manage stakeholders accordingly - In-depth exploration of data to develop marketing strategies - Partnering with senior digital distribution stakeholders and business partners - Working with technology teams to define data strategy and build data models - Conducting data analyses and prototyping basic statistical or machine learning models - Fostering a data-driven, innovative culture Skills/Competencies Required: Competencies - At least 3+ years of experience in roles within the fields of business strategy, consulting, technology, data analysis, and/or asset management - BA / BS degree – majors or minors in business, engineering, computer science, data science, finance, or related fields - 1+ year coding in Python and SQL - Experience with analytic project management - Financial services experience, asset management preferred - 3+ years in digital marketing preferred Skills - Comfort in working flexibly and iteratively with large sets of data - Applying a practical analytic lens to identify key insights - Proficient with Excel, PowerPoint, and/or other common project and business communication software - Functional in Python and well versed in SQL - Modeling acumen - Strong time management and organizational skills - Strong communication/interpersonal skills - Ability to adapt to shifting priorities, requirements and timelines by utilizing problem-solving skills - Proactive communications and positive attitude to manage stakeholder satisfaction Show more

Finance Control Management (FCM) is responsible for maintaining a strong and consistent control environment across Corporate and Line of Business Finance (collectively “Firmwide Finance” or “Global Finance”). With Control Managers appointed for each Function and Line of Business, there is a comprehensive coverage and joint accountability model with the business executive that promotes early operational risk identification and assessment, effective design and evaluation of controls and sustainable solutions to mitigate operational risk. Control Management focuses on four areas: control design and expertise, risks and controls identification/assessment, control breaks and resolution, and control governance & reporting. FCM is also responsible for managing the Firm’s SOX Framework and CCAR CFO Attestation Program and governing other external reporting initiatives including Quality Assurance, Accountability & Attestations and Issues & Errors Management. The FCM Governance & Reporting team is responsible for developing and executing programs and initiatives that support Finance Control Management’s objectives. Responsibilities include: Control Management Governance - Produce and coordinate materials for monthly and annual updates to Senior Management governance forums including the Global Finance Control Committee, the Firmwide Control Committee, the Office of the CFO meeting, and the Audit Committee; drive action items to completion - Perform ongoing monitoring of Firmwide Finance risks, issue management and metrics; including escalation to various control and risk forums - Lead the monthly Firmwide Finance Control Managers meeting and coordinate specific Finance initiatives with control manager engagement   - Administer Corporate Finance Keys meetings to support the management closure of regulatory issues - Provide oversight of Corporate Finance committees Risk Assessment and Reporting - Produce and coordinate the GF&BM quarterly conduct risk appetite and the Financial Reporting and Accounting risk quarterly operational risk appetite - Perform ongoing monitoring of Financial Reporting and Accounting risks, issue management and metrics; including escalation to various control and risk forums - Administer root cause analysis and lessons learned for Compliance, Conduct and Operational Risk issues, losses and events Finance and Firmwide Initiatives - Develop and drive implementation of control standards for Intelligent Solutions across Office of the CFO - Identify the need for and lead initiatives to address regulatory commitments and management priorities The role reports to the FCM Governance & Reporting lead and provides opportunities to work with Corporate and Line of Business Finance Control Managers and partner primarily with Risk Management and Compliance, Audit and Technology. Qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required - 3-5 years of experience in financial services industry with background in process improvement, controls, audit, quality assurance, operational risk management, or compliance preferred; or equivalent subject matter expertise in a relevant business related function/operation - Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) required and data analytics preferred using Excel, Access, Tableau/Dashboard reporting - Business knowledge – fast learner with the ability to grasp Finance concepts and regulations - Project management skillset – ability to coordinate collection of data from various sources and partners timely and in an organized manner; including taking ownership of the project and results - Communication/presentation – excellent written and verbal communication skills; including preparing presentations and reports, with an ability to communicate and present to management in a clear and meaningful manner - Problem solving / Analytical skills – solid critical thinking. Ability to review and challenge data, metrics and problems and formulate appropriate action items and solutions that are then driven to completion - Work autonomously – flexible, adaptable to shifting priorities, manages competing priorities to achieve the most effective result and able to work in a fast-paced, results driven environment - Decision Making/Judgement – moderate level of independent decision making using sound judgement and providing timely escalation and feedback - Networking – strong interpersonal skills; strong collaboration and relationship building skills Show more

Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to deliver banking, sales and trading and asset management capabilities to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and control to preserve and enhance the firm’s assets and its reputation. For every trade agreed, every new product launched or market entered, every transaction completed, it is Operations that develops the processes and controls that makes business flow.      Looking for an Associate who is passionate about risk and control and can be a part of the Control Solutions (CS) team in their mission to provide assurance for non-financial regulatory compliance and monitoring functions.    The CS team within Regulatory and Control Operations (RCO) is responsible for implementing an evolving control framework to support our regulatory obligations and ensuring the continued integrity of our books and records reconciliations    To drive consistency, control, and traceability of key Operational processes through the application of detailed assessments and the utilization of business intelligence tools. The Control Solutions team offers specialist skill sets and technical knowledge in the areas of front-to-back process review, traceability documentation, standardization and governance, and the design and implementation of complex business solutions.    The Associate would be involved in helping the team develop and achieve its strategic objectives, with Assessment & Analytics driving a notable proportion of their overall day to day responsibilities. Performing Front to back assessments would entail validating the data reported and ensuring functions carried out by the teams are in compliant with our regulatory obligations and control framework. They will be accountable for the quality of the information we send and maintaining the right reporting environment to ensure issues are quickly escalated and remediated. The candidate will need to engage with their global RCO Operations and technology groups, legal, compliance and internal audit.  We will also expect the successful candidate to contribute in the continuous build of our Analytics and Metrics Strategy. Our partners in Operations and Technology are gathering and managing a vast array of data and processes which contribute to the firm’s regulatory compliance; our role is to provide assurance to the firm in respect to our compliance. Role Responsibilities: - Create a proactive risk and control culture that leverages proven evaluation strategies and sound change management protocols  - In partnership with stakeholders, evaluate and perform an end-to-end analysis of the business’ risk and control environment to identify significant gaps and weaknesses and determine root cause of control breaks - Ensure that controls are properly designed, operating effectively, and essential to a proactive risk and control culture that leverages proven evaluation strategies and sound change management protocols - Review, analyze and assist with strategy of program related data (e.g., KRI/KPI) to support business-related risk mitigation  - Provide leadership support for the end-to-end execution of the Risk & Control evaluation, including control breaks, Action Plans and resolutions, to reduce financial loss, regulatory exposure, and reputational risk  - Assist with and lead development of CORE Risk & Control mapping and documentations through participation in end-to-end process walkthroughs and deep dives with assigned business units - Engage with control colleagues across the firm, business, operations management, legal, compliance, risk, audit, regulators and technology control functions  - Assist with and lead Line of Business efforts including implementation of applicable control policies, standards and Firm-wide initiatives, including developing strategic solutions to meet requirements   Qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required - 7 years of experience in financial services industry with background in controls, audit, data governance or operational data risk management; able to synthesize large amounts of data and formulate appropriate conclusions - Understanding root cause / identifying control breaks  - Developing timely and sustainable solutions  - Analyze metrics for emerging risk   - Implementation skills - Writing Action Plans, Procedures  - Strategize on Policy and Standard requirement to meet business, Firm, and regulatory needs and subsequently driving implementation, including development of operating models, communications, training, tracking/reporting, etc.  - Change Management   - Ability to make subjective and informed decisions based upon output, influence stakeholders and justify decision making  - Developing timely and sustainable solutions - Analyze metrics for emerging risk    Show more

Corporate Risk - Risk Regulation - VP – New York  YOUR IMPACT  As a VP in Corporate Risk - Risk Regulation based in New York, you will play a key role in the oversight of credit, market, and operational risk management regulation. You will be responsible for leading projects and participating in activities primarily related to important regulatory initiatives.      The Risk Division is a team of specialists charged with managing the firm’s credit, market, liquidity, and operational risk. Whether assessing the creditworthiness of the firm’s counterparties, monitoring market risks associated with trading activities, or offering analytical and regulatory compliance support, our work contributes directly to the firm’s success. The division is ideal for collaborative individuals who have strong ethics and attention to detail.  The Corporate Risk department is a function within the Risk Division (second line of defence) responsible for managing the Division’s regulatory risk and operational risk across risk disciplines (i.e. market risk, credit risk, operational risk, and liquidity risk), among leading other important initiative for the Division. The Regulatory function within Corporate Risk manages regulatory interactions, policy/regulatory obligations and leads the communication with internal and external parties, including our regulators.  In performing its role, the Corporate Risk department works closely with all areas within the Risk Division, as well as with various groups across the firm including Controllers, Global Markets Division, Internal Audit and Technology. Specific to this role, the team partners with the Credit Risk (“CR”), Market Risk (“MR”) and Operational Risk (“OR”) departments, to ensure appropriate oversight of related regulatory requirements, including existing regulations, the assessment of new regulation and the development and implementation of associated processes, analytics and reports. OPERATIONS  Operations partners with all areas of Goldman Sachs to deliver our institutional, consumer and asset management businesses and to provide a seamless experience for our clients. We manage and process our clients’ business, including onboarding, post-trade processing and regulatory compliance. Our teams work closely across the firm to develop and deliver new products and services, while mitigating operational risk and enhancing the client experience. We drive process and technology change to scale and automate our businesses. Operations professionals are either embedded in the revenue division that they support, or they support multiple businesses and are part of core Operations.      You are looking to join a fast-paced, dynamic team that has broad connectivity across the firm for a franchise critical process. You will collaborate with cross-Federation teams to manage the firm’s retail cash payments and receipts each day. You have a strong desire to contribute your cash management and retail transactions experience to support our retail clients and manage business risks, as well as work closely with a network of key banks and internal payments team to ensure smooth execution.    Treasury Services is a sub division of the Operations Division. As a global, multi-faceted and cross product sub division, the primary objectives are to mitigate payment risk through the active monitoring of retail deposits, lending, or card accounts, executing payments, monitoring adherence to NACHA operating rules, using ACH risk management tools to support AML and Fraud in eliminating fraud loss.  The sub division has a rare opportunity as an independent control to support the Marcus by Goldman Sachs with electronic payments, ACH, Lock box, check, wire, ACH risk management, settlement, clearing and ACH file monitoring in order to mitigate operational money movement risks.  Treasury Services has regional presence in Salt Lake City, Dallas, New York, London, Bengaluru, Singapore, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and many other offices working closely together. OPERATIONS  Operations partners with all areas of Goldman Sachs to deliver our institutional, consumer and asset management businesses and to provide a seamless experience for our clients. We manage and process our clients’ business, including onboarding, post-trade processing and regulatory compliance. Our teams work closely across the firm to develop and deliver new products and services, while mitigating operational risk and enhancing the client experience. We drive process and technology change to scale and automate our businesses. Operations professionals are either embedded in the revenue division that they support, or they support multiple businesses and are part of core Operations.      You are looking to join a fast-paced, dynamic team that has broad connectivity across the firm for a franchise critical process. You will collaborate with cross-Federation teams to manage the firm’s retail cash payments and receipts each day. You have a strong desire to contribute your cash management and retail transactions experience to support our retail clients and manage business risks, as well as work closely with a network of key banks and internal payments team to ensure smooth execution.    Treasury Services is a sub division of the Operations Division. As a global, multi-faceted and cross product sub division, the primary objectives are to mitigate payment risk through the active monitoring of retail deposits, lending, or card accounts, executing payments, monitoring adherence to NACHA operating rules, using ACH risk management tools to support AML and Fraud in eliminating fraud loss.  The sub division has a rare opportunity as an independent control to support the Marcus by Goldman Sachs with electronic payments, ACH, Lock box, check, wire, ACH risk management, settlement, clearing and ACH file monitoring in order to mitigate operational money movement risks.  Treasury Services has regional presence in Salt Lake City, Dallas, New York, London, Bengaluru, Singapore, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and many other offices working closely together. GLOBAL COMPLIANCE  Our division prevents, detects and mitigates compliance, regulatory and reputational risk across the firm and helps to strengthen the firm’s culture of compliance. Compliance accomplishes these through the firm’s enterprise-wide compliance risk management program. As an independent control function and part of the firm’s second line of defense, Compliance assesses the firm’s compliance, regulatory and reputational risk; monitors for compliance with new or amended laws, rules and regulations; designs and implements controls, policies, procedures and training; conducts independent testing; investigates, surveils and monitors for compliance risks and breaches; and leads the firm’s responses to regulatory examinations, audits and inquiries. You'll be part of a team with members from a wide range of academic and professional backgrounds, such as law, accounting, sales, and trading. We look for those who possess sound judgment, curiosity, and are able to adapt to a changing regulatory landscape.      Are you passionate about digital consumer banking? We're looking for a Vice President to join our consumer banking compliance team. You will focus on supporting the development and execution of new business opportunities for consumer credit cards. in addition, you will drive the enhancement, management and oversight of the compliance management system for consumer credit cards, including metrics, risk assessments, exams and reporting.    Our consumer banking compliance team partners with all functional areas of the Digital Finance business to advise on business strategy, develop compliant processes within the business, implement compliance processes, systems, and digital tools for identifying, measuring, and mitigating risk and report on the status of such risk. You will be involved in building and managing this new business for the Firm. As an experienced professional in Business Analysis, you'll shape the technology solutions that drive strategic initiatives across the firm. Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll interact with colleagues in various lines of businesses to learn about challenges and opportunities, and translate that insight into high-quality solutions. In addition to working with the development team to create new solutions, you'll help optimize existing technology and identify new capabilities. While your role requires deep technological skills – including expertise in everything from data management to functional design – it also hinges on teamwork and leadership. You'll offer clear guidance and feedback to your Business Analysis colleagues, while promoting the values, culture, and brand of JPMorgan Chase & Co. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: - BS/BA degree or equivalent experience - Advanced knowledge of business processes and data analysis, as well as the ability to construct complex data queries and collaborate with colleagues - Ability to liaison between lines of business and development teams, translating strategic goals into technology solutions, and vice versa - Experience in project management, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource planning - Understanding of business needs, including how data is used and managed, and functional design - Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals Show more

West Creek 2 (12072), United States of America, Richmond, Virginia  Business Analyst Associate - 2021  In our 25 years as a founder-led public company, Capital One has grown from a small, credit card start-up that pioneered the use of predictive modeling into one of the largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic financial technology companies. At Capital One, we believe our success is fueled by data-driven insights, deep customer understanding, and innovative business strategy. We’ve helped transform cities and communities by attracting incredibly talented associates with the audacity to think they can change the world and the humility to understand they need a whole lot of help to make it happen.  If you’re interested in Capital One and a development program that enables you to build a strong foundation by focusing on deep analytical challenges and business strategy, then the Analyst Development Program is a great place to begin your career journey.     As a Business Analyst, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. This role will enable you to build your business management skills by developing and deploying strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. You will act as a business consultant to drive recommendations and implement solutions. You will do this by collaborating with colleagues across product, tech, sales, operations, design, data science, engineering, and finance in an environment that values your unique insights, encourages you to take on new responsibilities, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation. Through our best-in-class analytical practices, you’ll help us quickly identify, build, and test our way to success.             Job Category - Analytics, Product Innovators Show more

Position Overview CCB Remediation and Corrections team manages the process to triage, fix, correct, and eliminate customer impact caused by a business process or operational break. CCB Correction Analytics COE team plays extremely critical function to support Analytics throughout the entire correction process, which entails to identify the impacted, calculate financial harms, execute to have customer appropriately refunded and/or notified based on various correction strategies. The CCB Correction Analytics COE was built in 2017 with a vision to have high talent Data Analysts centralized to support multiple LOB correction efforts including Consumer Banking, Business Banking, CWM and Credit Card. This COE model provides increased career mobility, better training, stronger controls and more opportunities to allow analysts to work across multiple LOBs. In order to excel in Correction Analytics, the individual needs to be highly motivated, highly analytical, extremely detail oriented, and an exceptional problem solver who take pride in being part of the correction organization that owns customer’s issues from the beginning to end, fix their problems and deliver great customer experiences. Skills/Competency Requirements - Use SQL and SAS to pull and wrangle data- Proficient coder - Able to pull data, aggregate/group by fields , and remove duplicate observations  - Proficiency with standard MS Office tools (Excel, Word, etc.) - Possess good verbal and written communication skills - Exhibit strong process adherence discipline- Throughout the life cycle of a project, specific process control procedures and documentation must be followed and completed by the CA (Corrections Analyst)  - Must be detailed and quality assurance oriented -  Willingness to ask questions to fully understand the break and correction activities - Able to deep dive and do root cause analysis - Be able to work multiple problems simultaneously -  Typically a CA will be assigned one to two cases at once - Understanding of the data infrastructure in a financial services organization will be a plus - JPMC product, data table, and/or structure knowledge preferred Knowledge/Experience/Education Requirements - Basic SQL experience – joining, filtering, and aggregating data tables - Basic SAS knowledge related to data-step programming - College degree and up to 5 years experience - MS Office experience - Experience working on multiple projects at once - JPMC Product knowledge preferred - JPMC Data knowledge preferred Show more

Job Description  Applies technical knowledge in determining end to end design requirements for large projects involving line of business, software/hardware developers and vendors. Work closely with business partners to define strategies for technical solutions, determine requirements, and develop functional designs based on the analysis of line of business needs, objectives and existing systems infrastructure. Drives and participates in design, development and implementation of large and complex enterprise wide applications, often using new technologies. Work closely with developers and testers to ensure requirements and functional designs are translated accurately into working technical designs and that test plans and scripts serve customer needs. May manage projects including responsibility for a project and project budget. Works under minimal supervision on enterprise wide projects requiring creative solutions. Job Description  LOB Job Description:  This role is responsible for capturing and refining business and/or system requirements (based on specialization). Key responsibilities include working with stakeholders to understand their needs, analyze problems, and capture their requirements, and then working closely with the Development Team(s) to refine the requirements into specifications that can be executed by the team. They possess a foundational understanding of the business and/or technical domain based on their specialization.  This role will be responsible for    5+ years of experience with Process Design, gathering and analyzing user requirements, developing functional and operational specifications using professional techniques and automated tools. The Process Design role will contribute and have input to the process definition, requirements gathering, documentation, system development, quality assurance, testing, deployment and support within the system framework enabling key business capabilities. Requires a strong skill set around general business emphasis of traditional process design, documentation, project management with a working knowledge of the systems development lifecycle (SDLC) and IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) practices. The role will directly interface with system stakeholders, end users and developers. Skills desired also include strong process design, documentation, systems such as JIRA and Remedy, and communication and presentation skills, along with a general technical knowledge of the system architecture      1st shift (United States of America)    40 Show more

McLean 2 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia  Investment Analyst  About United Income  United Income is a financial technology company that was recently acquired by Capital One. We combine the latest technology with time-tested wisdom to understand the interconnectedness of our financial lives better, allowing us to lower client’s taxes, boost retirement benefits, and improve the quality of investment management.  We have over $1 billion of assets under management, 99 percent client retention, and 88 percent of clients have had their fees reduced (since our technology lowers our operating costs, which we share with our clients). We’ve attracted over 200 media stories about the company’s wealth-building innovations and thought leadership, including a Forbes article that said we have “an all-star team.”  Our team is united in our mission to use new technology to increase the financial potential of our customers in ways that have not been possible in the past. That’s where you come in. We want the best and the brightest. Work is more fun when you know that you’re surrounded by people who are as dedicated as you are.    Use technology to lower the cost of advice, improve its quality, and simplify its delivery so we can help more people convert their hard work into financial mobility and security.       As an Investment Analyst at United Income, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to investments and trading to drive customer value and outcomes. You will team with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact our customers and the bottom line. And you will do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.  We are looking for an Investment Analyst who is exceptionally imaginative, collaborative, and truly excited about our mission. The ideal candidate is resourceful, analytical, self-motivating, and has great attention to detail. Job Description  Provides technical systems and software support for modification, implementation, or conversion of business systems. Translates business needs into technical requirements and ensures all systems support and conform to business needs and specifications. Acts as liaison between business unit and software, hardware developers and vendors. Proficient to work fairly independently on the most complex projects, and often on multiple phases. Working knowledge of business or function for which application or system is designed. Often responsible for the completion of a component of a project. Provides guidance and check the work of less experienced associates. IT degree preferred or substantially equivalent experience. Typically requires a minimum of 3-5 years of applicable experience.  Responsible for providing first point of contact support to internal users by providing day-to-day inquiry/system support for business partners on supported applications. Consults with technology support and acts as a liaison with business partners during the resolution of system issues. Understands the end-to-end process to answer inquiries and resolve moderately complex requests under supervision. Keep abreast of all functions, changes and enhancements. Must be client focused and be able to build and sustain work relationships. Proficient to work fairly independently on various IT functions. Resolve routine issues regarding operations, including administration, error messages, on-line transactions, system status and downtime procedures, etc. Ensure user satisfaction by providing preventative maintenance, troubleshooting and quickly resolving routine problems. Position Overview CCB Remediation and Corrections team manages the process to triage, fix, correct, and eliminate customer impact caused by a business process or operational break. CCB Correction Analytics COE team plays extremely critical function to support Analytics throughout the entire correction process, which entails to identify the impacted, calculate financial harms, execute to have customer appropriately refunded and/or notified based on various correction strategies. The CCB Correction Analytics COE was built in 2017 with a vision to have high talent Data Analysts centralized to support multiple LOB correction efforts including Consumer Banking, Business Banking, CWM and Credit Card. This COE model provides increased career mobility, better training, stronger controls and more opportunities to allow analysts to work across multiple LOBs. In order to excel in Correction Analytics, the individual needs to be highly motivated, highly analytical, extremely detail oriented, and an exceptional problem solver who take pride in being part of the correction organization that owns customer’s issues from the beginning to end, fix their problems and deliver great customer experiences. Skills/Competency Requirements - Expertise and practical experience with pulling and wrangling data using SQL and SAS or other advanced programming skills (C++, R, Python, Stata, etc.)- Utilize data-step programming and PROC SQL to efficiently pull and manipulate data - Knowledge of analytical functions - Ability to write and read SAS macros - Able to pull data, aggregate/group by fields , and remove duplicate observations - Understanding of how to match tables without unique fields  - Elevated proficiency with standard MS Office tools (Excel, Word, etc.) - Possess good verbal and written communication skills- Communicates thoughtfully and thoroughly  - Ability to quickly self-learn different business and execute analytics projects- Understanding the business problem - Working out an analytical solution  - Simplify complex issues  - Identify and carry out programming steps to solve a problem- Analyst will frequently need to challenge and self-identify correction requirements  - Ability to research data structure using front-end systems - Able to independently deep dive and do root cause analysis - Exhibit strong process adherence discipline- Throughout the life cycle of a project, specific process control procedures and documentation must be followed and completed by the CA (Corrections Analyst)  - Must be detailed and quality assurance oriented- Willingness to ask questions to fully understand the break and correction activities  - Be able to work multiple problems simultaneously- Typically a CA will be assigned two to three problems at once  - Understanding of the data infrastructure in a financial services organization will be a plus - Detailed JPMC product, data table, and/or structure knowledge preferred - Proficient in Tera Data database environments; Oracle environments a plus. Knowledge/Experience/Education Requirements - Advanced SQL experience related to data wrangling and aggregation - Advanced SAS experience related to data-step programming - College degree and 5 + years experience - MS Office experience - Experience working on multiple projects at once - Experience redefining unclear business requirements - Experience leading a case/project - Advanced degree preferred - JPMC Product knowledge preferred - JPMC Data knowledge preferred - Experience with agile methodology preferred - Teradata and/or Oracle databases experience preferred Show more

Analysts will also have the opportunity to participate in multiple role rotations within Wealth.  – You will spend time with Divisional Directors during coaching sessions, make effective outbound calls, submit paperwork, gain exposure to support roles and participation in client-facing activities. – You will spend time with the trading department, create presentations, conduct industry research, and understand how to make changes to investment mixes based on the current market. – You will assist with financial planning, create presentations, prepare for client meetings and observe daily activities of client support teammates. – You will become familiar with complex credit products, collaborate with various Wealth Advisors and handle/contribute to document prep and follow-up.  What to Expect  Throughout your time as a Wealth Analyst, you will play a meaningful role in supporting internal business partners and external clients. You will expand your leadership and collaborative team skills, while gaining industry and technical knowledge. Our program also offers vast exposure to senior leaders within Wealth, a support network of mentors and peers, and the chance to join the close-knit Wealth community. Upon program completion, analysts who meet performance requirements may be placed in one of the Wealth roles mentioned above, as well as others―based on business needs, analyst preference and performance. J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.   Background: Wholesale Payments Operations (WPO) is part of the Digital & Platform Services organization in the Corporate & Investment Bank. WPO supports Payments, Receivables, and Trade Finance Products and acts as the payment hub for JPMorgan Chase, across the firm’s business lines. WPO consists of 5,500 employees across 60 sites and supports 142k corporations, financial institutions, governments and municipalities domiciled in over 180 countries. On average, WPO processes 30.1MM transactions daily across 122 currencies valued at $3.2T.   Wholesale Payments Operations and the Payments industry as a whole are undergoing significant amounts of change and disruption – industry, technology, and organizational. It is critical to develop and execute on a strategy that will enhance the organization’s business and operational model and position it for continued success.   Role Description: We are seeking an Associate level candidate to lead diagnostics initiatives across the WPO organization. The role will report directly to the Data Analysis within Wholesale Payments Operations – Strategy & Innovation Team. The successful candidate will build and leveraging sophisticated diagnostics toolsets, identifying insights, developing transformation opportunities across WPO and performing basic project management business analysis and design functions as needed. This role will interact and collaborate with Operations Leaders and their respective organizations, key partners across Digital & Platform Services including Operations Transformation, Data Science, Technology and Business colleagues.   This role is ideal for a highly motivated individual with advanced analytics, problem solving, influencing, interpersonal and communication skills.    Responsibilities: •       Leverage diagnostic toolsets including (taxonomy, workforce discovery, digital process discovery, process mapping, manual touchpoints, and email rationalization) to gain insight into what WPO does and how it is performed. •       Lead data analysis and bring order to the various separate diagnostic datasets to connect them together to generate and deliver insights to key stakeholders. Skills Required / Qualifications •       Strong analytics experience – Alteryx, Excel •       Strong data visualization – Tableau (Preferred) / Qlik •       Complex problem-solving skills •       High tolerance for ambiguity •       Ability to build relationships with and influence colleagues and partners •       Confident communicator with ability to provide clear and succinct verbal and written updates •       Superior execution skills •       Strong risk and control mindset Show more

Job Description  Responsible for capturing and refining business and/or system requirements (based on specialization) that may or may not involve a software change. Works with stakeholders to understand their needs, analyze problems, and capture their requirements, and then working closely with the Development Team to refine the requirement into specifications that can be executed by the team. Possess a foundational understanding of the business and/or technical domain based on their specialization. Developing an understanding of stakeholder needs to help create a solution, envisions the solution to solve a problem (manual or through software). Analyzes the stakeholder process to build efficiencies and also analyzes the software to improve or implement that process. Gathers and catalogs functional, non-functional, and technical requirements for stakeholder requests. Analyzes functional and data requirements. Answers the questions: What does the software do and how does it store information? Assists users and development team with application testing and troubleshooting. Identifies, documents and troubleshoots application related problems. Documents process, procedures and workflows associated with applications. Creates and maintains training materials for end-users. Individual contributor.       An Analyst I is responsible for capturing and refining business and/or system requirements (based on specialization) that may or may not involve a software change. Key responsibilities include working with stakeholders to understand their needs, analyze problems, and capture their requirements, and then working closely with the Development Team to refine the requirement into specifications that can be executed by the team. They possess a foundational understanding of the business and/or technical domain based on their specialization. An Analyst I is an individual contributor to a team.  This is the EXCELLENT opportunity to take your career to a whole new level providing ways to work with high profile financial applications that are impacting cutting edge technology such as the evolving fraud landscape, the ever changing world of payments and the power to transact anywhere with CashPro Mobile. CashPro sits within the Global Markets organization and Global Transaction Services which provide liquidity management, payments and receipts, trade and supply chain finance, foreign exchange and commercial card services to small businesses, middle market companies, and to multinational corporations, financial institutions and governments around the world. This is an opportunity to work in a fast paced forward looking technology organization which continues to expand around the world and always be on the cutting edge of innovation.    Bank of America is seeking a Product Owner Analyst that will lead and design application based projects for an enterprise wide treasury and credit application. Must be able to understand very complex systems and utilize development patterns to develop key components in a clustered and multithreaded environment which is highly scalable with continued good performance. Must be self-driven, communicate well and work well on a team of other developers. Some projects may lead others or may be led depending upon project priorities and functionality. Must work with business to understand requirements and architecture leads to develop a strategic design and roadmap. Ultimately responsible for delivery of project into production.        1st shift (United States of America)    40 Show more
