Business Operations Analyst (602) The CCB Remediation and Corrections department works directly with multiple lines of business to correct harm to customers caused by a business or operational process break. The Business Analyst Team within this department plays a critical function in supporting the entire correction process including working together with Legal, Compliance and LOB stakeholders to identify a correction strategy, developing the impacted population with the Correction data analytics team as well as documenting how the correction steps were executed. Our team supports correction efforts for credit card operations. In order to excel as a Corrections Business Analyst, the individual should be a highly motivated individual able to work collaboratively across teams, an exceptional problem solver who owns customer issues from beginning to end and skilled at working multiple complex initiatives at one time. Core Responsibilities:                                       - Day to day management of correction case work and related activities - Collaborate with subject matter experts and correction peers to understand the break, how customers were impacted and what steps need to be taken to identify and correct customers. - Work with Data Analytics partners to drive development of the customer population through various data warehouses and any other data sources. - Accurately document how we execute each correction case including the steps taken to identify the population, any analytical or manual work performed and any additional reporting created to support execution activities (e.g. tax reporting). - Be the main point of contact for executing the case through the Corrections Quality Control process and owning the process for providing customers any corrective actions that need to occur, including but not limited to refunds, points adjustments, credit bureau impacts, and card terms and changes to terms, as well as any regulatory impacts. - Clearly articulate progress for population identification and execution activities to internal and external stakeholders as needed. - Develop or enhance correction execution procedures to address risks and/or increase efficiency Qualifications: - Proficiency with standard MS Office tools (Excel, Word, etc.) - Possess strong verbal and written communication skills, can communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. - Experience with leading meetings and collaborating with others of varying seniority levels - Direct experience working with the credit card processes, systems, and products - Ability to foster collaboration and information sharing to ensure efficient execution - Strong time-management skills - Ability to think critically and problem solve - Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with stakeholders internal and external to our department - Understanding of relational databases, data warehouses and data analytic tools (SQL and/or SAS) Show more

The Operations Business Analyst supports the line of business by performing complex operational and analytic tasks including reviewing report performance data, performance against established metrics and account. Works with the business to define reporting requirements and analysis of data to assist the business in meeting operational objectives. Partners with the business to increase focus on drivers of productivity, quality, and efficiency. Interprets results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to more complex data mining independently. Analysis focus is on process improvement and in some cases compliance with internal or external audit. Partner with seasoned analysts in developing complex reporting and in creating presentations for all levels of management with clear, concise, and easy to understand graphics that outlines the data for various levels of management. Partner with business contacts to develop and document requirements for operational reports and will participate with more seasoned analysts in creating and recommendations of reporting solutions to meet the need of the business. Designs, develops, implements and maintains business controls and solutions ensuring compliance with Regulatory requirements, including Chase policy. Works directly with project and business leaders to identify analytical requirements and address report gaps. Familiar with a variety of mortgaging servicing concepts, practices and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks with limited supervision. Core Competencies: - Delivering Results – Strive to set and understand goals and work to reach short-term goals and support long-term strategy. - Communication - Share information, concepts and opinions with others that results in clear understanding and desired outcome. Also, the ability to answer complex inquiries, provide information, consult with customers and manage difficult customer interactions - Problem Solving -Identifies business issues which require an analytical solution, utilizes business knowledge to identify the root cause of business issues and to propose solutions - Organization and Data Analytics: demonstrating the ability to understand concepts and analyze data; understanding business principles. - Technical Knowledge: Performs advanced technical tasks, using tools such as Excel. Has advanced familiarity with internal technology systems. - Ability to Learn and Follow Procedures: Demonstrates the ability to learn and apply a series of steps, rules, or guidelines needed to perform a specific task, responsibility, or role. Duties and Responsibilities: - Develops and communicates solutions for the line of business by effectively gathering, compiling and reviewing information and data, evaluating existing systems and procedures, identifying alternate courses of actions, development of tools and/or improvements. - Individually solves business problems and completes analysis. Performs advanced functions to provide performance information to LOB leaders. - Work with business to define reporting requirements and analysis needs to help drive performance or meet various operational needs - Create reporting and interpret results and convey in a concise, straight-forward, and professional manner for all levels of operational staff from supervisors to senior level management. - Create presentations for all levels of management. Need to provide clear, concise, and easy to understand graphics that easily depict the information trying to relay. - Leads tasks/projects end to end to identify all potential problems and how to solve for them. Articulates issues and risks to management. Provides support to department to ensure timely completion. - Develop, test, implement, and maintain reporting (regular production and ad-hoc) that enables data driven business decisions. - Assure the integrity of data through automated extraction, manipulation, processing, analysis, and reporting - Partner with Data Infrastructure team and business owners to implement new data sources and ensure consistent definitions are used in reporting and analytics - Develop partnerships with key operational site management to ensure effective analytical support for the operations organization - Work with Site to develop an Action Plan, track and communicate results against the plan - Identify data process improvements and leverage technology to automate and streamline existing processes - Evaluate as-is processes, identify gaps, risks and recommend solutions that clearly add value to customer experience   Qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Math, Business Administration, Computer Science, or related discipline strongly preferred. - One to three years of prior experience in mortgage banking preferred. - Strong Microsoft Excel skills - 3-5 years experience working management reporting and performance analysis techniques strongly preferred - Demonstrated, in-depth knowledge of Loan Operations knowledge of Chase systems. - Exposure to and ability to learn basic database concepts and ad-hoc data query basics - Demonstrated ability to work as team player, and to develop alternative solutions to complex problems, think outside the box, and recommend the best solution - Detail oriented with strong organizational skills; ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize work efforts - Able to communicate effectively to an audience including all levels of LOB leadership - Develops partnerships with team members and peers. - Ability to operate in a collaborative and cooperative environment, and must possess the strong interpersonal skills necessary to work effectively with colleagues at various levels of the organization. - Ability to plan, organize, and guide a project from inception through multiple timeline milestones all the way to completion. - Proficiency within the Microsoft Office suite MS Access, PowerPoint, Excel functions including pivot tables, charts, embedded queries, macros and Visual Basic. - Strong oral and written communication skills. Expresses thoughts and ideas clearly and concisely - Independent logical problem solver; analytical ability to synthesize data and project outcomes. - Maintains the highest standards of honesty, fairness and ethics. Will be exposed to confidential information. - Keeps others informed of key business information, issues decisions and action. - Adapts well to increasing scope and complexity of work brought on by business growth. Show more

Job Description  Production Services Analyst is typically an entry level position responsible for the execution of the day to day operational technology platform. Work activities specific to Production Services roles include Problem/Incident Management, Release/Deployment, Operational Readiness, Capacity/Availability Management, Application Monitoring, Service Analytics and Reporting, Production Governance, Triage, Associate Support, Change/Configuration Management, etc. The Production Services Analyst identifies possible production failure scenarios, creates incident tickets, enhancements and/or problem tickets in ticket tracking system, and communicates effectively with development and internal business operations teams. Identifies vulnerabilities and opportunities for improvement, as well as maintain metrics to help develop analysis that will drive improvement in all areas of Production Services. Creates and enhances administrative, operational and technical policies and procedures, adopting best practice guidelines, standards and procedures. Takes ownership of escalations and perform trouble shooting, analysis, research and resolution using advanced query and programming skills. Performs analytical, technical, and administrative work in planning, installing, designing and supporting new and existing equipment and software under moderate supervision. Resolves less complex issues. Consults with end users to determine optimal configuration of equipment and applications. Works on problems of minimal scope where analysis of situation or data requires a review of identifiable factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Should have awareness and exposure to basic technical principles, concepts and techniques. Competent to work under supervision on less complex systems issues, in some cases working from documentation. Limited responsibility. Limited knowledge of business or function for which system is designed. Follows standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained.                1st shift (United States of America)    40 Show more

The Analyst serves as the Product Owner for maintaining Agile Best Practices and Standards and Agile Training Materials, and is responsible for engaging with stakeholders to determine needs of the business and communicating and translating these to the delivery team in the form of Features and User Stories for the Agile CoE Team. In-depth knowledge in information systems and ability to identify, apply, and implement best practices. Understanding of key business processes and competitive strategies related to the IT function. Ability to plan and manage projects. Ability to solve complex problems by applying best practices. Ability to provide direction and mentor less experienced teammates. Ability to interpret and convey complex, difficult, or sensitive information.          Thank you for your interest in Truist! Job Description  Leads and/or participates in the design, development, and implementation of complex system engineering activities involving cross-functional technical support, systems programming and data center capabilities. Responsible for components of highly complex engineering and/or analytical tasks and activities. Establishes input/output processes and working parameters for hardware/software compatibility, coordination of subsystems design, and integration of total system. Viewed as a technology subject matter expert; able to provide and communicate complex technology solutions across differing audiences including technical, managerial, business executives, and/or vendors. Will have responsibility for multiple, complex projects; will direct activities of teams related to special initiatives or operations and may have direct reports. Leads the resolution process for complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Exercises judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criterion for obtaining results. Information Technology degree and/or technology certifications preferred or substantial equivalent experience. Typically 7-10 years of IT experience.    The IT Service Stability and Performance Management Lead is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) focused on IT system performance and stability of externally hosted services integrated with BofA's environment. She or he will liaison business, technical organizations, and vendors; independently providing consultation services following ITIL Service Operation framework processes and best practices for the following areas: Change Management; Post Incident Problem Management; system stability and resiliency; and disaster recovery activities. She or he will act as a consultant during system design assessments, and review service hosting environments to identify weaknesses with IT system resiliency and high availability designs. Concentration will be on integrity of operational processes igh-Availability designs used by vendors, identifying gaps, and independently driving implementation of mitigating solutions. As a SME you will also provide consulting expertise to internal technology and business groups, creating solid written business cases and delivering presentations to senior leaders that propose recommended solutions and process improvements when needed to achieve greater overall system stability and resiliency.          1st shift (United States of America)    40 Show more

JP Morgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), a financial holding company incorporated under Delaware law in 1968, is a leading global financial services firm and one of the largest banking institutions in the United States of America (“U.S.”), with operations worldwide; JPMorgan Chase had $2.6 trillion in assets and $256.6 billion in stockholders’ equity as of December 31, 2018.  The Firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small businesses, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  Under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands, the Firm serves millions of customers in the U.S. and globally many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients. Firmwide Risk Management is overseen and managed on an enterprise-wide basis. The Firm’s risk management governance and oversite framework involves understanding drivers of risks, types of risks, and impacts of risks. Within the broader Risk organization, the Wholesale Risk Chief Data Office (WR CDO) is responsible for developing a best-in-class data management function across the Risk organization, including various critical business initiatives (CCAR, Basel, etc.). Through partnerships with Firmwide Data Management (FDM), Business, Operations, and Technology stakeholders, the team is responsible for defining and executing on the overall data governance and data management strategy across Wholesale Risk Management. As a WR CDO Analyst, the ideal candidate will contribute to the delivery of strategic initiatives across both the Risk CDO organization and Firmwide Data Management. Core responsibilities include, but are not limited to: ·         Supporting the Data Landscape effort affecting various Risk Management functions through data-centric analysis of Risk applications and related business processes and data flows ·         Assisting with the documentation of a Wholesale Risk Chief Data Office Operating procedures to ensure and evidence adherence to Firmwide data management policy and data quality operating model ·         Producing metrics that demonstrate progress against objectives ·         Maintaining strong working relationships with other members of the WR CDO team other Risk Management colleagues, other CDO groups, Data Content Owners (DCO’s)   Experience ·         Bachelor’s degree required; Finance related degree preferred ·         1-3 years of demonstrated experience related to Data management / Risk management or middle office; business analysis and project management experience a plus ·         Strong data analysis and interpretation skills; analyzing data with respect to corresponding business and technology processes; software/application development experience a plus ·         Excellent ability to quickly learn and assimilate business and technical knowledge ·         Strong organizational skills and ability to carry out multiple streams of work concurrently in a flexible, fast paced environment ·         Must be detail oriented, highly responsible and able to work with tight deadlines ·         Excellent written and verbal communication skills ·         Strong analytical and problem solving skills; sound and independent judgment   Technical ·         Overall strong desktop skills including Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and other Office applications  ·         Understanding of concepts and hands-on experience working with relational databases and SQL; experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, Alteryx is helpful Show more

Wells Fargo Technology is a team of more than 40,000 information technology and security professionals who help keep Wells Fargo at the forefront of America's diversified financial services companies. Employees execute an engineering-led IT strategy to deliver stable, secure, scalable and innovative services that provide Wells Fargo global customers ‘round-the-clock' banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels. Wells Fargo Technology plays a critical role in the company's customer and employee experience, business and risk management transformation, and growth agenda.  The Systems Operations Engineer is a senior analyst position that will provide technical solutions for the Consumer Lending Business Technology platform and help innovate processes and capabilities that will make the platform more resilient and efficient. Successful team member will analyze and resolve complex issues in a high visibility distributed JAVA/J2EE and .NET based middleware platform. The resource will actively interact with development and various technical partner teams, vendors, as well as internal and external business partners. As a Senior resource on the Platform Management team, he/she will evaluate and recommend enhancements/changes to existing processes.  Candidate must have strong application support experience and have an understanding of various middleware technologies. Familiarity with various database, NAS, and network systems is also highly desired. The ability to take initiative, problem solve, and lead high visibility fast-paced efforts (while effectively communicating to technical and senior leaders) is a must. The candidate must have strong verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to multi-task and analyze complex issues in critical situations. As a senior resource within the team, this individual will mentor junior team members. The ability to work in a positive and collaborative manner, within a large virtual team setting, is crucial. A proactive mindset (combined with a willingness to learn new processes and tools) is vital to this role.             83 Wooster Hts - Danbury, CT 550 South 4th St - Minneapolis, MN 2700 S Price Rd - Chandler, AZ    All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Goldman Sachs Personal Financial Management (GS PFM) specializes in creating personalized wealth management plans for affluent individuals and families. We give clients clarity, confidence and control over their financial decisions. Our dedicated team of advisors across approximately 100 offices throughout the U.S., develops and implements personalized plans tailored to each client's values and life goals. Our advisors offer an investment platform inclusive of products and services offered by Goldman Sachs and other third parties, including private banking and lending offerings. We consider the relationships with our clients a lifelong partnership, a partnership backed by over 150 years of Goldman Sachs providing consistency, perspective and access as our clients’ needs evolve.                            The Consumer and Investment Management Division includes Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM), Private Wealth Management (PWM) and our Consumer business (Marcus by Goldman Sachs). We provide asset management, wealth management and banking expertise to consumers and institutions around the world. CIMD partners with various teams across the firm to help individuals and institutions navigate changing markets and take control of their financial lives.    At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. External Regulatory Risk Reporting – Analyst  External Regulatory Risk Reporting group is responsible for firm-wide risk reporting and analysis in support of critical regulatory requirements to the Federal Reserve Board (FRB), Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), and the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council (FFIEC). The Risk Reporting Senior Analyst will have the opportunity to support a host of critical and dynamic deliverables for the Firm. As part of the External Risk Reporting team, the ideal candidate will work closely with Risk and Finance groups within the firm, as well as line of business credit and financial teams.   Successful candidates will drive process improvements, strengthen controls, improve data quality, and reduce cycle time.   Roles & Responsibilities: As an External Risk Reporting Senior Analyst the ideal candidate will: - Have the opportunity report and monitor of the Legal lending Limits process for the firm, critical to JPMC compliance with the 12 CFR regulations and liaise with Credit Executives in support of exposure limits  - Work on the new Single Credit Counterparty Limit Reporting and Monitoring Federal Reserve guidelines, including analytical review and preparation of the quarterly report.  This role will include working with various teams in the bank such as Credit Risk, Finance, Legal, Policy, Technology, and reporting teams  - Prepare and analyze the Top 50 Counterparty Reports for the Firm, working with Credit Executives.  - Have a marked impact on strategic process improvement through the identification, tracking, and resolution of data quality issues.    Qualifications/Skills: - Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or other relevant discipline - Ability to understand business drivers and requirements and influence partners to deliver solutions to business issues and problems - Strong analytical and financial skills with a proven track record of execution - Acute attention to detail and control driven mindset - Strong communications skills both written and verbal - A developed leadership presence capable of effective messaging to colleagues, regulators and management alike. - Ability to work on multiple priorities at the same time within tight deadlines, demonstrating excellent organizational skills - Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Excel; Access & PowerPoint) and with large amounts of data - Strong team player who can work well and build partnerships with colleagues of various levels, across multiple locations - Knowledge of Alteryx is a plus Show more

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Wells Fargo Technology is a team of more than 40,000 information technology and security professionals who help keep Wells Fargo at the forefront of America's diversified financial services companies. Employees execute an engineering-led IT strategy to deliver stable, secure, scalable and innovative services that provide Wells Fargo global customers ‘round-the-clock' banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels. Wells Fargo Technology plays a critical role in the company's customer and employee experience, business and risk management transformation, and growth agenda.  The Systems Operations Engineer is a senior analyst position that will provide technical solutions for the Consumer Lending Business Technology platform and help innovate processes and capabilities that will make the platform more resilient and efficient. Successful team member will analyze and resolve complex issues in a high visibility distributed JAVA/J2EE and .NET based middleware platform. The resource will actively interact with development and various technical partner teams, vendors, as well as internal and external business partners. As a Senior resource on the Platform Management team, he/she will evaluate and recommend enhancements/changes to existing processes.  Candidate must have strong application support experience and have an understanding of various middleware technologies. Familiarity with various database, NAS, and network systems is also highly desired. The ability to take initiative, problem solve, and lead high visibility fast-paced efforts (while effectively communicating to technical and senior leaders) is a must. The candidate must have strong verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to multi-task and analyze complex issues in critical situations. As a senior resource within the team, this individual will mentor junior team members. The ability to work in a positive and collaborative manner, within a large virtual team setting, is crucial. A proactive mindset (combined with a willingness to learn new processes and tools) is vital to this role.             83 Wooster Hts - Danbury, CT 550 South 4th St - Minneapolis, MN 2700 S Price Rd - Chandler, AZ    All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Asset Management - Financial & Business Analysis (Product Support) – Associate  J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, with client assets of $3.4 trillion, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. Its clients include institutions, high-net-worth individuals and retail investors in every major market throughout the world. The division offers investment management across all major asset classes including equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset and money market funds. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits.  Job Description: We are looking for a candidate to join the Finance team in Plano supporting the various product desks in our Asset Management (AM) division.  The team is responsible for providing value added financial reporting, planning/forecasting and analysis to help our product desks to improve financial performance, achieve key business priorities and make informed decisions.  The product desks supported include equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset solutions, and liquidity. The role will involve ownership of the various tasks and projects listed below, and will give you a broad exposure to the business drivers of the Asset Management business.  You will work closely with the Product CFOs and broader Financial Planning & Analysis team, but also will be expected to interact with peers and business leaders in the product desks and other areas as necessary. The key responsibilities of the role include: - Produce weekly/monthly/quarterly/adhoc reporting of the results and drivers for senior management, and prepare materials for business reviews and other presentations. - Perform variance analysis to understand the key drivers of the results and provide commentary explaining changes from prior forecasts/budgets. - Review and analyze the results of the AM activity based costing model and suggest areas where expense efficiencies could be achieved. - Partner with desk heads and investment specialist heads to produce and develop metrics to measure performance of their teams. - Enhance controls and streamline processes, introducing automation where possible. - Work on projects to drive global consistency and create synergies across the team. An example would be developing a new pricing tool that can be used for all products. Qualifications: - BA/BS in Finance, Economics, Accounting or other related area (CFA, CPA, MBA a plus). - Minimum of 2+ years of relevant Financial Services experience. - Strong technical and analytical skills, including proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, Essbase, and other financial applications; experience with Tableau or Qlikview a plus. - Inquisitive, enthusiastic and diligent, and capable of challenging peers. - Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex issues clearly. - Highly motivated and able to maintain composure in a fast-paced environment and prioritize projects accordingly. - Desire and ability to understand and effectively utilize MIS reporting systems - Integrity in handling highly sensitive and confidential information. - Knowledge and understanding of financial principles and ability to link results to activities - Team player with the ability to be respected as a trusted partner for the Business, Finance, and F&BA Teams. Show more

Business Management optimizes business performances by helping to drive key initiatives. We act as trusted advisors and counterweight to Business/Group Heads and are responsible for identifying, escalating, and mitigating business risks. The role of a business manager is dynamic and can vary from business to business, in line with the priorities of the different lines of business. As an analyst in Business Management you would be expected to: - Provide a high level of responsiveness to executive ad-hoc requests related to project management, presentation development, and business analysis - Organize complex information in a strategic and compelling way, demonstrating strong design acumen and expertise in Excel and PowerPoint techniques. Create wireframes and mock-ups quickly and iteratively for management presentations, reports, and dashboards - Communicate effectively with key business partners to understand projects and drive next steps - Coordinate team activities and prepare materials for town halls, employee recognition, and strategy working sessions - Collect and maintain internal resources and documentation on collaboration sites, like SharePoint - Participate in collaborative initiatives with team members and global managers, looking for ways to continually simplify, improve, and add value to existing business processes Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or other related area - Proven experience delivering timely, high quality presentations and/or reporting for various projects and stakeholders. Attention to detail is a must with continuous focus on design excellence - Excellent organization and project management skills - Ability to articulate and demonstrate thoughtful rationale in design decisions - Intermediate-level ability expected in all MS Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Pivot Tables) - Self-motivated, tenacious and able to work with high degree of independence - Excellent written and oral communication skills - Highly motivated self-starter with excellent time management/prioritization skills Show more

As a member of our Business Analysis team, you'll play a crucial role in identifying, improving and developing technology solutions that drive our strategic goals. This is a tremendous opportunity to learn about high-priority initiatives and collaborate with colleagues throughout the firm. Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll sharpen your understanding of business processes, vendor solutions configurations and data analysis, while continuing to develop your leadership, management and communication skills. No matter where your career ultimately takes you, you'll make a meaningful impact and lasting connections with outstanding colleagues and mentors. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: - BS/BA degree or equivalent experience - A strong understanding of at least one business function in the firm, as well as a broader understanding of other areas. - Proficiency in business applications, data usage and management - Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JS, SQL; or willingness to learn and become proficient - Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team. - Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals - 5+ years of experience as an IT Business Analyst/QA Analyst or Solutions Engineer, including experience interfacing with technical and business stakeholders within multiple lines of business, gathering and analyzing requirements, creating data models, defining and establishing process, reviewing/understanding tasks in project plans, configuring vendor solutions and managing multiple simultaneous assignments. - 5+ years of experience working within and interfacing with Business, QA, and Application Development teams. Implementation of systems using Agile is a plus.  Experience in the implementation of IT Solutions and overall knowledge of Infrastructure and System Architecture, Data Management, Applications Development, Systems Integration and SQL. Proven ability to analyze complex processes and systems. Strong experience/understanding of business process reengineering and business modeling concepts. - Proven experience working in projects based on 3rd Party vendor solutions and custom development applications. Strong experience with Third Party Software Configuration.  - Tririga implementation experience is desired. Tririga implementation responsibilities include Tririga configurations, creation and maintenance of Objects, Forms, Workflows, etc. Show more

As an experienced professional in Business Analysis, you'll shape the technology solutions that drive strategic initiatives across the firm. Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll interact with colleagues in various lines of businesses to learn about challenges and opportunities, and translate that insight into high-quality solutions. In addition to working with the development team to create new solutions, you'll help optimize existing technology and identify new capabilities. While your role requires deep technological skills – including expertise in everything from data management to functional design – it also hinges on teamwork and leadership. You'll offer clear guidance and feedback to your Business Analysis colleagues, while promoting the values, culture, and brand of JPMorgan Chase & Co. The role will be part of J.P. Morgan’s global technology team supporting Digital Investment Banking and aims to rapidly create products to improve business efficiency, generate new insights to drive client discussion and eventually support new revenue generation. The individual will work in partnership with product managers, business analysts, UI/UX engineers, data engineers & software engineers across the globe spanning multiple skillsets and backgrounds. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: - BS/BA degree or equivalent experience - Advanced knowledge of business processes and data analysis, as well as the ability to construct complex data queries and collaborate with colleagues - Ability to liaison between lines of business and development teams, translating strategic goals into technology solutions, and vice versa - Experience in project management, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource planning - Understanding of business needs, including how data is used and managed, and functional design - Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals - Must have prior experience working on UI/UX projects, ideally those involving analytics and business intelligence.   Responsibilities: - Define tools, screens and applications, plan, execute, and deliver.  - Partner with a multi-disciplinary team of Technologists, Data Scientists, Bankers, and UI/UX designers to create transformative technology products. - Manage the priorities, deliverables, and banker buy-in and adoption including leading stakeholder management and communication. - Define and execute the banking analytics strategy, which includes delivery of clear, reliable performance metrics, deriving actionable insight from complex business data, and leveraging data to understand and improve business capabilities and processes for Sales. - Coordinate across numerous constituencies to gain consensus, mediate conflicts through ‘air traffic control’ and develop innovative, efficient, competitive approaches to issues. - Analyze existing capabilities and identify priority gaps and opportunities. - Prioritize needs and investments based upon relationship insight, competitive positioning and industry research. - Drive actionable and implementable strategies that produce tangible results. Given the critical role JPMC plays in the world economy, resiliency remains a key area of focus for the firm. The Firmwide Business Resiliency (FBR) group within the Chief Administrative Office is responsible for ensuring the adequacy of the Firmwide Resiliency Program in the event of disruptive events.  Working with key business and support partners, the team is responsible for providing corporate governance, awareness and training. In addition, strategic and decision support is provided for the various business activities as well as long term initiatives. We are seeking a Product Analyst to support our ever expanding book of work.  The ideal candidate will have prior experience analyzing requirements, writing user stories, and participating in the product development life cycle from Discovery through production release.    The Business Resiliency Product Analyst will report to the Delivery Manager for Resiliency Technology Product Management. Key Responsibilities: - Analyze product roadmaps, epics, and wireframes to develop master story lists. - Partner with tech teams and business stakeholders to translate wireframes and high level requirements into stories are clearly defined with specific acceptance criteria and delivered on time. - Effectively collaborate with technology partners to build best in class solutions - Recommend functional prioritization of features for development to provide incremental value - Actively participate in Discovery and Refinement sessions with stakeholders to determine future requirements. - Perform UAT testing, production go live activities, and transition functional support information to operations. - Grow subject matter expertise in Firmwide Resiliency processes and practices. Qualifications: - BS/BA degree or equivalent experience - Experience working with agile practices and tools (Jira, Confluence) - Demonstrated experience in analyzing processes and translating high level requirements into detailed stories - Effective communication skills - Detail oriented, strong analytical/problem solving skills - Self-driven with ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as on a team Show more

J.P.Morgan Private Investments (JPMPI), which sits within the Corporate line of business, brings together the Strategic and Heritage Private Equity Investing activities of the firm into a single center of investing excellence. JPMPI has approximately 40 professionals (both Front Office and Finance and Business Management) located in New York, Chicago, Newark, London and Hong Kong.   Strategic Investments acts as a service provider to the Lines of Business and Corporate. It is a central resource to help identify, diligence, structure, negotiate, close, monitor and divest investments.  Finance team oversees fund and partnership accounting, distribution management, treasury services, tax support services, waterfall/carry calculations, financial and regulatory reporting, and corporate entity administration and domiciliation services.   The JPMPI Analyst will work closely with the Controller and coordinate with members of the Strategic Investment Finance and Business Management teams.  Key activities include review of monthly investment activity, prospective monitoring of deal pipeline, and ensuring relevant information is communicated between investment professionals, middle office and relevant LOB controllers.   Responsibilities: ·         Track monthly investment activity and assist with review process to feed management reporting systems ·         Develop and perform monthly reconciliations to ensure data integrity for management and financial reporting ·         Coordinate with team to ensure relevant investment updates are communicated between front office and back office teams ·         Assist with management of corporate approval process for all investment activity ·         Provide analysis and insight on investment portfolio to individuals in accounting policy, valuation control group, principal risk and corporate tax as needed ·         Assist with month-end general ledger close activities and quarter-end reporting requitments ·         Assist with monitoring and updating of legal entity information in the centralized system ·         Assist in preparation and review of quarterly portfolio review ·         Assist with ad hoc projects   Qualifications: ·         Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance ·         Up to five years of business experience ·         Ability to manage multiple projects effectively and adjust priorities as needed ·         Detail oriented and extremely organized ·         Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills ·         Effective interpersonal skills with ability to work with people at all levels ·         Ability to work independently and manage time effectively ·         Excellent verbal and written communication skills ·         Proficient in Excel Show more

Organization Description   Our professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we’re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.   Global Real Estate (GRE) is organized to efficiently provide global functional expertise with local implementation. Teams manage the firm's real estate assets and investments in addition to delivering workplaces that enable the firm’s businesses, employees, clients and customers to thrive. The core groups include Regional Real Estate, Portfolio Management, Global Design & Construction and Retail Real Estate.   Employer Description   JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.   We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.   Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans   Job Description   The Business Systems Administration (BSA) group is part of the overall Global Real Estate (GRE) Space Management organization.  The GRE BSA team function is comprised of GRE and Program Management professionals who are responsible for partnering with leadership to achieve GRE’s systemic platform objectives for ongoing support and management of GRE data.  GRE Space Management key data elements consist of property data including building, floor, space, space assignments, mail codes, and occupancy allocation detail.       Key Responsibilities   Will lead all efforts involving gathering business requirements and translating into systemic design enhancements.  This will include, but is not limited to: - Analysis and review of high-level requirements as defined in the Business Requirements  - Strategically assess if the business requirement can be solutioned through existing technology or if a new enhancement should be deployed  - Assess which GRE platform would be the optimal space for a business requirement to be deployed  - Lead and coordinate business requirement gathering working sessions  - Document business requirements and scenarios for business use cases  - Provide guidance to the business to assist in gathering all the correct information for design  - Document requirements in the form of a JIRA story  - Work with technology to groom the story for development  - Attend working sessions with the UAT lead to draft test scripts based on business requirements  - Review of detailed specifications as defined in the Functional Specifications Document  - Review of change requests by verifying all supporting documentation, approvals from all respective internal business partners and vendors  - Collaborates with internal team, technology, and business partners to ensure all information required for an enhancement is gathered and documented appropriately for technology to start development  - Work with the program lead to assist in defining business priority    Leadership:   - Networks effectively with peers and senior leadership  - Escalates and reaches out for assistance appropriately  - Excellent organizational, product management, problem solving, and decision making skills  - Ability to work independently and make efficient judgement calls  - Willing and able to step up to take on additional responsibilities with an open mind  - Sets high standards for self  - Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment    Business Results:   - Drives for results; strong accountability  - Escalates issues quickly and helps to resolve; solution focused  - Strong analytical and problem solving skills  - Thinks outside the box and acts with a sense of urgency  - Strong attention to detail and analysis of upstream and downstream impacts  - Proven ability to proactively collaborate with the business and technology to ensure end to end quality of our applications    Soft Skills: - Positive can do attitude  - Excellent written and verbal communication skills  - Experience in presenting solutions in a fact based thought out manner  - Innovative ideas that are clear, concise, well organized  - The Loan Quality Review (LQR) Analyst will provide underwriting quality oversight by performing end-to-end reviews and evaluations of loan file underwriting decisions (Credit, Income, Assets, Debts and Collateral). Analysts provide timely, actionable feedback to the appropriate party on errors, concerns or trends on those loan level reviews.   Review volume may include, but is not limited to, live underwriting production for purposes of reviewing new underwriters attempting to obtain lending authority, closed production for purposes of quality oversight for delegated Correspondents, and other ad-hoc audits as requested by Channel or Oversight Management.    Business Description           LQR Analyst performs quality oversight of underwriting decisions through the review of files for accuracy of overall credit and collateral decisions.  The Analyst is responsible for delivering feedback, providing clear and concise descriptions of loan defects and articulating identifiable concerns and trends to management.    Core Competencies •             Analytical Thinking - Applies logic to solve problems and get the job done •             Strong Organizational Skills - Ability to manage time appropriately, set priorities and tasks accordingly •             Problem Solving skills – Must possess the ability to discover and analyze problems then seek to overcome obstacles to solve the issue •             Communication Skills - Strong verbal and written communication skills; strong ability to listen, present and clearly express key concepts •             Customer Focus – Must possess the ability to serve both the internal and external customer while at the same time safeguarding risk for Chase         Principal Duties and Responsibilities •             Performs pre-close and/or post-close reviews of files with defects to determine cause and potential remedy  •             Provides clear and concise descriptions of loan defects and cause, articulating identifiable trends and concerns to management •             Engages appropriate internal and external partners, as appropriate, to remedy deficiencies •             Performs reviews on live production, when dictated by policy and/or procedure, to support production underwriting.  Reviews may include lending authority submissions, random reviews dictated by policy based on Underwriting quality, loan exception reviews, and/or other files as referred by management •             Documents review findings, provides feedback to internal and external partners based on the type of file review and drive resolution, as appropriate •             Performs second review of declined files, when dictated by procedure, to ensure accuracy of decision and initiate steps to remedy underwriting errors •             Performs tracking of quality performance and prepare reports as directed by management or procedure •             Acts a subject matter expert in policies and procedures Knowledge and Experience: - Minimum 5 years in frontline mortgage underwriting required - College Degree preferred - Excellent negotiation, analytical, and decision making skills - Strong verbal and written communication skills - Thorough knowledge of Chase credit policies, products, and guidelines; agency products and guidelinesand private investor products and guidelines - Expert in personal business financial analysis and in tax returns and balannce sheet analysis, including both cash flow and AGI methods - VA and FHA experience a plus - Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Powerpoint preferred  Show more

Company Description J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world's most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With more than $18 trillion of assets under custody and $390+ billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.   Project Description Post Trade Technology is one of the main pillars of the Corporate & Investment Bank’s Technology group, managing billions of transactions for the wholesale business and are responsible for post trade Clearing, Settlement, Margin & Collateral Management, securities processing, finance and accounting. Post trade is also responsible to perform Analytics on data and providing meaningful MIS for front office, middle office, Back office, regulatory and various other divisions for the firm.   The Post Trade Functional Architecture team’s role is critical in defining and aligning the platforms built within post-trade technology to the business functions it serves. Key objectives include: - Consolidating platforms and standardizing components to simplify the stack and enable reuse -  Consolidating multiple stores of the same data, reducing reconciliations - Aligning and centralizing functionality across business and asset classes where possible -  Enabling externalization capabilities for client self-service   Job Description   The Functional Architect / Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for driving large scale and comprehensive functionally-based solutions, aligning key business functions across various lines of business to singular platform solutions. As part of this role, the senior Functional Architect / Business Analyst will partner with senior members across various business domains as well as technology teams to gather functional and business requirements, analyze complex and nuanced current and target state data flows, operating models and platforms, and synthesize the information captured into tangible technology-based solutions and proposals which are understandable to both business and technology teams.   The successful candidate will have a strong background of understanding the end to end lifecycle (e.g. order management and execution, risk management, trade capture, settlements, confirmations, position-keeping, accounting, regulatory requirements) across multiple financial products (Cash Equities / Fixed Income, Cleared / Non-cleared Derivatives, FX etc.). The successful candidate will also be a hands-on SME with a proven track record of working of large-scale technology-based solutions within the investment banking space.  The ability to bridge the gap between business and technology is paramount in this role, to drive the business forward in meeting their objectives through technology-based solutions.   Responsibilities - Partner with multiple Operations, Finance & Technology leads globally to solve and provide E2E functional architecture solutions - Gather functional / business requirements, perform detailed analysis alongside Operations and Finance - Synthesize functions / business requirements and working alongside Technology teams to translate those requirements into high-level data and Technology platform selection choices - Build out a business function inventory with available associated platforms available, and identification of any gaps - Provide regular updates to senior management in Operations, Finance and Technology   Qualifications - Strong background of understanding the end to end lifecycle (e.g. order management and execution, risk management, trade capture, settlements, confirmations, position-keeping, accounting, regulatory requirements) across multiple financial products (Cash Equities / Fixed Income, Cleared / non-cleared Derivatives, FX etc.). - Ability to clearly define and articulate business requirements. - Excellent written, verbal and presentation communication skills - Confidence in communicating internally at all levels; candidate will be dealing with Operations, Finance and Technology teams on a daily basis who are both business and technically sophisticated - Ability to coherently construct and present business requirements and solution based on input from various sources - Excellent analytical/problem-solving skills - Strong project management skills - Experience and/or willing to be involved in the technical details (Sybase, Java, Python, XML, FIX) both in terms of analysis, modelling and problem solving. Proactive, self-motivated and flexible with a positive attitude - Excellent team-working skills - Strong time management skills; efficient at multi-tasking and able to work under pressure to deliver multiple business demands on-time, to a high-level standard - Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology and Project Management and or working knowledge in related field, or an equivalent work experience - 7+ years’ experience in Financial Services industry, preferably in investment banking and specifically in brokerage / operations and finance areas. Corporate Finance: FAIR Organization; GLA – Associate   Requisition #: Location: Newark, DE Job Category: Corporate Staff   The Firmwide Financial Accounting & Reporting organization (FAIR) is responsible for the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of the Firm’s financial results – books and records, while providing financial reporting to both internal and external clients.   The FAIR organization closely examines the general ledger, operating systems and infrastructure controls across the entire lifecycle of the business to ensure the firm’s financial information is accurately depicted for reporting and regulation purposes. This financial information is used by external analysts to assess the firm’s financial position; by management to make sound financial decisions; by investors to make informed decisions; and by regulators to supervise and examine the firm appropriately.   The most common functions and activities owned by Firmwide Financial Accounting and Reporting include but are not limited to the following: financial analysis, financial consolidation, reporting, balance sheet reconciliation/certification/substantiation, general ledger reconciliation reporting & governance, inter-entity control and governance, suspense analysis and clearing, manual accounting/bookings to the general ledger and operating systems, and execution of the month end financial close process.   The Financial Accounting and Reporting Analyst will be required to work closely with the line of business controllers, Legal Entity Controllers and other key business partners.    Primary Responsibilities of an Analyst will include, but are not limited to:   GLA Reporting - Responsible for ensuring the accuracy and validity of line of business general ledger accounts; including adherence to the firmwide General Ledger Reconciliation & Substantiation (GLA) standards - Ensure adherence to P&L and Balance Sheet controls owned by Financial Control; including identifying  and implementing opportunities for efficiency - Analyze, communicate and resolves material variances between the general ledger and upstream systems; as defined by line of business - Understand business drivers in a short span of time with minimal information - Perform variance analysis and research, produce metrics and related reporting to review with senior managers with a clear understanding of the issues and path to resolution.   Skills: - Strong analytical skills, able to evaluate and identify root cause of issues, provide tactical solutions to remediate in short time frames - Strong excel skills, able to manage large data sets, compile findings in a user friendly format; familiarity with Alteryx (green belt preferred), technical skills to build new reporting to automate existing processes - Strong communication, ability to articulate key messages around issues or trends to management - Organized and self-motivated, able to follow through on directives and can self-manage time effectively - Ability to partner with numerous technology, operations, and business teams to collaborate on improving ops models and efficiencies - Comfortable challenging existing processes and implement change - Knowledge of GAAP accounting standards - Basic understanding of General ledger; prior exposure to relevant function an added advantage - Basic accounting and finance skills preferred - Ability to work and multi-task in a fast paced, sometimes high pressure environment - Ability to balance multiple priorities and execute in a constantly changing environment - Basic knowledge of financial products and services - Able to critically challenge all processes, with the goal of identifying control issues and improving the control environment on an ongoing basis - Excellent attention to detailed sets of data   Required Experience: - Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business - Knowledge of SAP accounting system preferred - Experience with financial reporting systems such as Business Objects - Prior work experience of 4+years  - Fluency in both written and spoken English - Excellent desktop/spreadsheet/database skills - Familiar with industry standards and regulations - Knowledge of firm’s products and services Show more

CCB Data & Analytics:  The CCB Data & Analytics Team unifies data and analytics talent across Chase to responsibly leverage data to build competitive advantages for our businesses with value and protection for customers. J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, with client assets of $2.4 trillion, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits. The Tax Operations Analyst will be part of a team responsible for the tax data integrity of transactions processed within our accounting systems and the production of the 1099s, 1042S forms, and tax packages for our Wealth Management Clients. The Tax Operations Analyst is expected to have an understanding of the financial activity as it relates to tax withholding and reporting. A holistic understanding of the tax cost and reporting process as it relates to specific financial instruments. The Tax Operations Analyst is expected to assist the team with tax projects that impact our accounting system including system enhancements, transition of accounts from other platforms, new securities, and new services. Job Description Department Description   Firmwide Data Management (FDM) was created with the mission to help improve the quality, integrity and reliability of the firm’s critical data. Party Reference Data and Reference Data Strategy actively contribute to the firm’s efforts in growing the business, reducing costs, and ensuring regulatory compliance. The organization’s objectives are to explain the path that critical data follows, improve data quality, reduce ambiguity and inconsistent terminology, enhance transparency, rationalize the number of replicated data assets, and improve firmwide-sharing of information and best practices. To achieve all of this, FDM serves as the governing body to create firmwide standards that drive consistent data management practices, develop technologies and processes to support data management processes, partner with LOBs to embed data management best practices and capabilities, and ensure sustainability by refining, measuring, and improving the firm’s ability to manage data.   Background   The successful candidate will join the Reference Data Strategy team focused on driving business priorities and strategy. Strong partnerships with other global functional support areas are essential; these include technology, business support management, product business managers, legal, credit and various operational support teams. An ability to develop effective working relationships with partners, stakeholders, and senior management is critical; this role interacts with the leads across FDM, Lines of Business and Functional teams. Ability to support & adopt within a changing environment. - Strong time management skills; efficient at multi-tasking and able to work under pressure to deliver multiple business demands on-time, to a high-level standard This role provides an outstanding opportunity at JPMorgan Chase for the selected candidate to join a high profile team and take a partnership role, supporting one of the Bank’s most significant change programs. The business analyst – program manager is a key part of the product owner team, and will be responsible for driving initiatives in any of the following four areas of focus:  1. 2021 SECURITIES SERVICES LEADERSHIP PROGRAM- FULL-TIME Want to work in a global business that delivers value to clients with whom we maintain long-standing strategic relationships? Want to make meaningful contributions in a dynamic team environment early on, while developing your professional expertise? Join the first class of the Securities Services Summer Analyst Leadership Program. Securities Services is the engine of the trade lifecycle, serving the industry’s largest institutional investors and their investment strategies.  An end to end service model offers clients dedicated coverage and access to subject matter experts to address their evolving needs.  Securities Services bring a unique combination of complementary business that, while distinct, work together to provide a seamless experience for institutional investors. This program is designed to develop future leaders with a core understanding of the Securities Services business. You’ll have the opportunity to build your network, expand your professional skills and gain experience in a diverse environment.   What to Expect This two-year rotational program offers the opportunity to develop a comprehensive, end-to-end knowledge of the Securities Services business.  You’ll participate in three eight month rotations, covering areas such Client Service, Product Development, and Operations.  This program is designed to establish a strong foundation in the key disciplines of Securities Services so that you will be able to take on significant responsibilities and projects within the business upon completion of the program.   You will cultivate and hone new skills through an ongoing training curriculum, including specialized data literacy trainings, and all program analysts will participate in a 2 week bootcamp in New York.  You will have the unique opportunity to participate in leadership trainings designed for your analyst class.   You’ll make an Impact by ·         Developing your analytical, technical and leadership skills while gaining hands on project management experience during your rotations.  ·         Building relationships across different product and functional business areas ·         Being part of day-to-day project or client coverage teams that interact across a global organization ·         Working on deliverables directly aligned to strategic client needs and priorities   Locations you may join ·         Boston, MA ·         New York Metro   About you We’re looking for future leaders of the business, with the vision and initiative to develop solutions and drive change.  You should have a strong interest in finance, project management, emerging technologies, data governance and analytics, and use of digital tools to drive innovation.  Our business is constantly evolving so we rely on strong teams players who are proactive, responsive, and can thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. This role is not eligible for employer immigration sponsorship.  If you require immigration sponsorship after completing your degree, you do not meet the requirements of this role.    Key Attributes and Qualifications include ·         A well-rounded academic background – preferred minimum cumulative GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale ·         Pursuing a B.A., B.S., or 5th year M.A. or M.S., with an expected graduation date between October 2020 and February 2021 ·         All majors considered; finance, accounting, engineering or project management are a plus ·         Exceptional critical thinking and problem solving abilities ·         Excellent communication and interpersonal skills ·         Ability to collect & synthesize large amounts of detailed information, and use it to propose/deliver innovative solutions ·         Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative work environment ·         Working knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)   Join us At JPMorgan Chase, we’re creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you’re passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we’re looking for you.   What’s next? Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.     After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.    If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you’ll receive an email invitation to complete a series of 12 games through the Pymetrics platform. Pymetrics will allow you to showcase your potential beyond what you tell us in your resume and application form. It’s an additional data point that helps us gain a better understanding of who you are as an individual. It should take no longer than 25-35 minutes to complete. If you have already completed the Pymetrics games, you will have the opportunity to submit your gameplay results for this specific application without having to replay the games.   Following completion of Pymetrics, you’ll receive another email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.   Both Pymetrics and HireVue are required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed them. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.   JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.   Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.   ©2020 JPMorgan Chase & Co. Profil de l'entreprise  Morgan Stanley, chef de file mondial des services financiers, offre un large éventail de services bancaires d’investissement, d’opérations sur titres, de gestion de placements et de gestion de patrimoine. Les employés de la Société servent des clients du monde entier, notamment des entreprises, des gouvernements et des personnes à partir de plus de 1 200 bureaux dans 43 pays.  Le talent et l’enthousiasme de notre personnel sont vitaux pour un chef de file comme nous. Nous avons en commun un ensemble de valeurs caractérisées par l’intégrité, le souci de l’excellence et la rigueur des règles d’éthique appliquées par nos équipes. Morgan Stanley peut offrir un environnement supérieur pour bâtir une carrière professionnelle : un milieu où il est possible d’apprendre, d’accomplir et de progresser. L’équilibre entre le style de vie, les objectifs et les besoins de chacun est une philosophie au cœur de sa culture.  Contentieux et conformité  Le service du contentieux et de la conformité aide Morgan Stanley à atteindre ses objectifs commerciaux conformément aux valeurs fondamentales de la Société et aux principes de gestion des risques mondiaux en s’occupant de la gestion des risques relatifs aux affaires juridiques et réglementaires et des risques relatifs aux franchisés, en plus d’en assurer la surveillance.    Profil du service  Les professionnels du service du contentieux et de la conformité (SCC) fournissent un large éventail de services à nos unités d’exploitation. Ils peuvent aider à structurer une opération transfrontalière complexe et délicate, donner des conseils sur le lancement d’un nouveau produit, élaborer un programme de formation ou atténuer un différend avec un investisseur. Ils préservent la réputation d’intégrité inestimable de la Société et la protègent contre les sanctions au moyen de politiques et de procédures qui respectent les exigences réglementaires partout dans le monde. Ils s’efforcent également d’entretenir des relations de coopération avec les responsables des politiques gouvernementales et les organismes de réglementation et d’autoréglementation qui régissent les activités de la Société.  L’analyse de données est une fonction du service du contentieux et de la conformité responsable de la conception et de l’optimisation de modèles, d’approches et d’outils de surveillance à l’aide de techniques analytiques avancées comme l’apprentissage automatique (AA) supervisé et non supervisé, le traitement automatique du langage naturel (TLN) et de techniques en constante évolution comme l’apprentissage par renforcement et l’apprentissage profond ainsi que l’analyse de graphiques. Les outils, notamment ceux de surveillance, aident à détecter les comportements suspects et illégaux comme le blanchiment d’argent, la manipulation du marché, les délits d’initiés, les ventes ou pratiques commerciales déloyales et autres crimes financiers.  Principales responsabilités  – Travailler avec les membres des services des crimes financiers, de la conformité, du contentieux et des TI pour déceler, évaluer et gérer les risques en évaluant de vastes ensembles de données à l’aide de divers outils statistiques. – Formuler des recommandations pour améliorer les activités de contrôle et de test de la surveillance et de la conformité par l’élaboration de nouveaux modèles de risques, l’analyse statistique des seuils des modèles, les tests rétrospectifs et autres analyses de sensibilité et de performance. – Développer et améliorer les méthodologies statistiques et les modèles quantitatifs pour favoriser l’efficacité. – Appuyer les évaluations périodiques des risques par l’analyse d’éléments de données liés à des indicateurs potentiels de risque relatif au client, au produit ou à la région géographique et le repérage de nouveaux facteurs quantitatifs pouvant être intégrés dans le processus d’évaluation des risques. – Aider à la création d’indicateurs clés de risque et de performance à l’appui du programme de surveillance, de contrôle et de test.  Compétences requises  Compétences souhaitées  Connaissance du français et de l’anglais sont requis.  Morgan Stanley est un employeur offrant l’égalité professionnelle. Nous travaillons pour offrir un environnement de travail accueillant et favorable dans lequel toutes les personnes peuvent réaliser leur plein potentiel.  Dans ce document, l’emploi du masculin n’a d’autres fins que celle d’alléger le texte. Toutes personnes intéressées par ce poste sont invitées à soumettre leur candidature.    29 sept. 2020    Americas-United States of America-New York-New York    Autre    Temps plein Show more

The Firm's risk management governance and oversite framework involves understanding drivers of risks, types of risks, and impacts of risks.  Within the broader Risk organization, the Wholesale Risk Chief Data Office (WR CDO) is responsible for developing a best-in-class data management function across the Risk organization, including various critical business initiatives (CCAR, Basel, etc.). Through partnerships with Firmwide Data Management (FDM), Business, Operations, and Technology stakeholders, the team is responsible for defining and executing on the overall data governance and data management strategy across Wholesale Risk Management.  As a, the ideal candidate will contribute to the delivery of strategic initiatives across both the Risk CDO organization and Firmwide Data Management. Finance related degree preferred  • 1-3 years of demonstrated experience related to Data management / Risk management or middle office; business analysis and project management experience a plus  • Strong data analysis and interpretation skills; analyzing data with respect to corresponding business and technology processes; software/application development experience a plus  • Excellent ability to quickly learn and assimilate business and technical knowledge  • Strong organizational skills and ability to carry out multiple streams of work concurrently in a flexible, fast paced environment  • Must be detail oriented, highly responsible and able to work with tight deadlines  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; sound and independent judgment    • Overall strong desktop skills including Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and other Office applications  • Understanding of concepts and hands-on experience working with relational databases and SQL; experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, Alteryx is helpfulJPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
