Janssen Research and Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson and Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Principal Scientist, Cardiovascular and Metabolism (CVM) – Biomarkers, focusing in the Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (PAH) Area of Cardiovascular and Metabolism (CVM) to be located in Spring House, PA.  At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science.  We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Research & Development, LLC is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.  The CVM Biomarker Team is an integrated group of scientists composed of experts in Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension and many other Cardiovascular and Metabolic Areas. Together, the Biomarker Team will provide the key learnings/insights on the next wave of novel therapies for these patients. Organizationally, the Biomarker Team serves as a pivotal bridge between Discovery Research and the later phase Clinical Development group. The Biomarker Team provides the necessary scientific expertise combined with Translational Medicine to advance an industry-leading pipeline of novel mechanism small molecules and biologic agents to address unmet need in CVM diseases.  The CVM Biomarker Team has a broad remit stretching from support of discovery with human data to support target selection, through development of novel decision-making biomarkers for early phase clinical trials, target-centric indication sequencing and prioritization, and biomarker support of regulatory filings. It has expertise in biomarker development, disease biology research and in the application of CVM and data science technologies to support drug discovery and development.  The Principal Scientist will be a leader in the CVM Biomarker team focusing on drug discovery projects and the design and implementation of novel experiments and interpretation of data to lead in the clinical progression of innovative therapies in Pulmonary Hypertension. The successful candidate will be responsible for building and executing on the strategy to drive assets in the PAH disease area. He/She will lead will work with Discovery Scientists and be accountable for the design and execution of lab experiments for human-based in vitro models, new assay development and data interpretation. The candidate will bring an enthusiastic discovery mentality to the CVM Biomarker Team.  The Principal Scientist will be effective in his/her ability to lead in the execution, guidance and troubleshooting of lab experiments for human-based in vitro models and new assay development for disease understanding, target identification, and disease indication exploration. The candidate will lead and develop the timely creation and implementation of high caliber translational biomarker plans in support of key milestones for preclinical and clinical portfolio programs. Additional activities include partnering with Discovery, TM scientists and external partners to drive the strategy for disease understanding, target identification, and disease indication exploration. The Principal Scientist will be expected to be proactive in support of decision making to project teams. The successful candidate will serve as a lead for PAH preclinical and/or clinical programs in the development and implementation of high caliber translational biomarker packages. Further, the candidate will operate in a highly collaborative environment interacting with multiple internal and external stakeholders contributing high quality and timely deliverables as assessed by stakeholders such as the project team, the clinical trial team, and Biomarker Team leadership.  Responsibilities are as follows: • Ensure strong translational package for the evaluation of new target identification, target evaluation, and indication selection in collaboration with teams from discovery through to clinical development • Directly conduct relevant biomarker analyses in the lab, and coordinate biomarker measurements with internal and external supporting groups or CROs • Lead strategies enabling the design and implementation of novel experiments for disease understanding, target identification, and disease indication exploration • Guide team members in the communication of study results and guide stakeholders in applying those results to making strategic decisions • Work closely with key leaders in partner functions to ensure project goals are met • Contribute to the strategies on molecular understanding of human diseases, patient stratification and biomarker-based endpoint translational strategies • Represent CVM Biomarkers on program discovery and development teams • Contribute to the overall department’s strategic direction with special focus on increasing the impact of translational science approaches in drug discovery and development • Lead internal and external collaborations to increase team capabilities or address a strategic need • Help build an extensive external network of leaders to enable strategic partnerships and awareness of advances in translational and biomarker research • Prepare and/or direct the preparation and review of protocols, clinical study reports and Biomarker sections of Translational plans, IBs, INDs, abstracts, manuscripts, and technical reports • Make recommendations for investment and leadership of key external collaborations Show more

Who Are We Looking For  Nike has embraced big data technologies to enable data-driven decisions. We are looking a Data Engineer to keep pace. As Principle Data Engineer, you will work with a variety of talented Nike teammates and be a driving force for building first-class solutions for Enterprise Data and Analytics working on development projects related to consumer data. The ideal candidate will have programming experience, comfortable with ambiguity and will enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.    In this role, you will work on consumer data with other data engineers, product owners, business analysts, architects and stake holders in other geographies. Your work will be highly impactful. We have a small team which equals huge impact.    You'll get to work alongside truly hardworking teams and help them enhance their performance by promoting collaboration and innovation. We have organized our team for speed and autonomy but backed by world class resources. You will collaborate with engineering, product management and business partner teams on daily basis to help enable data strategy efforts with our partner teams in Greater China.      Show more

Auto req ID: 216454BR  Job Description  PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change, driven by eCommerce and emergent retail technologies. To ensure continued success in the food and beverage space, PepsiCo has assembled a dedicated eCommerce team – tasked with optimizing eCommerce operations and developing innovations that will give PepsiCo a sustainable competitive advantage. While tied closely to broader PepsiCo, the eCommerce group more closely resembles a start-up environment; embracing the core values of having bias for action, being results oriented, maintaining a community-focus, and prioritizing people.  PepsiCo’s Data Science and Analytics group is a team of data scientists, technology specialists, and business innovators who operate within eCommerce to build industry-leading systems and solutions. By focusing on machine learning and automation, the Data Science & Analytics group is pushing the bounds of possibility for PepsiCo and its strategic partners.   As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a critical role in executing the global ecommerce growth agenda. You will be tasked with identifying, designing, and implementing data science/machine learning solutions to business problems. You will collaborate with the larger data science and analytics teams to create a robust, shared codebase; on which PepsiCo will build automated eCommerce systems. You will work with internal business stakeholders and strategic partners to identify opportunities for collaborative development and foster a data-driven culture between relevant teams. NIKE, Inc., Beaverton, OR. Will lead in the data engineering space by researching and developing technical designs and turning them into working solutions that advanced engineering teams can adopt and build upon to support the needs of data governance and data management groups in Beaverton, OR. Will collaborate with Data Architects, Technical Leads, Business Stakeholders, and other agile team members while ensuring alignment with strategic business roadmaps that meet key objectives of the business and technical leadership. Will lead the product development data group’s cloud development effort focusing on scalability, quality and performance. Will serve as the organization's expert on Enterprise Data Governance platform technologies and architecture through the design of efficient and scalable processes to acquire, manipulate, and analyze data. Will contribute to the Enterprise Data Governance codebase directly by taking on development tasks. Will ensure adherence to enterprise best practices for engineering and data design and implementation and infuse the same standards to the product development data engineering teams. Will understand enabler work and collaborate with system and solution architecture and engineering to assist with decision-making and sequencing of critical technological infrastructures to support new business functionality. Will communicate consistently and clearly to all team members to ensure technical designs are understood, questions are answered, issues are raised, and solutions are delivered effectively and efficiently. Will foster an engineering culture including code reviews, learning, and best practices. Will manage a team of data engineers located both on and offshore, including employee performance reviews and regular one-on-one sessions. Will invest time in individual team member development towards goals and interests while developing the overall versatility of the team through T-shaping of all team members. Will participate in an Agile / Scrum methodology to deliver high quality solutions. Will foster an Agile mindset for the team, including continuous improvement and the understanding that overall accountability for the entire product belongs to the team as a whole.  Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or Engineering. Experience: five years of overall progressive experience in leading an engineering team. Skills/requirements: 5 years of experience in (1) AWS distributed / cloud-based data services, including RDS, DynamoDB, Data Pipeline, and EMR; (2) writing and tuning complex highly optimized SQL queries across large data sets; (3) ETL/ data movement tools to build robust and scalable data integration pipelines using SQL, EMR, Python, Spark, Glue, Informatica, and DMS; (4) programming in Python, Java, and C/ C++; (5) NoSQL data stores, including DynamoDB or Cassandra, and SQL data stores, including Aurora; (6) microservice architecture; (7) modern build strategies, continuous integration, unit testing, static analysis, and automated integration tests; and (8) Agile principles and the Scrum development process. As our NIKE Sport Research Lab (NSRL) Senior Perception Researcher, you will lead and execute research projects (both applied and basic research) aimed at delivering validated performance insights that will lead to technologically innovative footwear, apparel and equipment that are globally relevant. In this role, you will actively contribute to developing, executing, applying the research vision, direction, and agenda for functional groups within the NSRL to drive performance innovation across functional teams. You will participate in developing new tools and methods; utilizing sophisticated research skills and knowledge/experience of the consumer, as well as performance requirements, resulting in product/performance innovation. In addition, you will become a resident specialist for all of the Sensory Perception research tools used by the Nike Sport Research Lab staff. You will serve as a full time member of the Product Creation Process, interacting with Senior Researchers and Product Innovators in all phases of research to provide a holistic evaluation of innovation concepts. This position actively contributes to the development of vision for a specific research program leading to product insights or new product innovations. You will demonstrate Nike's dedication to product performance research through attendance at scientific meetings, clinics and conferences, and by communicating research findings and insights to diverse audiences. Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of fast moving consumer goods with operations in over 100 countries and sales in 190. Consumers buy 170 billion Unilever packs around the world every year, and our products are used over two billion times a day. We have more than 171,000 employees globally; (11,000 in the United States) and generated annual sales of €46.5 billion in 2011. Working to create a better future every day, we help people feel good, look good and get more out of life with brands and services that are good for them and good for others. Our portfolio includes some of the world’s best known and most loved brands including thirteen €1 billion brands, and global leadership in most categories in which we operate.  In the United States the portfolio includes brand icons such as: Axe, Ben & Jerry’s, Bertolli, Breyers, Caress, Degree, Dove, Good Humor, Hellmann’s, Klondike, Knorr, Lever 2000, Lipton, Magnum, Motions, Nexxus, Noxzema, Pond’s, Alberto, Promise, Q-tips, , Popsicle, St. Ives, Suave, Skippy, TRESemmé, and Vaseline.  Unilever’s ambition is to double the size of our business, whilst reducing our overall environmental impact (including sourcing, consumer use and disposal). We are also committed to doing what we can to improve health, nutrition and hygiene, with a target to help more than a billion people take action to improve their health and well-being, as well as sourcing all our agricultural raw materials sustainably by 2020. All of these goals are itemised in around 60 time-based commitments in our Unilever Sustainable Living Plan.  Unilever has led the Food Producers sector in the Dow Jones Sustainability World Indexes for 13 consecutive years. We are included in the FTSE4Good Index Series and attained a top environmental score of 5, leading to inclusion in the FTSE4Good Environmental Leaders Europe 40 Index. In 2011 Unilever led the Climate Counts Company Scorecard and was named #1 in the list of Global Corporate Sustainability Leaders according to the latest survey findings from GlobeScan Inc. and SustainAbility Ltd.  For more information about Unilever and its brands, please visit www.unilever.com.  Ø Are you a … Who can Learn Leadership Fast?  Ø Are you a Flexible, Agile ? The is a global initiative enabling Unilever to build a strong talent pipeline that will support and lead our business growth. UFLP is a 36-month rotational leadership development program for which we recruit top-performing undergraduate talent who demonstrate the potential to become managers within our business within 3 years. It’s designed to grow you into a manager, through hands-on learning alongside world-class experts. You’ll be hired into a function and develop your leadership skills by working on live projects which offer you all the experience you need to become ready for your first management role. At the heart of it, it’s about developing tomorrow’s leaders, today.  From Day 1, our Management Trainees (MTs) take on real business challenges within their own function and across the organization. Each of our MTs will gain an understanding of how we make and how we sell our products, become immersed in our sustainability initiatives, understand and experience first-hand our global markets, and build people management skills and financial acumen. Along the way you will develop deep core professional skills and leadership skills, and build a robust support network. On top of all that, you will have a lot of fun along the journey.  We look for people who want to get to grips with the inner workings of a vast business and a desire to understand how it works. It’s about commitment, real people skills and a deep-seated interest in the business as a whole. You’ll become part of a leading-edge company, where you’ll  work with outstanding brands and outstanding people to drive sustainable business growth.         The first thing for you to do is decide which business area interests you the most. Unilever is such a broad company, there’s plenty to select from. But don’t worry if you find it hard to choose, you’ll get exposure to other functions during the program. Regardless of which business unit you work in, you’ll be part of a team at Unilever that’s working to create better futures every day.  Come work for a global supply chain leader in the consumer goods industry! Charged with creating sustainable competitive advantage for the business, Unilever’s Supply Chain delivers more than one billion units of product to customers and consumers every week. We were just recognized with two prestigious awards: Unilever’s Supply Chain has been ranked in the top 25 best supply chains by AMR All specialized areas of supply chain call for clear thinkers with good strategic, logistical skills. Auto req ID: 215778BR  Job Description  We are PepsiCo Supply Chain. We are the game changers, innovators, collaborators and history makers. The ground breakers of the Supply Chain & Logistics space.  We are a diverse group, spread across 200 countries and territories, and united by a shared set of values and goals. You know our name through our amazing portfolio, including Tropicana, Pepsi, Frito-Lay, Quaker and Gatorade.  We perform with a purpose. We dream globally and act locally, constantly innovating to sustain our planet, our people, our communities and our business practices. Together, we raise the bar in lean manufacturing practices. We put forth new standards and stretch to reach beyond the goals we set. We are a think tank, bringing our ideas into action and are determined to find ways to drive efficiencies, improve processes and achieve the highest level of safety… all while meeting the demands of our customers and consumers to deliver the best products. At PepsiCo, we are committed to performing well as individuals and in teams, and to strengthen the company as a whole.  Are you hungry to be a part of the world’s largest portfolio of billion-dollar food and beverage brands? Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: what makes you unique makes us better.  The Supply Chain Designate role manages all activities associated with their front line team, in order to positively impact the overall department. The Supply Chain Designate will be leading a team consisting of hourly front line associates, and possibly salaried exempt associates. Responsibilities include cost efficiency, continuous improvement on processes, service, and safety. This is an opportunity to lead a diverse team of 15 to 30 hourly manufacturing, warehouse, or traffic associates with varying levels of experience. Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of fast moving consumer goods with operations in over 100 countries and sales in 190. Consumers buy 170 billion Unilever packs around the world every year, and our products are used over two billion times a day. We have more than 171,000 employees globally; (11,000 in the United States) and generated annual sales of €46.5 billion in 2011. Working to create a better future every day, we help people feel good, look good and get more out of life with brands and services that are good for them and good for others. Our portfolio includes some of the world’s best known and most loved brands including thirteen €1 billion brands, and global leadership in most categories in which we operate.  In the United States the portfolio includes brand icons such as: Axe, Ben & Jerry’s, Bertolli, Breyers, Caress, Degree, Dove, Good Humor, Hellmann’s, Klondike, Knorr, Lever 2000, Lipton, Magnum, Motions, Nexxus, Noxzema, Pond’s, Alberto, Promise, Q-tips, , Popsicle, St. Ives, Suave, Skippy, TRESemmé, and Vaseline.  Unilever’s ambition is to double the size of our business, whilst reducing our overall environmental impact (including sourcing, consumer use and disposal). We are also committed to doing what we can to improve health, nutrition and hygiene, with a target to help more than a billion people take action to improve their health and well-being, as well as sourcing all our agricultural raw materials sustainably by 2020. All of these goals are itemised in around 60 time-based commitments in our Unilever Sustainable Living Plan.  Unilever has led the Food Producers sector in the Dow Jones Sustainability World Indexes for 13 consecutive years. We are included in the FTSE4Good Index Series and attained a top environmental score of 5, leading to inclusion in the FTSE4Good Environmental Leaders Europe 40 Index. In 2011 Unilever led the Climate Counts Company Scorecard and was named #1 in the list of Global Corporate Sustainability Leaders according to the latest survey findings from GlobeScan Inc. and SustainAbility Ltd. The is a global initiative enabling Unilever to build a strong talent pipeline that will support and lead our business growth. UFLP is a 36-month rotational leadership development program for which we recruit top-performing undergraduate talent who demonstrate the potential to become managers within our business within 3 years. It’s designed to grow you into a manager, through hands-on learning alongside world-class experts. You’ll be hired into a function and develop your leadership skills by working on live projects which offer you all the experience you need to become ready for your first management role. At the heart of it, it’s about developing tomorrow’s leaders, today.  From Day 1, our Management Trainees (MTs) take on real business challenges within their own function and across the organization. Each of our MTs will gain an understanding of how we make and how we sell our products, become immersed in our sustainability initiatives, understand and experience first-hand our global markets, and build people management skills and financial acumen. Along the way you will develop deep core professional skills and leadership skills, and build a robust support network. On top of all that, you will have a lot of fun along the journey.  We look for people who want to get to grips with the inner workings of a vast business and a desire to understand how it works. It’s about commitment, real people skills and a deep-seated interest in the business as a whole. You’ll become part of a leading-edge company, where you’ll  work with outstanding brands and outstanding people to drive sustainable business growth.         The first thing for you to do is decide which business area interests you the most. Unilever is such a broad company, there’s plenty to select from. But don’t worry if you find it hard to choose, you’ll get exposure to other functions during the program. Regardless of which business unit you work in, you’ll be part of a team at Unilever that’s working to create better futures every day.  Come work for a global supply chain leader in the consumer goods industry! Charged with creating sustainable competitive advantage for the business, Unilever’s Supply Chain delivers more than one billion units of product to customers and consumers every week. We were just recognized with two prestigious awards: Unilever’s Supply Chain has been ranked in the top 25 best supply chains by AMR All specialized areas of supply chain call for clear thinkers with good strategic, logistical skills. Johnson & Johnson Consumer Healthcare, a member of Johnson & Johnson’s Family of Companies, is currently recruiting for a Senior Category Insights Manager located in Bentonville/Rogers, Arkansas. Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies touches more than a billion people’s lives each day through our health care products and services, our corporate giving, and the volunteer efforts of our employees. The Johnson & Johnson Family of Consumer Companies develop and market beloved brands that address the needs of consumers and health care professionals worldwide. Our portfolio ranges across several distinct business units: Baby Care, Oral Care, Compromised Skin Care, Beauty, and OTC products. The Sr. Category Insights Manager role is responsible for driving category strategies with Walmart that result in market leading category growth and joint value creation. This individual will be responsible for translating these into category growth driving modular executions. This person will serve as the primary category resource for multiple stakeholders at the customer including (but not limited to) Category Managers/Buyers and Modular Development. This person should be an expert in analytics, Walmart assortment discipline, business processes, and key shopper/ category systems such as POS/Retail Link, Syndicated Data, JDA Space Planning Software. This person should be able to operate a high level fast paced, complex, and changing business environment. Responsibilities: - Serve as Category Advisor on specified category and department. - Provide unbiased strategic and tactical insights and recommendations to Walmart buyers on Distribution, Shelving, Merchandising, Pricing, and Promotional opportunities to improve category performance. - Provide superior support to Buyer during modular relay process. - Uncover business opportunities with deep-dive analytics using a variety of resources including, but not limited to: POS/ Retail Link, Syndicated Data, Marketplace & HH Panel Assessments, and Ad/Promotion Review. - Responsible for leading Managers and Analysts to provide value-added weekly reporting to customer. - Work with internal Shopper/Category partners on research opportunities: provide voice-of-customer, facilitate research projects, and activate findings to be customer-specific. - Work with Category Manager and internal partners on Category Strategy Development including growth plans for focus Segments/Brands, Regional/Demographic Opportunities, and Assortment Gaps - Influence and execute the modular activation of merchandising improvements, efficient assortment, and clustering solutions. - Lead and develop Analyst team members as subject matter experts and superior modular drawing expertise. - Ensure Analyst team members have appropriate talent development focus with development plans, on-going coaching/feedback and succession plans. - Develop, leverage, and share best-practices to enhance the entire category management team. Background And Purpose Of The Job  As an Associate Customer Strategy Manager, you will be responsible for leading, building and leveraging digital solutions for Unilever. You will have end to end responsibility – managing an agile product process and using the product to manage a business. The ideal candidate is curious, obsessed with serving the customer and constantly looking for opportunities. You will unlock human potential by automating routine data tasks and gleaning insight from data.  This role will give you the opportunity to become a transformative leader that can bridge the gap between ideas and execution. You will lead, build and inspire the next generation of digital solutions and strategic value.    You can conduct thorough analysis of a customers’ supply chain and/or initiatives using process mapping and other techniques. You have mastered working with white space and can identify new techniques and data to gain new customer or channel insights. Build, implement and manage Alteryx workflows. HBO Max is the future of entertainment and storytelling. WarnerMedia’s new streaming entertainment offering, HBO Max is the culmination of some of the most innovative new technology and greatest creative talent in the industry. Job Description  The Twentieth Century Fox Television Financial Reporting Group provides financial statements and analysis to WDT Management and Controllership. This department is responsible for reporting the financial performance of hundreds of shows over different markets. The Senior Financial Analyst of this team will be responsible for various key functions that support the month-end, quarter-end and year-end close processes including but not limited to revenue recognition, journal entries, revenue/deferred/unbilled reconciliations, intercompany confirmations, tax credit rollforwards and adhoc requests by management. This role will also work closely with other internal Disney divisions, including Corporate Controllership, Media divisions, FP&A, SOX and distribution teams.  The purpose of this job is to assist the team in providing financial analysis for Twentieth Century Fox Television Group under Walt Disney Television. This role will be responsible for journal entries, monthly reconciliations, and assisting in closing the books on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis. This position will play an important role to help the team to prioritize tasks, keep track of the project processes, reconcile and explain variances daily, along with various ad hoc analysis. Description  JOIN US AS A DATA ANALYST – MERCH / FOOD AND BEVERAGE  About Us  Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.  Behind one of the world’s best loved brands is a uniquely capable and brilliant team of data analysts. The Target Merchant Analytics team creates the tools and data products to sustainably educate and enable our business partners to make great data-based decisions at Target. We are experts in data sourcing, data visualizations, and providing action oriented insights used by clients throughout the enterprise. We also play a key role in identifying the test-and-measure or A/B test opportunities that continuously help Target improve the guest experience, whether they love to shop in stores or at Target.com.    As a Data Analyst, you’ll be part of an agile analyst team, supporting Target merchandising by actively exploring data and sourcing it for specific use cases. You would join and create measureable insights from the data to be shared; development of metrics, reports and statistics. You would document calculations, code and adhering to data management principles and validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review. You would explore statistical analysis that could be applied to the data. Help in performing descriptive statistics including mean, variance, median correlation. Train and communicate output to users to gather feedback and apply insights and testing in partnership with business users. In addition, active participation in team meetings, support agile ceremonies and train other data analysts on technical solutions. You’ll work directly with managers, engineering and business users to gain insight and access to relevant data. You’ll engage with product owners and users to deliver completed work. Develop additional metrics and insights that advance user stories via data discovery and enrichment. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.       Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. Job Description  Implement and deliver analytical solutions by developing data science driven descriptive and predictive models using statistical programming languages that aim to improve budget optimization, media mix efficiency and targeting efficiency. Perform data extraction and transformation tasks to convert data into a structured format that allows for model development, automated reporting and derived insights. Work with the marketing and sales teams to identify the business needs, understand their strategic plans and provide analytical solutions for offline and online campaigns. Develop front end visualizations using business intelligence tools to visualize and explain data trends. Conduct deep dive analyses to identify key drivers of performance. Design A/B tests and develop measurement plans to determine statistical significance using Power tests. Use HiveQL/SQL, R, Python, SAS, Tableau and advanced analytics/statistical techniques for data wrangling, modeling, segmentation, hypothesis testing and performance optimization. Develop data storage and modeling solutions using tools such as SQL Server, SAS, Hadoop and Netezza. Work closely with other analytical consultants, data scientists, data engineers, visualization specialists to drive end-to-end data gathering, data automation, predictive modeling, code maintenance, visualization and reporting. Present findings and analysis in a succinct and presentable manner to executive leadership.      Master’s Degree in Information Systems Management, Information Technology, Statistics, Business Analytics or related field.  Minimum 1 year of experience in exploratory data analysis, linear and non-linear predictive modeling, optimization and machine learning techniques. Must have experience with the following: hypothesis testing and sampling techniques to design marketing campaigns using statistical methods; analyzing large-scale data sets from multiple data sources by leveraging languages and tools including SAS, R, Python, Spark; working with HiveQL, MS-SQL, and Hadoop; and developing interactive dashboards using business intelligence including Tableau. Job Description  Are you interested in a work from home position? An opportunity where you can balance priorities in and outside of work while helping people on their path to better health? If so, consider a role at CVS Health, a Fortune 5 company, as a Data Visualization Senior Consultant on our Resource Planning - Reporting and Analytics Team!  We are looking for a Data Visualization Senior Consultant to help create and maintain a suite of self-service dashboards that will be used by Resource Planning and Operations to evaluate and analyze call handling performance.  To be successful in this role you will need experience in developing, maintaining and managing Tableau driven dashboards & analytics and a working knowledge of Tableau administration/architecture.  In addition to working in Tableau, this position will require strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data and provide insights and recommendations to leadership. Partnering with stakeholders across Customer Care to understand data needs and define self-service reporting solutions, interpreting and analyzing dashboards and providing insights and recommendations to leadership. Job Description  Do you want to make a large impact in your next role? Join CVS Health as an Underwriting and Analytics Senior Consultant, where you will be responsible for Financial Analysis and Underwriting within the team. Here, you will work on key pricing activities to retain and grow pharmacy lives and support CVS Health and Finance leadership to drive value through networks, formulary and sub-client pricing strategies.  In this high impact position, you will support key underwriting and financial analysis activities with a team of Underwriters and Analysts. This role will manage vast, complex PBM pricing strategies and pricing deployment designed to meet the business needs of CVS Health, client and client's customers.  To be successful, you will possess and maintain expert knowledge of the PBM and Health Plan Insurance industry economics. The successful candidate will have proven their ability to work on a high-performing team of knowledge-based employees with the necessary business acumen and technical skills to contribute to the goals of their team. The successful candidate will also have a track record of demonstrating the skill sets necessary to build a deep understanding of the client’s business and goals in order to successfully execute on strategies targeted at improving financial outcomes with supporting data.You will also demonstrate a high level of consistency and expertise in using logic and analytic skills to direct client analysis in response to specific business questions and be able to communicate the findings, including methodology and estimated outcomes. Additionally, the successful candidate will have proven experience executing support capabilities to meet existing and future client needs and will work with internal terms to enhance analytic support for clients. This will require developing an understanding of levers of PBM and enterprise profitability as well as utilizing the tools and processes for pricing current and prospective clients.    Join the company helping people on their path to better health! Our organization offers a competitive benefit package including vacation and holiday paid time off, health/dental/vision insurance, work/life balance, employee discounted stock purchase program, 401K, tuition reimbursement, and employee discounts at all CVS stores.    2 years in a health plan actuarial role, PBM financial analysis or underwriting role, or comparable industry experience. Description  About us:  Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 500 company and one of America’s leading retailers.  Right on pace with Target’s distinctive retail brand, in a role in Target Finance and Accounting, you will be a truly collaborative partner with a seat at the table. You’ll bring your unique point of view, experience and passion for the work to your team and internal clients. In Finance, you’ll be an integral voice in discussions that lead to Target’s unparalleled shopping experience. Your analysis and recommendations will be directly applied to critical business decisions, from sales to merchandising and beyond. Within Finance, you’ll enjoy the interesting challenges of the competitive retail space. You’ll see your contributions come to life in virtually every area of this dynamic enterprise. And you’ll grow and be challenged in your career while having a healthy balance with life outside of work.  Internal Audit provides independent assurance and risk insights to and collaborates with business owners across the enterprise. You’ll use professional judgment, analytics, agile concepts and other innovations daily. You’ll understand, assess the effectiveness of and help improve risk management capabilities (e.g., processes and controls) for Target’s strategic, business and compliance objectives.  As a Senior Auditor, you will lead the development and execution of Internal Audit activities, leveraging your knowledge of risk management capabilities, including identifying and assessing risks and internal controls and utilizing your subject matter expertise. Leading Internal Audit activities requires working independently with a high level of initiative, providing direction and coaching to others, managing projects effectively, communicating with business owners and developing and maintaining strong business relationships. You will foster your personal development by remaining current with industry trends and emerging risks and gaining unique experiences supporting a meaningful career. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs       Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. Target Operations is at the center of building strategies focused on utilizing stores as hubs to meet the guest’s needs both in person and through delivery, reducing out-of-stock issues, improving product transitions, inventory management, and enterprise space needs to enable growth and create inspiring experiences. Description  Loyalty Marketing Operations Analyst  About Us  Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.  Fueling the continued success of one of the world’s most beloved and recognized brands is a distinctly capable, creative and innovative Marketing organization. Target Marketing is well known for inspiring and surprising guests, and we pride ourselves on connecting them to the products and experiences they expect and deserve from Target. We study our guests to discover new needs and insights, and then craft every interaction to build brand love. We are market experts who insist on a clear and cohesive understanding of our business objectives, guest segments and behaviors, strategies and tactics, overcoming obstacles and measuring success. Our commitment to partnering both internally and with external agencies gives us a wide range of capabilities, from award-winning creative work to exciting and unique promotional marketing. Leveraging our collective assets and fostering a healthy, supportive and open team culture, we deliver a holistically gratifying experience that guests can only get at Target.  A role with means a big opportunity to create new Target guests and drive profitable growth. Here, you’ll deliver the insights and analytics that measure our performance and improve our marketing and media decisions. You’ll lead the discovery, interpretation and communication of meaningful data patterns that inform innovation for greater guest loyalty. Your work will help guide the holistic Target experience for our guests while providing our business partners with facts distilled into insights and implications that they can quickly and easily act on. You’ll dream big to ideate the new tools and methodologies that effectively answer Marketing and Media Strategy’s most critical questions. And you’ll provide leadership when it comes to guest data governance, policies and enhancements.  As a Loyalty Marketing Operations Analyst, you will partner with business owners and strategy leads to help translate business problems into guest-focused marketing & business solutions. The Loyalty Marketing Operations team drives and maintains a toolkit of guest-led, innovative and scalable solutions that support business needs. You will help develop effective campaigns that increase brand awareness, solidify guest loyalty and drive sales. You will define the target audience in support of campaigns and also support with pre and post campaign analysis and reporting. You will also be responsible for solving business problems through end-to-end strategic operations including the technology, process and execution. You’ll work cross-functionally with product teams, marketing, merchandising, external vendor partners, store operations, and our partner teams in India to drive the brand, business and operational solutions.  Core responsibilities of this job are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs. Description  About us:  Target is one of the world’s most recognized brands and the second-largest retailer in the United States.  Target Global Supply Chain and Logistics is evolving at an incredible pace. We are constantly reimagining how we get the right product to the right guest even better, faster and more cost effectively than before. We are becoming more intelligent, automated and algorithmic in our decision-making, so that no matter how guests shop—in stores or on Target.com—we deliver the convenience and immediate gratification they demand and deserve. We are on a mission to win decisively over any competitor, with a seamless and superior guest service experience unlike any they can offer. Our teams work with the agility our mission requires, and we constantly come together to implement new processes in record time. So we’re looking for exceptional people who are proactive, creative, independent, innovative, risk-savvy and comfortable working in varying degrees of ambiguity. Are you a critical thinker who seeks the root cause and can analyze both qualitatively and quantitatively? Are you a creative problem-solver who simplifies problems, quickly identifies solutions, commits to a plan and then positively influences others to execute it? If so, you will have success on one of our dynamic teams.  A role in Inventory Management means applying your specialized and well-informed point of view to what we buy, from whom, how much, and where it needs to go from there. You’ll use the right combination of data and expertise to achieve the best possible product availability through proper inventory positioning. You’ll establish and develop great relationships with our vendors to encourage on-time shipment and delivery to stores and ultimately, guests.  As an, you'll develop business strategies to drive availability and profitable sales. Make an impact by managing and allocating inventory to stores, negotiating and maintain business relationships with the largest vendors in the industry, and formulating in-depth inventory forecasts. It’s your skills that help bring guests what they want, when they want it, whether guests shop our stores or online. We’ll be supporting you with extensive training and robust development to help you grow as a strong Inventory Analyst. This position includes competitive pay and discounts, and flexible scheduling.  Core responsibilities are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs. POSITION PURPOSE The Sr. Web Business Analyst Specialty Channels leads the design and implementation of the Homedepot.com web analytics strategy. In this position, you will analyze web analytics data as well as other offline data to evaluate site performance (capacity, customer experience, fall out points, etc.). You will collaborate with various departments to design and execute a fact-based continuous improvement / channel growth strategy using online and offline data analysis. The Sr. Web Business Analyst works with the Web analysts to analyze online data using various analytical tools to uncover trends and provide insight that will maximize HomeDepot.com online marketing efforts, as well as overall business objectives. You will work with the Web analyst to research and analyze business trends and customer behavior data to identify opportunities for website enhancements and new internet marketing initiatives. You will analyze and understand the key drivers of performance related to Homedepot.com's online objectives. You will analyze and provide insight on the HomeDepot.com website(s) traffic and conversion. Finally, you will work with the Web analyst to provide weekly Web Analytic dashboards to Management and the supporting teams.    20% - Work with other departments providing analytical insight on business performance. 20% - Research and analyze business trends & customer behavior data to identify opportunities for website enhancements. 20% - Analyze web analytics data as well as other offline data to evaluate site performance. 10% - Work with the Web Analyst to provide weekly Web Analytic dashboards. 10% - Takes the lead on new programs and initiatives for Web Analytics Team. 10% - Provide web analytics strategy to Specialty Channel. Job Description  Fortune 8 CVS Health has an exciting opportunity for a Rebate Finance Program Management Analyst, Senior to join our newly formed Rebate Process Innovation department! This role and team will drive key activities as part of CVS Health’s Align for Growth initiatives and will be a part of our Rebate Operations department within the PBM Finance organization. The candidate will require an ambitious, motivated, and eager individual, looking to work for an industry leader. The individual will be working across our Rebate Operations department, IT organization and other functional areas as we look to transform our business through capital investments and process improvement initiatives.  As the Rebate Finance Program Management Analyst, Senior you will play an instrumental role in delivering on our transformational goals. You will partner closely with SMEs across our rebates organization to identify key business deliverables and assist with the documentation of project scope and timelines. The role requires the individual to possess functional understanding of our rebate transformation initiatives, knowledge of the various projects deliverables and the ability to document project timelines and status to the program leadership team. The role will need to ensure the initiatives align with the department’s transformation roadmap while ensuring the program stays on track to deliver on the objectives and goals outlined by the project teams. They will be expected to manage project documentation, produce project plans which capture deliverables and expected timelines and store the information in a manner where it can be accessed by various stakeholders. The position will also develop and management department metrics related operational and project activities which will be shared throughout the organization. They will also work with the Director – Rebate Process Innovation to align priorities and ensure the teams receive the necessary support to complete their project objectives within agreed upon timelines. The individual will assist with the management of department’s capital budget which will exceed $20MM and ensure the portfolio is appropriately funded to support the transformation initiatives.  The successful candidate will have experience capturing business requirements and creating project documentation across varies functional areas and systems. They will demonstrate the ability to initiate and lead project discussion and ensure teams are aligned with project deliverables. They must have the ability to identify key business and IT stakeholders, identify risks and dependencies across high visible program and provide status updates to leadership on health of the initiatives. The individual needs a proven record of collaborating and leading cross-functional teams which work to identify and resolve business needs.    4 or more years experience in a operations and/or finance based role    2 or more years experience within the PBM or Healthcare industries 3 or more years experience in a project management role   Bachelors Degree required. Job Description  As a Platform Innovation Product Manager, you will be an entrepreneurial and innovative product leader with a user-centric mindset and proven experience in driving the product development process. You will collaborate with internal project stakeholders across sales, marketing, credit, legal, finance, compliance, operations and executive management to translate business needs into an effective product strategy. The Platform Innovation Product Manager is essential to ensuring CVS Health maintains its leading position in a highly competitive market. The Platform Innovation Product Manager position is responsible for assessing emerging trends, technologies, electronic platforms and potential partnerships that allow us to deliver innovative experiences that improve the customer experience.  You’ll own the product vision, strategy and outcome-oriented roadmap, prioritize product features and capabilities, and maintain a healthy product backlog (i.e. writing and accepting user stories). You’ll spend each day collaborating with stakeholders, users, and a deeply dedicated team as you create amazing products.  As part of Platform Innovation, you will be leading innovative and bold initiatives aimed at transforming health care using the latest technologies and methodologies.  The Product Manager must have exceptional problem-solving skills, be an effective communicator that uses his/her abilities to successfully collaborate with others, able to lead and influence product conversations, build consensus among a wide range of business partners, and instill commitment from direct reports to deliver high performance results towards the development and execution of enhanced product offerings.  This role requires a high level of collaboration, in-office presence 5 days a week, and a willingness to question the status quo and passion for IT innovation. It is a hands-on product management position that works across the entire product lifecycle from product-market fit, experience design, implementation, delivery and post launch support. Job Description  As a UX Product Designer, you will be an integral part of an innovative and bold initiative that takes a modern approach of disciplined agile and lean software practices aimed at transforming healthcare and pharmacy. The UX Product Designer is essential to ensuring product success and end-user satisfaction in a highly collaborative environment that follows the Extreme Programming (XP) methodology. The UX Product Designer position is responsible for taking a user-centered approach to design in finding the right solution for users as part of a small, cross-functional product team. You will help educate both business and technology teams on the XP process and how the traditional UX role changes, as well as lead products from discovery through iterative delivery.  A firm understanding of user-centered design principles and user research methodologies is crucial for success in the role. Empathy, creative problem-solving, comfort with uncertainty, pairing with team members, excellent communication skills, curiosity and learning are the foundational characteristics of the UX Product Designer. The position is located in the Irving, TX office, and candidates must be able to be in the office daily to work with their product team. POSITION PURPOSE  The SEO Content Strategist plays a key role in increasing the organization’s search engine presence by developing and executing content strategies that achieve specific earned media goals.  The SEO Content Strategist partners with the Earned Media Insights team to connect the dots between the different disciplines - merchandising, category experience, business intelligence, social media and creative - to identify, recommend, groom, and produce optimized digital content experiences for our customers.  The strategist synthesizes and analyzes multiple data inputs including SEO requirements, customer and industry research, case studies, business intelligence, and competitive analysis to develop and recommend earned media content strategies. The strategist also partners with the SEO Business Analyst to size, groom, and prioritize content opportunities based on projected ROI, business objectives, and resources. The strategist works with internal business partners and outside agencies to execute and track content initiatives as they move through the production pipeline to ensure deliverables meet THD standards, are error-free, and SEO optimized prior to publication.        This position reports to the EARNED MEDIA CONTENT STRATEGY MANAGER This position has no direct reports.                                  Show more

Job Description  As a Platform Innovation Product Manager, you will be an entrepreneurial and innovative product leader with a user-centric mindset and proven experience in driving the product development process. You will collaborate with internal project stakeholders across sales, marketing, credit, legal, finance, compliance, operations and executive management to translate business needs into an effective product strategy. The Platform Innovation Product Manager is essential to ensuring CVS Health maintains its leading position in a highly competitive market. The Platform Innovation Product Manager position is responsible for assessing emerging trends, technologies, electronic platforms and potential partnerships that allow us to deliver innovative experiences that improve the customer experience.  You’ll own the product vision, strategy and outcome-oriented roadmap, prioritize product features and capabilities, and maintain a healthy product backlog (i.e. writing and accepting user stories). You’ll spend each day collaborating with stakeholders, users, and a deeply dedicated team as you create amazing products.  As part of Platform Innovation, you will be leading innovative and bold initiatives aimed at transforming health care using the latest technologies and methodologies.  The Product Manager must have exceptional problem-solving skills, be an effective communicator that uses his/her abilities to successfully collaborate with others, able to lead and influence product conversations, build consensus among a wide range of business partners, and instill commitment from direct reports to deliver high performance results towards the development and execution of enhanced product offerings.  This role requires a high level of collaboration, in-office presence 5 days a week, and a willingness to question the status quo and passion for IT innovation. It is a hands-on product management position that works across the entire product lifecycle from product-market fit, experience design, implementation, delivery and post launch support.              At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Job Description  As a UX Product Designer, you will be an integral part of an innovative and bold initiative that takes a modern approach of disciplined agile and lean software practices aimed at transforming healthcare and pharmacy. The UX Product Designer is essential to ensuring product success and end-user satisfaction in a highly collaborative environment that follows the Extreme Programming (XP) methodology. The UX Product Designer position is responsible for taking a user-centered approach to design in finding the right solution for users as part of a small, cross-functional product team. You will help educate both business and technology teams on the XP process and how the traditional UX role changes, as well as lead products from discovery through iterative delivery. A firm understanding of user-centered design principles and user research methodologies is crucial for success in the role. Empathy, creative problem-solving, comfort with uncertainty, pairing with team members, excellent communication skills, curiosity and learning are the foundational characteristics of the UX Product Designer. The position is located in the Buffalo Grove IL office, and candidates must be able to be in the office daily to work with their product team. We have been named one of the world’s most innovative companies and we are on a mission to provide the best interconnected shopping experience to our consumers. To do so, we need more dreamers, innovators and big thinkers passionate about re-imagining the future of retail. Interested in making history with us? If so, apply today to experience what it’s like to be a part of our HomeDepot.com team. Who knows? Your next big idea may just change the future of retail!  The Sr. Analyst, Online Merchandising Solutions leads a team of data coordinators in the execution of homedepot.com data collection and maintenance. Job Description  As the Senior AS400 Developer, you will be responsible for development and maintenance of software applications critical to the operations of CVS Health. The Senior AS400 Developer is essential to ensuring the success of the RxClaim Adjudication team in their support of both internal and external clients. You will be part of the project team comprised of both employee and contract staff, and will also partner with project leaders, business stakeholders and managers in accomplishing the projects.  The Senior AS400 Developer is expected to be proficient in SDLC methodologies and adhere to established CVS standards & guidelines. As the Senior AS400 Developer, you will be providing solutions to technical and functional requirements, estimations with little or no variance, system design, problem resolutions and guidance to other team members and support operations. Position Purpose  The Senior Inventory Solutions Analyst will be responsible for leading and implementing projects within the Inventory Planning and Replenishment Organization, and will oversee the planning, designing, and implementing of new systems or changes in existing systems. The Sr. Analyst will design and develop inventory management metrics and reports to support the business requirements, and will play a key role in Business Process Documentation, Design and Improvement. Additionally, this role will be responsible for leading key inventory management improvement initiatives and provide data driven insight and resolution recommendations. They will serve as a central point of contact IPR and logistics, lead cross-functional project from a process and/or systems focus. The Sr. Analyst will be charged with implementing multiple initiatives against aggressive schedules. As the principle driver of their initiatives, this person will work across functional groups to coordinate efforts and ensure success; drive change management by understanding, communicating, and managing changes associated with system enhancements, implementations and process improvements. Job Description  This position is based in the office in Phoenix AZ. This is a SQL Server/SSIS/ETL Developer position. The charter of the team/department is to design, build and maintain a "best-in-class" data warehouse to serve as a centralized repository for all Aetna Medicaid operational data.   Experienced database developer needed for SQL/SSIS development in a Microsoft shop. Technologies limited to TSQL and SSIS. No front end development. Position responsible for the development, support, and optimization of complex TSQL DDL and DML database objects and SSIS packages. Developers participate in non-development tasks such as data analysis, data modeling, user training and documentation. Developers gather requirements for custom data solutions and build relationships of trust with internal departments. The ideal candidate will enjoy solving puzzles and designing creating data solutions in a highly collaborative team environment.          A highly collaborative, small team working environment with a "best-in-class" attitude in a growing department. A challenging and rewarding project where individuals contribute their knowledge and experience for the benefit of everyone. The work day for this role can start any time between 7 and 9 am Arizona time. This is an in-office position and not a telework role. POSITION PURPOSE The Senior Analyst Assortment Planning will provide subject matter expertise, project management and analytical support to assortment decisions made by the merchandising organization during category reviews. This position is responsible for executing category Business Reviews (BR) and Product Line Reviews (PLR) for a designated department and should be seen by merchants as a thought leader on category and assortment strategy. The Senior Analyst should be an advocate for implementing assortment planning best practices across the portfolio of categories.    90% Work in collaboration with Merchants to determine category review goals and objectives, conduct standard and ad hoc analysis to identify key drivers of performance, recommend assortment decisions that will improve category performance and develop financial plans that reflect category changes. Typical analysis will include: (a) marketplace and macroeconomic trends impacting the category including competitive assessment, (b) vendor portfolio strengths and weaknesses including private brand, (c) line structure, (d) store clustering, (e) customer and store feedback, (f) identifying key product attributes and (g) regional performance. Develop executive-level presentations that summarize analysis including historical category performance, strategic rationale underpinning assortment decisions and expected financial impact. Report out to all levels of management. Accountable for accuracy, thoroughness, thought process, timeliness and viability of recommendations. 10% Own Merchant/Associate Merchant relationship for designated department. Special projects. Ad hoc analysis and reporting.  This position reports to the Senior Manager, Assortment Planning. This position has no direct responsibility for supervising others. Job Description  CVS Health has a few new opportunities available in Lincoln, RI as a part of the Rx Commerce Center on the Workforce Management Team. The team is seeking Workforce Management Analysts who will join a dynamic organization committed to providing key business analytics, reporting and scheduling that ensure CVS.Com customer inquiries are handled in a timely manner. We are hoping you'll be interested in utilizing your exceptional communication skills coupled with our high quality training to join our team!  As an Analyst you will monitor call volume and staffing data utilizing our internal tracking system (Aspect) and produce Workforce Management (WFM) reports according to deadlines – attendance, absence, and adherence, intraday and ad hoc reports. In order to be successful in this role you must ensure sufficient time is planned to support the business needs through training, individual representative development, team meetings. You will be asked to analyze intraday reporting, have the ability to communicate results to leadership and ensure accuracy and timeliness of data by working time-off, schedule change and other requests types.  We are currently looking for someone to work Sunday through Thursday from 10:30am - 7:00pm with flexibility from 2:30pm- 11:00pm.  We also offer a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision insurance as well as a comprehensive list of supplemental list of benefits and discount programs. Purpose Of Role  The primary purpose of this role is to identify and track relevant share data trends, analyze and share them with key stakeholders to drive business action. Key responsibilities include driving business decisions across key business units via share data analytics and reporting that provides market, category, brand and customer recommendations; partnering with suppliers to provide and evolve reporting based on observed business needs; and partnering with other analytical groups (Data Analytics, Customer Insights, Finance) to answer complex business questions.          Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 18 million customers a week in the United States and Canada. With fiscal year 2019 sales of $72.1 billion, Lowe’s and its related businesses operate or service more than 2,200 home improvement and hardware stores and employ approximately 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe’s supports its hometown Charlotte region and all communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts. For more information, visit Lowes.com.    As a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company, Lowe’s is committed to creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts through nonprofit partnerships. Across every community we serve, Lowe’s associates donate their time and expertise through the Lowe’s Heroes volunteer program. Description  Lead Information Security Analyst, CSIRT- Grace Hopper Conference  About Us  Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.  Target as a tech company? Absolutely. We’re the behind-the-scenes powerhouse that fuels Target’s passion and commitment to cutting-edge innovation. We anchor every facet of one of the world’s best-loved retailers with a strong technology framework that relies on the latest tools and technologies—and the brightest people—to deliver incredible value to guests online and in stores. Target Technology Services is on a mission to offer the systems, tools and support that guests and team members need and deserve. Our high-performing teams balance independence with collaboration, and we pride ourselves on being versatile, agile and creative. We drive industry-leading technologies in support of every angle of the business, and help ensure that Target operates smoothly, securely and reliably from the inside out.  We value diversity. We believe that diversity and inclusion is of core importance when try to create positive in-store experiences for our guests, and we think it is also critically important when building our teams. Read more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.  Target’s world-class information security team focuses on protecting Guest and Team member data. The Cyber Fusion Center (CFC) is the heart of Target’s security team and a place where innovation happens daily.  As a Lead Information Security Analyst on CSIRT, you will assist with the leading the team as you assess information security events and incidents across the Target environment. In this role, you will use your expertise to collaborate and utilize problem solving skills as you work among a team of skilled analysts to address complex problems within a 24x7 CFC environment. You will implement new processes and procedures as identified by CSIRT and CFC Leadership to ensure continuous improvements for Target’s monitoring, detection and mitigation capabilities. You will use your expert-level knowledge of Information Security to monitor SIEM and logging environments for security events and alerts to potential (or active) threats, intrusions, and/or compromises. You will lead internal trainings to CSIRT Analysts & Sr. Analysts to ensure in their continued education. You will work to understand the global threat landscape by working with Target’s Cyber Threat Intelligence team to maintain awareness. You will review and guide requests from internal teams and will escalate information security events according to Target’s Cyber Security Incident Response Plan. Additionally, you will lead containment and remediation efforts during or after an incident; and leverage your knowledge to write comprehensive reports for these investigations.  Core responsibilities of this job are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.       Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information. Show more

POSITION PURPOSE The Sr. Web Business Analyst Specialty Channels leads the design and implementation of the Homedepot.com web analytics strategy. In this position, you will analyze web analytics data as well as other offline data to evaluate site performance (capacity, customer experience, fall out points, etc.). You will collaborate with various departments to design and execute a fact-based continuous improvement / channel growth strategy using online and offline data analysis. The Sr. Web Business Analyst works with the Web analysts to analyze online data using various analytical tools to uncover trends and provide insight that will maximize HomeDepot.com online marketing efforts, as well as overall business objectives. You will work with the Web analyst to research and analyze business trends and customer behavior data to identify opportunities for website enhancements and new internet marketing initiatives. You will analyze and understand the key drivers of performance related to Homedepot.com's online objectives. You will analyze and provide insight on the HomeDepot.com website(s) traffic and conversion. Finally, you will work with the Web analyst to provide weekly Web Analytic dashboards to Management and the supporting teams.    20% - Work with other departments providing analytical insight on business performance. 20% - Research and analyze business trends & customer behavior data to identify opportunities for website enhancements. 20% - Analyze web analytics data as well as other offline data to evaluate site performance. 10% - Work with the Web Analyst to provide weekly Web Analytic dashboards. 10% - Takes the lead on new programs and initiatives for Web Analytics Team. 10% - Provide web analytics strategy to Specialty Channel. POSITION PURPOSE  The Analyst Customer Data Strategy and Governance will participate in a variety of projects related to the governance and management of customer data across The Home Depot. They may lead smaller customer data related projects and will accumulate knowledge to become a subject matter expert in customer data. They will be expected to participate in process development, project management, data analysis and status reporting and may lead these areas for a small project. Job Description  Position Summary:  Analyze user needs and provide effective operating structure for IT projects through sound IT analysis, Aetna Information System’s (AIS) project management methodology, AIS project resource allocation, and consolidated AIS project performance reporting. Gather and translate business and functional requirements into technical requirements to deliver precise specifications for functional hierarchy, workflow, business rules, definitions, outstanding issues, data profiling, data analysis, and data mapping while considering all impacted components from an end-to-end perspective. Work with Business Partners to elicit comprehensive functional requirements, recommend solutions to Architecture and Development, and work on developing training materials. Collaborate with Architects and System Developers to define overall functional application architecture on Hadoop, MarkLogic and SQL frameworks. Collect, analyze and track data trends on MarkLogic, Hadoop frameworks using Hue, XML schemas and X-Query to facilitate and recommend actions to improve existing processes. Conduct interviews and research to design creative, progressive IT application solutions for business problems and adhere to APLC (Aetna Project Life Cycle) or AGILE project management methodology by utilizing internal procedures and tools to identify areas for methodology improvement. Run SQL queries on HR Data Warehouse and DataMart to provide timely and quality solutions to assigned business and technical problems, and review deliverables/artifacts with project stakeholders through all the cycles of Software Development Life Cycle. Document detailed technical specifications, program functions and use cases needed to build and enhance the applications as part of technical design.      Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Engineering related field.  Minimum 5 years of Business Analyst experience. Job Description  CVS Health, a Fortune 500 company has a new and exciting opportunity within our Vendor Management team! The Vendor Management Performance Analyst provides key support to the Vendor Management team, working in a fast-paced, blended queue/call center performance data. Work efforts are focused on vendor performance, helping to make associated data accessible and meaningful for senior management and stakeholders providing them with business intelligence that allows them to manage and direct vendor operations to meet performance goals and requirements.  The selected candidate will actively assist in collaborating with internal partners to identify data and information needs, sources of relevant data associated with vendor performance and ensure consistency across reporting mediums, and will use tools such as Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau, R, SQL and a data warehouse to help access, consolidate and visualize the data. The Performance Analyst will support reporting, data and report automation for efficiencies, performance monitoring and trending, root cause analysis and ad hoc special projects, as well as facilitate action-focused/data-centered conversations about opportunities and trends in the data.  The preferred candidate will have excellent meeting facilitation and communication skills, both written and verbal and advanced computer skills, especially with MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint and SQL. The candidate must have the ability to work independently, travel when needed and manage deadlines.  We offer a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision insurance as well as a wide-ranging list of supplemental benefits and discount programs.  In addition to sixteen paid days off for employees, we also offer ten paid holidays. Job Description  Among the Contract Operations, Senior Analyst's key responsibilities are monthly guarantee reporting, financial reporting, which includes but is not limited to reconciliation of payments made through financial systems as well as identifying potential future risk based on past performance. Additionally, the Contract Operations, Senior Analyst must be able to analyze operational data to identify areas for improvement either operationally or contractually as well as to estimate probability of guarantee failure. The Contract Operations, Senior Analyst is also responsible for reviewing Performance Guarantee requirements in Request for Proposals (RFPs) and Request for Renewals (RFRs) for prospective and existing clients and providing a response within the pre-determined due dates.  This Contract Operations, Senior Analyst position requires working with business owners to review guarantees and assess risk, obtaining operational approval of non-standard guarantees, obtaining operational results and evaluating the data to ensure it is relevant and reliable as it relates to the respective guarantee. The position is responsible for interacting with, and resolving sales, legal, operational business owner and client concerns and issues, via telephone and email, ranging from routine to complex, as they relate to establishing and measuring of performance metrics and our contractual obligations.
