Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started. Do you like working with big data? Do you want to use data to help drive the direction of products that impact the lives of over 1 billion people every day? If yes, we want to talk to you. We're looking for a leader in our Data Engineering team to work closely with Product Managers, Data Scientists and Software Engineers to support product launches and roadmaps by building the data architecture that informs and drives insight. In this role, you'll see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. You'll work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, work with one of the strongest data sets in the world, use cutting edge technology, and see your efforts affect products and people on a regular basis. The perfect candidate will have strong data infrastructure and data architecture skills, a proven track record of leading and scaling data engineering teams, strong operational skills to drive efficiency and speed, strong project management leadership, and a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively improve companies.   Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.  Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com. Show more

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started. In June 2019 the Libra Association announced plans for Libra – a new global cryptocurrency that runs on the Libra network. Libra's mission is to create a simple global financial infrastructure that empowers billions of people around the world. It's powered by blockchain technology and the plan is to launch it in 2020.Novi is a newly formed Facebook subsidiary whose goal is to provide financial services that will enable people to access and participate in the Libra network. Our first product will be a digital wallet for Libra, a new global currency powered by blockchain technology, and it will be available in 2020 in Messenger, WhatsApp, and as a standalone app. Our vision is to reinvent money and transform the global economy so people everywhere can live better lives. Novi will let you send Libra to almost anyone with a smartphone, as easily and instantly as you might send a text message or photo, and at low to no cost. And, in time, we plan to offer additional services for people and businesses, such as paying bills with the push of a button, buying a cup of coffee with the scan of a code, or riding your local public transit without needing to carry cash or a metro pass. If so, lets talk.  Ideally you preside in the greater Washington DC Metro area, but we will consider other locations.  It’s time to transform health with new ways of working to improve approaches to care, productivity and well-being. Watson Health’s AI (Artificial Intelligence) and machine learning technology understands, reasons and learns – helping to translate information into knowledge that can help drive more informed decision-making. With cognitive computing, we can see and analyze more data than ever before – and achieve more than we ever thought possible.  The Client Executive is an experienced, motivated consultative sales executive responsible for IBM Watson Health data sales to the US Federal Government Agency-HHS as well as academic and non-profit organizations. This role requires a thorough understanding of one or more HHS agencies to include CMS, CDC, NIH, NCI, or FDA, and including how academic and non-profit organizations receive funding from and support HHS agency objectives. You should also have familiarity with the agency’s priorities from both a clinical and policy perspective and how its business and technology needs can become opportunities and procurements for IBM Watson Health. This role will lead data sales, coupled with services, within the assigned agency and any additional assigned agencies; and leverages the full spectrum of IBM Watson Health’s resources, including consulting services and health data assets, to deliver value to government agencies thereby enabling these agencies to achieve their business objectives.  Then Client Executive should have a deep understanding of business intelligence technologies specifically administrative claims data, electronic health record/electronic medical record data, and analytic strategies, and their use within the agency assigned.     IBM Watson Health is pioneering a new partnership between humanity and technology with the goal of transforming global health and revolutionizing many aspects of the medical and pharmaceutical industries, as well as government sectors. We aspire to improve lives and give hope by delivering innovation to address the world’s most pressing health challenges through data and artificial intelligence insights. As a Package Consultant at IBM, get ready to tackle numerous mission-critical company directives. Our team takes on the challenge of designing, developing and re-engineering highly complex application components and integrating software packages using various tools. You will use a mix of consultative skills, business knowledge, and technical expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into our clients' business environment and achieve business results.    The SAP Data Management Lead is responsible for leading the successful design and delivery of SAP Data Management solutions for IBM Global Business Services. The data management and Analytics consultant will define strategies, develop and deliver solutions that enable the collection, processing and management of information from one or more sources, and the subsequent delivery of information to audiences in support of key business processes. This position provides leadership and oversight of the Data Governance objectives and policies, procedures.  We bring our global industrial-strength Application Management capabilities, modernized for a cloud world, together with our world-class cloud and mobile-powered Enterprise Application and Systems Integration skills. The integration of DevOps Innovation Services and Agile practices, along with IBM Design Thinking and a world of talent, enables us to deliver continuous innovation with speed, quality, and at the cost point required to keep clients at the top of their game.    Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.     Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic.  In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.   With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!  #ibmsapusa #referGBSSAP   IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter business by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence. As a Package Consultant at IBM, get ready to tackle numerous mission-critical company directives. Our team takes on the challenge of designing, developing and re-engineering highly complex application components and integrating software packages using various tools. You will use a mix of consultative skills, business knowledge, and technical expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into our clients' business environment and achieve business results.  IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries.  Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM.    The SAP MDG Consultant is responsible for leading the successful design and delivery of SAP Data Management solutions for IBM Global Business Services. The data management and Analytics consultant will define strategies, develop and deliver solutions that enable the collection, processing and management of information from one or more sources, and the subsequent delivery of information to audiences in support of key business processes. This position provides leadership and oversight of the Data Governance objectives and policies, procedures.  We bring our global industrial-strength Application Management capabilities, modernized for a cloud world, together with our world-class cloud and mobile-powered Enterprise Application and Systems Integration skills. The integration of DevOps Innovation Services and Agile practices, along with IBM Design Thinking and a world of talent, enables us to deliver continuous innovation with speed, quality, and at the cost point required to keep clients at the top of their game.    Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.     Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic.  In 2015, Go Organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.  With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in! Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started. At Facebook, we're building devices and experiences that make people feel closer together, which we call Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality (AR/VR). The AR/VR organization includes Oculus and Portal products and other hardware, AR and VR software and content, and research and development labs.  The Reality Labs Marketing team is looking for an experienced marketing practitioner to build and lead a world class, global SEO function. The candidate is an experienced data driven marketer (SEO experience) with an excellent track record of driving growth and acquisition through content and technical SEO levers. This individual is focused on delivering results, loves to problem solve and thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, start-up environment.  This position is located in our Menlo Park headquarters.   Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.  Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com. Show more

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Ideally you preside in the greater Washington DC Metro area, but we will consider other locations.  It’s time to transform health with new ways of working to improve approaches to care, productivity and well-being. Watson Health’s AI (Artificial Intelligence) and machine learning technology understands, reasons and learns – helping to translate information into knowledge that can help drive more informed decision-making. With cognitive computing, we can see and analyze more data than ever before – and achieve more than we ever thought possible.  The Client Executive is an experienced, motivated consultative sales executive responsible for IBM Watson Health data sales to the US Federal Government Agency-HHS as well as academic and non-profit organizations. This role requires a thorough understanding of one or more HHS agencies to include CMS, CDC, NIH, NCI, or FDA, and including how academic and non-profit organizations receive funding from and support HHS agency objectives. You should also have familiarity with the agency’s priorities from both a clinical and policy perspective and how its business and technology needs can become opportunities and procurements for IBM Watson Health. This role will lead data sales, coupled with services, within the assigned agency and any additional assigned agencies; and leverages the full spectrum of IBM Watson Health’s resources, including consulting services and health data assets, to deliver value to government agencies thereby enabling these agencies to achieve their business objectives.  Then Client Executive should have a deep understanding of business intelligence technologies specifically administrative claims data, electronic health record/electronic medical record data, and analytic strategies, and their use within the agency assigned.     IBM Watson Health is pioneering a new partnership between humanity and technology with the goal of transforming global health and revolutionizing many aspects of the medical and pharmaceutical industries, as well as government sectors. We aspire to improve lives and give hope by delivering innovation to address the world’s most pressing health challenges through data and artificial intelligence insights. As the SAP Finance-Controlling (FICO) Lead Consultant you will provide application functional support and implementation in SAP Applications, including the module areas of Controlling - Profitability Analysis (PA), Product Costing, Profitability Controlling Analysis (PCA), Cost Center Accounting (CCA), and Material Ledger. The SAP Application Functional Specialist will be very knowledgeable with required SAP product module/suite business processes, navigation mechanics, and configuration requirements and integration with other modules and SAP's Business Warehouse. You will maintain the configuration and functional design documents and support role-based profile changes. You must perform all tasks in the development cycle, starting from business process definition, to configuration and unit testing, assistance and follow-up with user testing, to co-ordination of transports to Production, to training and post-live support and fixes, etc. As the Lead Consultant you will be working with our top-tier clients to help them meet business needs through innovative solutions. You'll be a trusted advisor, helping our clients make better, informed decisions. Using in-depth consulting skills, business knowledge, and packaged solution expertise, you'll work directly with clients to select, implement, support and effectively integrate IBM's world-class packaged technology solutions into their diverse business environments. Facebook is seeking an analytical, process, detail-oriented business analyst who can partner effectively with Sales leadership. The ideal candidate will be passionate about Facebook, view the world through an analytical lens, be interested in advertising, have a love for operations and project management, the ability learn quickly, thrives with ambiguity, strong attention to detail, and be able to move fast while keeping focused on high-impact projects. Description  Amazon Flex  We are building a world class last mile delivery with Amazon Flex as a cornerstone of this strategy. Amazon Flex works directly with independent contractors, called delivery partners, to make deliveries to our customers. With Amazon Flex, delivery partners are their own boss, build their own schedule, and choose from different types of delivery opportunities (e.g. Prime Now, Amazon Fresh, Whole Foods Market, and Amazon Logistics). Amazon Flex is powered by a mobile app that works in sync with our advanced systems and processes, allowing delivery partners to secure delivery offers, track their delivery progress, and more.  Flex Supply Planning  Flex Supply Planning is a business-critical function, directly affecting customer experience by securing commitments for work from our delivery partners in response to forecast and emergent demand for labor. As the gateway for DPs to get work, we own their most immediate incentive to engage with Flex, and have a responsibility to make Flex the “gig of choice.” Our team is seeking experienced professionals to join our Flex Supply Planning team providing deep dives in key product metrics for both product launches and weekly business reviews. The insights and analyses will inform product designs, drive prioritization and investment focus, and ultimate influence the product roadmaps. Qualified candidates will bring their technical expertise to disambiguate problems by understanding and quantifying various input and output metrics. Also, they have the ability to conduct hypothesis-driven experiments to prove or disprove their assumptions. The right candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment with interactions across a wide variety of systems and stakeholders. As a Business Analyst, this role will be an integral part of tech team, working closely with Product, Science, Engineers, BI and Business Operations. You will serve as the subject matter expert on presenting data in an informative and actionable way and in a way that facilitates productive, cross-functional dialogue. You will help to build and define the strategy for Supply Planning team and its projects. You will help build analytical models, develop new techniques to process large data sets, apply statistical testing methods, address quantitative problems, build dashboards that enable leaders to better understand their business data, assess functional business performance, and develop targeted, scalable action plans. You will be responsible for designing and implementing tangible insights, business metrics, measurement systems that guide operations, projects, and product roadmaps. You will have an opportunity to publish findings, updates, and data driven recommendations to Senior Leadership. You will hold a highly visible role that requires interaction with leaders across operations.       BA/BS in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Engineering, and related field     Master’s degree in Statistics, Businesses, Engineering, or a related quantitative field   - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A1254890 Show more

Executes security controls to prevent hackers from infiltrating company information or jeopardizing e-commerce programs.  Researches attempted efforts to compromise security protocols. As part of the Global Business Units within the Security Operations Center, you will be part of a global Security Operations & Incident Response team identifying security events and coordinating the response for the relevant technical support groups, businesses at risk and service recovery teams. As a member of this fast-paced team, you will execute controls to protect the infrastructure and employees against internal and external malicious attacks and infiltration.  The security analyst is responsible to monitor and help maintain the security posture of the Global Business Units IT environments. These responsibilities include analyzing data to identify computer attacks and malware infections, responding to security incidents, documentation, analytical investigation and recommended proactive security threat countermeasures. Using cutting edge network behavior and anomaly detection tools, the analyst will examine, identify, and understand the nature of cyber-threats such as viruses, worms, bots, root kits and Trojan horses. In addition, it may be necessary to work directly with employees to collect, analyze and submit virus samples to our vendors, help remediate malware infections and prevent further damage. The analyst will be expected to participate in security project tasks on an as needed basis and interact directly with Security organizations and multiple Lines of Businesses globally. Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started. Facebook is seeking an experienced Security Policy and Compliance Analyst to join our team. This position will be responsible for understanding and supporting the design Facebook's organizational, procedural and technological security controls within the context of the global regulatory frameworks applicable to our business. The position will also help codify these controls in supporting documentation and explain them to internal and external stakeholders. This role requires a mix of broad, business and technical acumen, the ability to inspire and influence decisions pertaining to regulatory standards, and a polished ability to communicate with key internal stakeholders. Description  Are you interested in engineering the metrics model that drives continuous improvement for Amazon’s global delivery operations? Do you have solid problem solving skills, metrics-driven mindset and want to solve problems with solutions that will meet the growing worldwide need? Then Middle Mile Technology is the team for you. We are part of building the world's fastest, most reliable, and lowest cost transportation network that provides customers the most control and are looking for a top notch Sr. Business Analyst.  As Sr. Business Analyst, you will develop solutions to drive insights and optimization for Network Planning and Forecasting. As a member of this team, you will have an opportunity to be a pioneer in Amazon Logistics and collaborate with a group of talented program managers, product managers, research scientists, software developers, and business members to design the Amazon network of the future.  This position requires innovative thinking, ability to quickly approach large ambiguous problems and apply reason, technical and engineering expertise to rapidly research, validate, visualize, prototype and deliver solutions. This position also requires significant cross functional work and integration with transportation, tech, operations and finance. Successful candidates should thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.  As you further your career as a Business Analyst at Amazon, you will focus on improving corporate reporting frameworks and data visualization. You will research performance data, discover and solve real world problems and build metrics and business cases to make strategic business recommendations. We are focused on your success and want to build and support passionate innovators within Amazon's Middle Mile. You can expect to leverage your methodical skills and have full ownership of the projects you work on. The Master Customer Profile Service team at Oracle is committed to enabling our customer experience (CX) SaaS components to provide the most interactive & richest experience possible to our customers. Department Description  The Oracle Backup & Recovery Product Management team is comprised of a group of top quality, high energy, and highly experienced professionals, who handle product management responsibilities for all features and solutions related to Oracle Database Backup & Recovery technologies, including Recovery Manager (RMAN), Database Backup Cloud Service, Zero Data Loss Recovery Appliance, and Oracle Secure Backup (OSB).  Further details can be found at http://www.oracle.com/zdlra and http://www.oracle.com/ha .  This position is focused on Oracle Backup and Recovery Cloud Services. Typical product management activities include working very closely with customers and Engineering to define product strategy and functionality, managing ongoing strategic relationships with top tier customers, serving as the customer advocate within the Development organization, developing marketing plan and collateral, providing field support, performing competitive analyses, conducting demos, evangelizing and speaking at key conferences, etc. Being a part of this team will allow you to make significant contributions towards the success of Oracle Database Cloud Services, along with related products such as Recovery Appliance, Exadata Database Machine, as well as the Oracle Database, providing you with an extremely high degree of internal and external visibility.  Brief Description  Be a core member of a product management team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, development and marketing of features related to Oracle Database Backup and Recovery Cloud Services.    If you love enterprise technology, if you get fascinated by how quickly technology and the enterprise market landscape change, and you want to be a part of this process, contribute, and make an impact – read on.  The Oracle Backup & Recovery team is looking for a top class Product Manager, to be a member of the core team behind RMAN and Recovery Appliance, and the respective cloud service offerings. In this role, you will be working with an elite group of software developers and product managers to assist with current initiatives around developing and marketing Oracle’s capabilities for Backup and Recovery Cloud Services. You may also be expected to take complete product management ownership on selected areas as well as products to be released in the future. If you can deliver on a regular cadence and add value to the team, this could be the opportunity that propels your career. Oracle Cloud Infrastructure – OCI  Big Data Data Flow Services  Principal Product Manager (IC4)  Santa Clara, CA; Seattle, WA  Our Team  The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Data Flow team is part of the OCI Data & AI product management team. The OCI Data Flow portfolio includes Data Integration, Data Catalog, and the Data Management platform services to support other Data related OCI services. OCI is committed to providing the best cloud products that meet the needs of our customers who are tackling some of the world’s biggest challenges. OCI is revolutionizing Big Data with disruptive simple, cloud-native Big Data Services, which unlock Big Data for Enterprises that struggle to overcome Big Data complexities.  In February 2020, Oracle released OCI Data Flow, the industry’s first fully serverless Apache Spark service, and delivers 5 major advantages over existing Big Data solutions. Expanding on this, our charter is to build a fully managed, cloud-native data management suite where data can be ingested, updated and analyzed natively in the cloud using batch, interactive, or streaming patterns. This is your opportunity to join us in simplifying big data and accelerating its adoption around the globe.  The Opportunity  We are searching for a Principal Product Manager to join the OCI Data Flow Service Team. In this role, you will be the product leader focused on the current and future strategy for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Data Flow services. You will work collaboratively with other cloud services product managers in addition to engineering to define the requirements and deliver an innovative, market-leading common data services layer to support multiple cloud services. Your charter is to drive more data and workload to the Oracle Cloud ecosystem with the common data management platform. You will report to the Senior Director of Product Management based in Santa Clara, CA.  You will be joining the Inbound Product Management team developing our cloud-native big data service suite. Your contributions will span a mix of batch, interactive, and streaming services.    Drive key features/functions for our fully managed big data services.  Gather inputs from external and internal customers, validate and prioritize development plans, and write necessary documents to guide development.  Work closely with Development and Documentation teams during the development process, ensure that the service functionality built is consistent with customer expectations and that it also helps establish significant market leadership for Oracle compared to competing services.  Maintain deep relationships with key customers – as the Development advocate/sponsor for these customers, ensure their continued success with Oracle’s services, and in turn cultivate the relationships to develop highly effective marketing references.  Work with customers directly, Support, Sales, and Consulting teams to understand customer usage patterns to fine-tune the service roadmap.  Work with Corporate and Field Marketing to evangelize OCI services.  Plan and execute service announcements, and help coordinate beta testing.  Provide hands-on training for Customer Support and Technical Sales personnel, as well as for select customers.  Develop collateral such as technical and business white papers, success stories, datasheets, brochures, best practices, and presentations.  Maintain internal and external web sites on related technologies.  Present at Oracle user group meetings, trade shows, customer sites, industry conferences, industry analyst meetings, and at the Oracle Customer Visit Center.    8-10 years of product management experience  BS / MS in Computer Science or other technical backgrounds  Expertise in Big Data is a must, ideally in Apache Spark or building SQL products professionally  Excellent written and communication/presentation skills  High-level understanding of engineering architecture plus experience working with engineering teams to deliver products or services  Analytical skills, with a passion to solve complex technology and business problems and an aptitude to learn new things  Ability to dig into the weeds as needed while at the same time able to rise up above the weeds, always keeping in mind the bigger picture  Experience dealing with a broad spectrum of IT audience – ranging from CTO/CIO to database/systems/network/storage administrators  Excellent teamwork, leadership, and people management skills  A can-do attitude, with a focus on deliverables and deadlines  This job involves US-domestic and international travel on an as-needed basis. IBM Corporate Strategy is IBM’s internal management consulting organization. It focuses on the most important and high-impact IBM-wide opportunities and challenges. The Corporate Strategy team engages with IBM senior leadership and internal client teams across Business Units to solve complex problems and inform decision-making. A few examples of the group’s impact: it drove the launch of IBM Blockchain, shaped cutting-edge technologies such as Quantum Computing and AI, and developed IBM’s Hybrid Cloud strategy, including the acquisition of Red Hat – one of the largest tech acquisitions in history.  The Corporate Strategy Consultant is an integral member of the Corporate Strategy team, responsible for analyzing problems, formulating hypotheses, developing insights, and delivering recommendations to drive growth and transformation. As a Corporate Strategy Consultant, you will work across IBM Business Units, gaining exposure to multiple industries as well as investigating new market opportunities and business models. As a recognized authority and leading contributor within their practice, this senior-level consulting position provides consistent high quality and innovative solution leadership to a project team. Leads the solution design and implementation aspects of engagement(s) ensuring high quality, integrated software solutions within constraints of time and budget.  Analyzes business needs to help ensure Oracle solution meets the customer’s objectives by combining industry best practices, product knowledge, and business acumen. Exercises judgment and business acumen in selecting methods and techniques to deliver functional and technical solutions on non-routine and very complex aspects of applications and technology installations. Provides direction and mentoring to project teams, and effectively influences customer leadership on key decisions. Supports the business development efforts by pursuing new opportunities and extensions. Collaborates with the consulting sales team by providing domain expertise. Resolves complex customer issues by recommending and implementing solutions. Demonstrates expertise in multiple business processes across two or more product families or ability to architect and design technology solutions encompassing multiple products and make decisions based on impact across the stack.  8-10 years of experience relevant to this position including 4 years of consulting experience. Prior team leadership or management experience preferred. Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience preferred. Product or technical expertise relevant to practice focus. Ability to communicate effectively. Ability to build rapport with team members and clients. Strong influencing and negotiation skills. Ability to travel as needed.      Oracle ERP Cloud Projects Functional Solution Architect– Projects/Grants (PPM – Projects Portfolio Management) with experience in the following modules: Project Accounting, Grants, Project Costing and Project Billing, ideally in a Public Sector environment.  You will provide functional leadership for assigned project role focused on implementing Oracle Cloud Projects/Grants (PPM) applications and any relative solution design, business process analysis, and system integration. Analyst will act as a Subject Matter Expert for the Oracle Cloud Projects application consulting team supporting the configuration and extension of the Oracle Cloud Projects modules.  This position is to analyze business needs to help ensure Oracle solution meets the customer’s objectives by combining industry best practices, product knowledge, and business acumen. As a position of technical/professional influence, this individual frequently operates at the leading edge of technology.  The successful candidate will recommend and justify enhancements to Oracle products to meet very complex customer needs. Exercises creativity and independent judgment in developing methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria to deliver functional and technical expertise on a wide range of business and technology solutions. Leads experienced consulting teams on challenging projects; works on significant and unique issues. Enables business development efforts by providing subject matter expertise. Resolves very complex customer escalations. Drives customer process direction and decisions by providing domain leadership within relevant industries on end-to-end enterprise solutions.  Understanding Oracle Projects/Grants functionality and capabilities to drive the teams to design and develop application along with assisting with quarterly update testing and new feature evaluation. Description  The Alexa Devices Team is looking for an insightful and analytical Business Intelligence Analyst with strong business and technical skills to join our rapidly growing Business Intelligence team. In this role, you will be partners to various executive, product management, engineering, finance, and sales & marketing teams that power Alexa’s Echo Family of devices. Your work will be instrumental to achieving its mission, be highly visible to Amazon leadership, and will drive key strategic company goals.  We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to work closely with our core business leaders to unlock key insights and trends from our data. As an analytics leader on our team, you will develop advanced models and tools, conduct statistical analyses, evaluate large data sets, and create tailored models and dashboards. Additionally, you will be instrumental in the creation of a reliable and scalable infrastructure for ongoing reporting and analytics. You will be structuring ambiguous problems and designing analytics across various disciplines which will result in actionable recommendations ranging from strategic planning, product strategy/launches, and engineering improvements to marketing campaign optimization, customer servicing trending, and competitive research.               - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A1235922 Show more

Description  The Amazon Kindle Fraud and Abuse prevention team is looking for an experienced individual to help drive business results through data. As a senior Business Analyst, you will uphold customer trust by building robust technical and analytical solutions to help us prevent fraud.  Our team works to protect Kindle readers and authors, as well as other Amazon services. We are constantly working to predict and prevent future issues so that our customers can have the best experience. We use sophisticated Machine Learning (ML) methods to detect and mitigate fraud as it is attempted. We build solutions that scale and work for the long term. We hold high standards for our computer systems and the services we deliver to our customers: our systems are highly secure, highly reliable, highly available, all while functioning at scale.  As a Sr. BA you will be in the forefront of creating fraud prevention intelligence. You will analyze large volumes of data and convert them into actionable insights for fraud mitigation,propose solutions to address ambiguous problems, and enable others to consume this intelligence. You will propose and define metrics for business reporting and product/process performance monitoring.  You will provide thought leadership and business analysis support as needed. The successful candidate will demonstrate business acumen, experience in developing reporting and analytical infrastructures and ability to work effectively with cross functional teams in a fast paced environment. You should have excellent business and communication skills to collaborate with business owners to draw insights from data to answer questions to key business questions. Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started. Facebook is seeking to fill a full-time position of Supplier Master Analyst in our Finance operations center. This role will be responsible for building and managing our growing supplier data including supplier onboarding, supplier maintenance and/or providing quality assurance over onboarding and maintenance requests. We are seeking a professional with Procure-to-Pay, finance, accounts payable, audit, and/or related experience in a global company. This role will work closely with the Field Marketing and BI/Finance team to unlock insights, and present complex information to multiple levels and roles within our organization in ways that others understand and can apply to their daily work. Description  Kindle e-readers are among the bestselling products in the history of Amazon, with a rich legacy for driving customer focused innovation. Our growth requires leaders who operate both strategically and tactically: think big to drive new opportunities; dive deep in data to uncover customer insights; break down and solve complex problems; and drive operational excellence.  The Kindle Sales, Product, and Product Marketing team is seeking a customer-obsessed, exceptionally strong analytical thinker to develop and execute a portfolio of analytically-heavy research and experimental programs intended to: inform brand strategy, new product development, and product positioning; drive customer demand; improve customer experience; and increase marketing and advertising effectiveness.  The role is both strategic and operational, and requires someone who can think big while diving into the details to execute flawlessly. This candidate will be expected to: develop a strong understanding of the Kindle business' long-term objectives and customer base; act as a consultant to worldwide sales, product, and product marketing teams; and possess fine-tuned project management and influencing skills to work across multiple teams to achieve success. Lastly, the ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a fast-paced, ambiguous, high-pressure entrepreneurial environment. Additionally, this role will assist in the preparation of weekly and monthly reports on the benefit administration team’s KPIs. Description  The Recruiting Engine Team is reinventing how we recruit at Amazon. Recruiting the right candidates across all of Amazon is critical to our ability to innovate and build on behalf of customers. As the search for talent becomes more competitive, we are bringing together recruiting, science, tech, programs, and process teams to find and hire candidates who raise the bar more quickly and efficiently.  Data is a foundational component to making this happen. In this role you will be responsible for navigating a wealth of data and turning it into actionable and insightful information for recruiting and business partners which enables our stakeholders to make informed people decisions.  The Sr. Business Analyst provides people metrics and insights along the employee lifecycle for Amazon's Software Development Engineer (SDE) channel across business lines. Description  The Business Intelligence Manager will manage a team of Business Analysts. It will be your responsibility, along with the PMO Manager and the Technical Product Manager to assign individual BA’s to specific projects or tasks. Alongside the management duties, you will also perform a certain amount of Business Intelligence analysis tasks in line with that of the BI consultant. As a Business Intelligence Manager you will have excellent skills in extracting, interpreting and presenting data and insights to support our various supply chain initiatives as well as proactively identifying improvement opportunities. You will lead the data analysis activities across our supply chain organization to bring together stakeholder needs and technical capabilities in order to define solutions that deliver value, often working across large complex projects or a number of projects. You must be a highly accomplished analytical tactician skilled in data profiling, conceptual data modelling and requirements gathering, with demonstrated success at guiding major BI projects and programs across multiple company functional areas. In addition, you will build and manage relationships with internal as well as external senior stakeholders. You will need to be driven and possess strong stakeholder management, analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as proven project management skills and experience. You will also need outstanding communication interpersonal and presentation skills, be highly organized with excellent attention to detail and be used to prioritizing tasks in line with project deadline requirements.. Description  Business/Team Introduction The Buying team is part of Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technology / Inventory Planning and Control organization, and is responsible for deciding how much inventory to carry of every single item offered by Amazon Retail on all of Amazon’s websites worldwide. Consuming inputs including demand forecasts, placement options, and vendor capability data, our buying system automatically computes the optimal inventory levels and re-order quantities for every single item in our Retail catalog every single day. As a Business Intelligence Engineer/Data Analyst in Buying, you will operate at the apex of multiple Amazon systems, getting global visibility of how Amazon functions and serves our customers. Your curious mind will enable the creation of solutions that drive automation, scalability and optimization of every aspect of buying, reducing cost and delivering speed of execution to thrill our customers. The impact of your work will be global, material and remarkable.  Business Intelligence Engineer/Data Analyst Responsibilities As a successful Business Intelligence Engineer/ Data Analyst in Buying, you need to be curious about Amazon’s supply chain operations and how data consumed and produced by our systems can be used to improve outcomes and lower costs. Your responsibility is to develop metrics, expose and measure the current performance of our Buying system, find and quantify opportunities for improvement, and dive deep into existing data to root cause unexpected performance. You will collaborate with engineering, research, data science and business teams for future innovation. You need to be a sophisticated user of data querying tools, and an expert at synthesizing and communicating insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication.    Major responsibilities include:  Measure / Quantify / Expand  Explore / Enlighten  Make Decisions or Recommendations        - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A804185 Show more

We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our HR Surface Transportation team in Seattle, WA.  The Business Analyst III, Surface Transportation role is both a strategic and hands-on role that provides Human Resources support to our Surface Transportation HRMs, BPs, and PMs. This role will help HR Surface Transportation build out the technical infrastructure needed to scale our growing business operations. Day-to-day activities include report automation, providing data insights, writing papers, and executing on large project deliverables independently without much guidance. You will utilize a variety of tools to navigate requests, be expected to conduct research and analysis on a wide range of data, as well as communicate effective solutions in a fun and fast-paced environment. Job Description  DESCRIPTION  Do you enjoy diving deep on complex problems? Do you have a history of designing data and using KPIs to guide business decisions? Are you excited about diving deep into success patterns and opportunities, turning new insights into actions for product teams to accelerate adoption of state-of-the-art technical product features? Join a team whose mission is to maximize the productivity of Amazon employees. Amazon Web Services (AWS) products and development team for IT Support is seeking a talented Senior Business Analyst with the passion and strategic vision to build and grow IT Products/Services measurement methodology, metrics development, report automation, and insights to understand the value provided by our products and services to hundreds of thousands of Amazonians and to the IT Services business.  As the Sr. Business Analyst for metrics development, you insist on the highest standards, have a bias for action, and bring a history of delivering results. You own the assessment of our metrics catalog and evangelize adoption throughout IT products and development teams. You will use your connections with IT Services and AWS leadership to guide the research and development of both standard product metrics and innovative value proposition measurement. You will maintain a relentless focus on the customer and dive deep into the challenges they face. You have great judgement and can advise which opportunities drive the most strategic value for the business.  You will be responsible for measuring the success of our products, and designing new and better ways to identify how we can be more successful. This is a unique opportunity to focus on strategy, automation, and longer-term innovation in metrics and measurement. You will create and deliver reporting and analysis to ensure that our products are effective. Additionally, you will be seeking opportunities to drive efficiency within the teams’ workflows to maximize productivity and proficiency through data analysis. Your work will be shared with leadership and will be influential in evaluating the effectiveness of the product teams. Your advice will be leveraged to ensure that all of our products/services are designed with data analysis in-mind from the very start. You will also work with partner teams, understand their best practices, find useful data sources, and scope and conduct your own analysis. This role spans measurement across all of Amazon’s IT Services products including self-service, support engagement, automation, and asset management. This is a visible role in an exciting space and growing team. You will be required to work with business leaders across product management, software development, business intelligence, data science, and engineering. This Sr. Business Analyst oversees IT Services product measurement program, which guides the development of innovative insights for our Amazonian customers, based on product and support interactions. The program helps teams answer key questions when assessing the overall product effectiveness. You will own of the product metrics catalog and the routine assessment process that drives experimentation and innovation of new metrics. You will use data to understand business performance, developing insights based on your work, and summarizing your findings for leadership consumption. You are responsible for the ongoing development of the program and communicating progress toward the goal of improving the quality of products/services metrics, including new and innovative metrics that promote our unique value proposition. Description  Love food? We do! The Grocery operations finance team is seeking an experienced and innovative Business Analyst to help shape the future of grocery pickup and delivery. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a groundbreaking initiative using advanced technology to solve difficult and interesting problems. You will support the rapid growth of this initiative by developing business metrics, mining data to uncover consumer insights and business opportunity, and partnering with internal stakeholders to drive the business. The ideal candidate will be highly analytical with proven experience delivering results. Develop and deliver content for cross functional operational reviews with internal leadership. Employ data mining, segmentation, and other analytical techniques to capture important trends and create relevant measurement dashboards. Support senior management by managing metrics reporting and performing data mining and data analysis to provide strategic advice on business forecast models. Collect business use cases, research and evaluate opportunities to help Amazon leverage its data to support business functions through complex mathematical modeling. Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation, and model implementation. Description  The Amazon Ops Talent Development team is looking for a Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) for the WW Virtual Training Program who enjoys the challenge of diving into complex business problems, providing data driven insights, and making recommendations that directly impact business. The Sr. BIE will use broad technical skills to build analytic and reporting capabilities that enable optimization of Virtual Training. The Virtual Training Program seeks to provide a friction-free experience for Associates to take training at home by integrating several internal systems. This role is currently a individual contributor role, but has potential for team leadership.  The ideal candidate is a highly analytical, critical thinker with advanced problem solving, data mining, and data engineering or software development skills. The Sr. BIE will work closely with learning specialists, program managers, BIEs, business analysts and data engineers to drive solutions. Successful members of this team are customer obsessed, flexible, good communicators and collaborative team players who enjoying working across functions and organizations to solve problems and get results. They thrive in ambiguity, ask hard questions, and build scalable solutions that provide critical business insights necessary to influence decision making across organizations. They find timely answers buried in large data sets and complex systems, identify root causes, and are obsessed with generating business insights. This position requires superior analytical thinkers, able to quickly approach large ambiguous problems and apply technical and engineering expertise to rapidly prototype and deliver solutions. The BIE Manager is a leader on the team and others look to them for advice on analytical and business issues they are facing. They are right a lot, work efficiently, and routinely deliver results on time. They have a global view of the analytical solutions that they build and consistently think in terms of automating, expanding, and scaling the results broadly.             Show more

Description  At Amazon, we're working to be the most Customer-centric company on earth. One customer experience that we’re constantly looking to take to a new level is how we deliver the right experience for our business customers. Our vision is to revolutionize support so our business customers can focus on their businesses. To meet this goal, we are continually innovating, improving, and eliminating upstream defects by implementing repeatable mechanisms and innovative products.  Amazon Business Customer Service (ABCS) is seeking a results driven and structured Senior Business Intelligence Engineer who will be part of a team that is re-defining the Customer Support model for business customers. As a Senior Business Intelligence Engineer, you will work closely with other Business Intelligence Engineers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Business Analytics and Product and Program Managers across Amazon Customer Service to build and maintain a scalable reporting infrastructure for the AB CS team. In addition to owning the infrastructure, you will be gathering customer insights, mining data, making recommendations, and acting as a key strategic partner to help senior leaders make key business decisions. You will have the opportunity to work with one of the largest and most complex data warehouses in the world to gather insights using data from across Amazon.  This role requires a customer obsessed individual with statistical and analytical abilities, knowledge of business intelligence solutions, and business acumen. You are a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, attention to detail, and an ability to work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. You have a bias towards data-driven decision making, and are excited by the prospect of collaborating with cross functional teams to define and implement solutions that will yield benefits to Amazon Business customers around the world. Description  Centralized Timekeeping is seeking an experienced Business Operations manager to support the growth of our time organization globally. This position will be responsible for implementing KPIs and measuring performance of the organization, supplying leadership with relevant and timely data and facts on health of the functions. This individual will identify, develop and deploy scalable mechanisms to manage the rhythm of the activities such as business reviews, goal setting and tracking mechanisms, headcount and location strategies, as well as other cadenced reporting and metrics.  This individual will need to collaborate effectively with internal end-users across the globe and data teams to solve problems, implement new reporting solutions, and deliver successfully against high standards. This is a hands-on position - the ideal candidate must be willing to “roll up the sleeves”.  This position will work with the several stakeholders including finance, space planning, service delivery leadership, economists, and data insight teams to facilitate knowledge sharing, best practice dissemination and alignment. The individual must have the ability to communicate effectively across various business units, as well as across geographies.    As Operations Manager, your role is critical and highly visible across the organization.  The successful candidate is analytical and possesses a passion for developing insights from data. The candidate should be able to communicate those insights effectively to business stakeholders. This requires excellent business acumen and communication skills as well as the ability to work with business leaders to develop and define key business questions. The candidate will also be able to collect information and design the analysis model that answers these questions. The candidate will demonstrate critical analytical thinking and the willingness to dive deep. Lastly, the candidate should be have a technical proficiency in Excel and preferably Tableau/Quicksight.       Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Description  Have you ever thought about what it takes to deliver high quality customer service at optimal cost? What would you do to take one of the best customer service organizations in the world to the next level? Do you enjoy working in an entrepreneurial, fast paced environment, solving complex problems and delivering innovative solutions? Do you like to innovate and simplify?  The Worldwide Capacity Planning (WWCP) organization owns the end-to-end workforce planning and execution of Amazon's customer service network. Our forecasting, labor planning, scheduling, and real-time management solutions are responsible for the millions of daily decisions needed to provide efficient and frustration-free support to our customers around the world. We are looking for an experienced professional with excellent analytical skills and strong business acumen to join our Forecasting team.  As a Senior Forecast Analyst in WWCP, you will be responsible for modeling forecasting problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, machine learning, algorithmic, data mining and visualization techniques. You will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to analyze forecast variances, understand and mitigate variance drivers, identify opportunities to improve operational efficiencies, and deliver successfully against high organizational standards. You should be able to apply a breadth of tools, data sources and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and present the insights in concise and effective manner. Additionally, you should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical audiences. This is a high impact role with goals that directly impacts the bottom line of the business. Accurate forecasts drive improvements in cost and quality of our customer service on a global scale.  This role requires a delicate balance in delivering models that are statistically grounded but also explainable operationally - business leaders must be able to understand what variables impact forecast variance and how they should respond tactically. This is a high visibility role with heavy interaction with senior leadership. Analytical ingenuity and leadership, coupled with demonstrated cross-functional partnership, are critical skills for this role.  The ideal candidate has an accomplished professional background with demonstrated proficiency in advanced mathematics and/or statistics. They are comfortable creating strategic recommendations in a thoughtful yet concise manner, and obtaining organizational "buy-in" at senior levels. They are well-organized, can manage multiple analyses/projects simultaneously, and are intellectually curious.       Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Description  Want to be on the forefront of the retail business? Come work on the team that is focused on driving retail profitability.  We are seeking a Senior Business Intelligence Engineer to join the Profit Intelligence (PI) team that owns Contribution Profit (CP) and delivers profitability metrics, insights and automated decision-making for the WW Consumer businesses. CP produces item-level profitability metrics for each item shipped and is used in both managerial reporting and automated systems across the WW Consumer businesses. CP utilizes economic, financial, and business fundamentals to attribute costs and revenues to millions of shipments a day to drive informed decision-making at many levels.  As a Senior Business Intelligence Engineer, you will work with our Finance and Tech team to create automated and scalable analytical tools, provide insights, and drive improved decision making at the item level. You will work with finance, economists, business, and tech to gain input and deliver tools that meet our customer needs. You will empower data driven decision making through implementing principles of data mining, Machine Learning, data modelling and analytical skills to define and measure metrics for evaluating health of the business. You will be able to extract, integrate and work on critical data to build out data pipelines, automate reports and dashboards to communicate your findings and leverage self-service tools to internal stakeholders. This includes building the infrastructure for regular reporting on business performance, deep diving financial processes and systems across Consumer, and writing the logic for accuracy metrics and opportunity valuation. Description  Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of eCommerce and advertising, offering a rich array of digital display advertising solutions with the goal of helping our customers find and discover anything they want to buy. We help advertisers reach Amazon customers on Amazon.com, across our other owned and operated sites, on other high quality sites across the web, and on millions of Kindles, tablets, and mobile devices. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do, including advertising. Description  Eliminating borders for buyers and sellers, Global Shipping facilitates Amazon's expansion into a rapidly growing list of countries, creating new logistical benchmarks and "firsts" through disruptive innovation. Our multicultural, multilingual team works with merchants, sellers, providers, governments and trade officials from the busiest to the most remote locations around the world, applying a global perspective with a local approach. The products and capabilities enabled by this role will deliver unprecedented selection while innovating beyond established supply chain norms. The right candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment with interactions across a wide variety of e-commerce topics, and will demonstrate competence in multiple fields and skill sets.  As a Program Manager for Global Shipping, this role is responsible for coordinating multiple stakeholder teams, to ensure successful launch of new products and/or features. The individual will ensure that our resources are focused on developing products and features that are appealing to our customers and results in high levels of adoption in our targeted segments. The person is responsible to develop comprehensive plans with clear measurable and deliverables across business opportunities, product, operations, sales and marketing that will ensure that we launch and scale our programs in line with our goals and objectives. These programs will require collaboration and/or co-lead with functional peers such as in Marketing, Product, Sales, Research, BI/Finance, Operations, and include launching new business segments, go to market strategies for large scale product/feature launches and revenue growth; promotional campaigns to drive adoption in specific categories or client segments; initiatives that will drive higher level of commitment from our customer base. In addition, the person will be responsible for developing customer value proposition, working closely with sales and marketing to refine and improve our external campaigns. This role will also manage our weekly and monthly business reviews, and our overall roadmap definition, interacting with senior leaders to secure inputs and communicate overall plans. As a critical member of the Cross Border Product team, the person will drive Voice of the Seller campaigns and similar customer/seller research & analysis efforts, as well as Selection Expansion initiatives. This role will interact with multiple stakeholders across the organization, keeping them informed on progress to targets, plans to close any gaps and possible roadmap adjustments based on feedback from the Sellers and Business Trends. In addition to day to day responsibilities, this person will work closely with Global Selling leaders to determine our global expansion strategy and assist in prioritizing the business opportunity and justification. Our SDE will lead the development of several new front end interfaces that will provide a robust end to end user experience managing all aspects of the ER Teams operations. This SDE, will also work closely with numerous partner organizations like World Wide Operations, Connections, PeopleInsights and HR partners to and develop innovative solutions in large areas of blank space. These products will support a vast network of partner organizations and will be highly visible across multiple orgs in Amazon.  What is Employee Relations at Amazon you ask? The Employee Relations team is responsible for reducing risk to the business by deploying programs, tools and solutions to empower the identification of defects in our employee experience across all roles in the WW Ops org. Our products and programs are global in scale and we continually innovate to transform and improve the employee experience. Inclusive Team Culture Our team has a developed a reputation for attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Yes we do get to build a really cool service and work closely with our customers, but we also think a big reason for our diversity is the inclusive and welcoming culture we try to cultivate every day. As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.  We are seeking an experienced data analyst capable of leading and supporting studies assessing the mission performance of Intelligence Community (IC) elements tasked with countering threats of weapons of mass destruction (WMD) proliferation. The customer is the mission manager for the Counterproliferation (CP) WMD mission, developing and coordinating strategy for the U.S. program, assessing performance against that strategy, and implementing key initiatives to advance the CP mission.  The Data Analyst will be part of a team of IBM consultants and will provide full-time, on-site direct support to government personnel who require analytics expertise.     IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.  What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.  IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.  For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.  Show more

Manage the development and implementation process of a specific company product.  Manage the development and implementation process of a specific company product involving departmental or cross-functional teams focused on the delivery of new or existing products. Plan and direct schedules and monitor budget/spending. Monitor the project from initiation through delivery. Organize the interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget constraints. Assign and monitor work of systems analysis and program staff, providing technical support and direction.  Duties and tasks are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 5 years of project management, product design or related experience preferred.    Oracle Corporation is making large global investments to deliver the most open, secure, reliable, and transformative Cloud platform to help its customers through their generational shift to the cloud. Database Product Operations is responsible for commercializing Mission Critical Database (MCDB) technologies products and services that includes providing business operations and analysis to influence decision making for product and GTM teams to move the business forward. Includes Oracle Database, Autonomous Database, and Exadata Platform (On-premises, Cloud at Customer, OCI Public Cloud). Scope includes quarterly business reviews, cloud billing / metering, pricing, deal support, capacity planning, feature analysis, and operations budget.  As a member of this team, you will be influencing the growth and success of Oracle Database products and services by supporting the executive leadership team. Example of projects range from the very strategic to the very operational: Go-to-market planning, revenue forecasting, capacity planning, data center region planning, Service Discount rate, purchase patterns, sales pipeline analysis, market analyst briefings, competitive market analysis. Deliverables include robust analytic models, monthly / quarterly business reviews, ad-hoc analysis, sales dashboards, and the packaging of data into query-able data sets.  Our team members have solid skill-set in analyzing data and communicating recommendations, looking at different angles of a product or business opportunity, and know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. Seeking self-starters, someone that enjoys tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating findings to a team leader the next. Candidate will be the BI subject matter export topics related to platform usage, bookings, and revenue.          Product Development    Yes, 25 % of the Time    US-CA,California-Redwood City    US-WA,Washington-Seattle    Regular Employee Hire    Oracle Show more

Executes security controls to prevent hackers from infiltrating company information or jeopardizing e-commerce programs.  Researches attempted efforts to compromise security protocols. Maintains security systems for routers and switches. Administers security policies to control access to systems. Maintains the company*s firewall. Uses applicable encryption methods. Provides information to management regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration or denial of access to information.  Job duties are varied and complex; independent judgment needed. May have project lead role. Prefer 5 years relevant experience and BA/BS degree.      Behind every mission-critical Cloud service is a sophisticated SaaS architecture supporting the largest companies in the world, employing the most advanced software engineering. We are proud to support those services and team with customers who depend on them, continually innovating and challenging the status quo. Our team environment is progressive, flexible, professionally challenging, rewarding, and fun. We are looking for experienced security engineers to join our efforts in reshaping the cloud services landscape across industry verticals to revolutionize the delivery of Cloud Services to the world’s most critical organizations. The SaaS Cloud Security (SCS) organization is responsible for securing enterprise-grade software services on behalf of our 25,000 customers, processing over 60 billion transactions per day.  We are building a team of analysts in the US that can work across 24x7x365 shifts to carry out activities in the areas of monitoring and detection and response to protect the Oracle SaaS environment. The team will be able to collectively cover the breadth and depth of: monitoring for Indicators of Compromise, being up to date with the latest industry trends and Threat Intelligence, and escalating identified incidents for the attack remediation, evidence collection and forensics efforts. Team members need to currently hold an Active or Inactive (not expired )Top Secret (TS)/ADP I clearance for Critical-Sensitive Positions.
