The Role    As an Operations Manager, you will have the opportunity to lead an inbound operation, outbound operation, or a functional process on a specified shift or across multiple shifts within an Amazon Fulfillment Center. You will be responsible for leading, developing and engaging a team of exceptional talent that makes innovation possible. One of your main focuses will be motivating, mentoring and coaching your team to become the best leaders they can be. To achieve this, Operations Managers are creative problem solvers who are able to dream in immense scale, interpret big data and deliver meaningful results that keenly drive productivity and efficiency.  Supporting all safety programs and OSHA compliance to ensure a safe work environment for all associates and managers Leading and developing a team of 3-7 Area Managers (front-line supervisors) and 100-300 hourly associates by embodying Amazon’s Leadership Principles Acting as the primary information source for the team, maintaining compliance and consistency and taking corrective action when needed Mentoring, training and developing teammates for career progression, performance improvement and recognition purposes Creating, communicating and maintaining quality control policies and standard work procedures to Area Managers and associates Proactively identifying and leading process improvement initiatives using Lean tools to delight customers Building and delivering productivity plans by reviewing work forecasts, determining productivity requirements and partnering with other Operations Managers to balance labor Evaluating performance objectives and metrics to determine inbound or outbound productivity requirements to achieve customer time, accuracy, and quality expectations Partnering with other managers to share best practices across shifts and the network    We are committed to developing a diverse workforce and we are even more committed to working with you to make that happen. Depending on the type of job, you will be required to engage in physical warehouse activities with or without reasonable accommodation.  Lifting and moving material up to 49 pounds each Bending, lifting, stretching and reaching both below the waist and above the head Frequent walking in the building and around area; facilities are over a quarter mile in length Standing and walking for up to 10-12 hours a day Ascending and descending ladders, stairs and gangways safely and without limitation  What do we offer? Amazon offers competitive compensation packages including comprehensive healthcare benefits starting on Day 1 and up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave. We grant each employee ownership in the company, including Amazon stock awards and a matching 401(k) program. But, if you’re not in it for those perks, here is one more: we don’t wear suits and ties! Come as you are because jeans, t-shirts, sneakers and sometimes a neon safety vest will be your daily outfit. Jeff Bezos’s most recent letter to shareholders sums it all up pretty well. Find it at https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1018724/000119312516530910/d168744dex991.htm  Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.       Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age   - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A1214103 Show more

Description  The Business Intelligence Manager will manage a team of Business Analysts. It will be your responsibility, along with the PMO Manager and the Technical Product Manager to assign individual BA’s to specific projects or tasks. Alongside the management duties, you will also perform a certain amount of Business Intelligence analysis tasks in line with that of the BI consultant. As a Business Intelligence Manager you will have excellent skills in extracting, interpreting and presenting data and insights to support our various supply chain initiatives as well as proactively identifying improvement opportunities. You will lead the data analysis activities across our supply chain organization to bring together stakeholder needs and technical capabilities in order to define solutions that deliver value, often working across large complex projects or a number of projects. You must be a highly accomplished analytical tactician skilled in data profiling, conceptual data modelling and requirements gathering, with demonstrated success at guiding major BI projects and programs across multiple company functional areas. In addition, you will build and manage relationships with internal as well as external senior stakeholders. You will need to be driven and possess strong stakeholder management, analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as proven project management skills and experience. You will also need outstanding communication interpersonal and presentation skills, be highly organized with excellent attention to detail and be used to prioritizing tasks in line with project deadline requirements..             Show more

Introduction At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Your Role and Responsibilities    IBMers don’t stand still; we continually innovate, staying ahead of the ever-changing world we live in. The IBM Supply Chain organization is a values driven team responsible for delivering world class products and solutions to our clients and partners. Our teams strive to unleash the power of new technologies to create a transparent, intelligent, predictive global supply chain for today and for the future. We offer dynamic, exciting careers that allow individuals to forge their own paths, be it an analytical path, leadership path, or a mix of both. Professional development is an important part of any IBMer’s career, and is ongoing with on-the-job training, structured learning programs, and mentorships.  You will be immersed in the operations of either Demand Planning, Materials Management, Business Operations, Manufacturing Support or Transformation, exposing you to many aspects of the business and many of the basic supply chain functions of the company. Over your stay at IBM, you will gain a unique and in-depth understanding of the business and what makes it work. Specific roles and responsibilities will vary with the individual positions. You will be expected to analyze and interpret complex data, assist in implementation of advanced technologies such as AI, Blockchain and IoT, while working on solving Supply Chain challenges. If you enjoy collaborating globally, utilizing data analysis to provide actionable insights, and have a passion to drive innovation, then we ask you: are you ready to join the company that has become essential to the world, driven by that same passion?  These are office based positions in IBM locations including the following. Opportunities in these locations will vary based on demand & will be deleted as filled:  NY - Poughkepsie MN - Rochester PA - Camp Hill  Required Technical and Professional Expertise     Bachelor's degree    IBM Systems helps IT leaders think differently about their infrastructure. IBM servers and storage are no longer inanimate - they can understand, reason, and learn so our clients can innovate while avoiding IT issues. Our systems power the world’s most important industries and our clients are the architects of the future. Join us to help build our leading-edge technology portfolio designed for cognitive business and optimized for cloud computing.  Your Life @ IBM What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.    IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.  Location Statement IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.  We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.  Being You @ IBM IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.  Show more

Description  Amazon Transportation Services (ATS) Middle Mile Partner Management manages best-in-class surface transportation programs for our internal and external customers. Connecting vendors, fulfillment centers, sort centers, air gateways, USPS and final mile delivery stations, if a truck load needs to be moved, we deliver results. Amazon is one of the most recognizable brand names in the world and we distribute over a billion shipments each year to our loyal customers. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, customer-centric, bright, and driven people.  We are looking for an organized self-starter who excels at internal stakeholder management and external third party management to join the ATS Transportation Execution Team. We are seeking Transportation Program Managers to support our network throughout the United States. This person is responsible for managing successful transportation execution and programs across specific nodes. This is a high collaborative role and will require work cross-functionally across various teams to be able to meet deliverables.  The ideal candidate will have experience with cross-organization communications and will ensure key information cascades consistently and smoothly across stakeholder organizations. He or she will also possess excellent analytical and problem solving skills. If you have demonstrated an ability to innovate for the customer and want to create the best-in-class transportation experience, then come join our team.    #NALH       Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A1287780 Show more

As a Supply Chain Engineering Professional at IBM, you’ll get to work on the systems that are driving the quantum revolution and the AI era. Join an elite team of engineering professionals who enable IBM customers to make better decisions quicker on the most trusted hardware platform in today’s market.  We are seeking dynamic and hardworking engineers with a growth mindset to enable our teams and suppliers to deliver quality products. Are you seeking an opportunity that helps you grow your career at an equal opportunity company like IBM?  This role entails working with technical teams encompassing suppliers, development, and manufacturing on early product development, qualification, quality management and also for ongoing production support. This role will enable your growth in several aspects of supply chain engineering such as: qualification, technology convergence, environmental compliance, process improvements, manufacturing assembly, manufacturing test, and quality support such as production yields, field performance, tooling, changes and product delivery. This role focuses on leading and developing technology roadmaps, communicating technical specifications and driving continuous quality improvement. Description  The Global Specialty Fulfillment team at Amazon is looking for an experienced Supply Chain Manager with a strong delivery record and senior leadership experience to own and manage strategic, cross-functional operations and business initiatives. As a Supply Chain manager, you will use analytical, technical, program management, and operations management skills to develop plans for partner teams to execute. As a member of this team, you will be a thought leader and will work cross functionally to design the Amazon fulfillment network of the future. You will help craft new fulfillment concepts to integrate into our network to improve the overall customer experience and reduce the total cost of fulfillment. The role includes writing documents that present a clear view on Supply Chain Strategy, developing tech requirements to enhance our planning efforts and ensuring our fulfillment network is robust to address future challenges and growth.      #gsfsupplychain       #GSFSupplyChain Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Description  The Global Specialty Fulfillment (GSF) Supply Chain team is responsible for building the next generation supply chain for Amazon’s world-class ultra-fast customer experiences, including Prime Now, Amazon Fresh, Amazon Go, Treasure Truck, Amazon Business, Whole Foods and other soon-to-launch exciting new businesses. Online grocery and ultra-fast delivery is growing at an exponential rate and with planned expansion and marketing initiatives, we expect volume to grow several orders of magnitude this year and in the future. Come be a part of a 100+ Fulfillment Center and Distribution Center network across North America, Europe and APAC – serving highly engaged customers in as fast as 60 minutes! This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in groundbreaking initiatives to solve challenging and interesting problems as we build the first ever distribution network and supply chain capabilities tailored to grocery and ultra-fast customer offerings.  The GSF Supply Chain team is looking for an experienced Supply Chain Manager with a strong delivery record and senior leadership experience to own and manage strategic, cross-functional operations and technology projects. This high-visibility role will require working with business, operations, and tech teams across the company and around the world to prioritize projects which support both new products/programs and existing operations and supply chain systems. Description  The Relay Operations Center of Amazon Transportation Services (ATS) is looking for a forward-thinking, customer obsessed leader to manage transportation projects, implement and improve metrics, and ensure that shipments move through the network (Middle Mile) in a way that is scalable and ensures industry leading customer experience.  To be successful in this role, you need a passion for making data driven decisions which will have direct impact on the customer experience. Many decisions will require high velocity decision making with limited information, along with insisting on high standards to improve process or technology. Our environment is deadline driven, fast paced and requires you to be detail-oriented and comfortable interacting or working with multiple teams (business and technical). The Relay Operations Center is constantly changing and improving: “Industry Standard” does not apply. The Operations Manager for Relay Operations Center will need to have a “Figure it Out” mentality as the team is often on the cutting edge, where standardization and background processes do not yet exist.    The ideal candidate has a background in running large, cross-functional projects. The candidate is as comfortable working on high-level strategy and design as they are rolling-up their sleeves and working on implementation. They have demonstrated the ability to build customized logistics solutions, drive process improvement, standardize procedures and eliminate the root cause of defects within current systems. This job will require strong communication skills and the ability to work independently in a high pressure and often ambiguous work environment. Passion and drive for customer service is a must.  #NALH       Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Online grocery and ultra-fast delivery is growing at an exponential rate and with planned expansion and marketing initiatives, we expect volume to grow several orders of magnitude this year and in the future. An S&OP manager is a highly visible and critical role in Amazon from driving ownership, earning trust of stakeholders to delivering results. This position involves using analytical, program management, and operations management skills to develop robust forecasting plans. Description  Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile, products, like Echo, FireTV, Kindle and tablets. The products we design and engineer are easy-to-use and offer users benefits that are only made possible through tightly integrated digital technologies and wireless connectivity.  As a member of the Supply Chain Product Management team, you will engage with the Global Commodity Management and the program management team to develop software tools that enables to conceive, design and develop innovative consumer products. You must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment.  Successful candidates will enjoy working in a collaborative, analytical, and fast-paced environment and are comfortable interacting with cross-functional teams including commodity management, engineering, finance, legal and software development team. Candidates must have excellent analytical capabilities, be comfortable diving deep into data, have strong writing skills, and lead executive-level reviews. Candidates must have a track record of understanding customer needs and delivering technology solutions to address those needs  The Role In the role as a Senior Supply Chain Product Manager, you are responsible for developing next generation online tools for the Supply Chain team at Lab126 and also collaborate with the data engineering team to develop Business Intelligence dashboards for the products being developed. Being proactive is key, you are responsible to wow internal customers with what they need before even them telling us or realizing it. Work fast and smart, and iterate quickly. You’ll also need to be able to communicate clearly and effectively to all levels of the company, both in writing and in meetings.          8+ years of experience as a product manager using agile methodology including ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and follow through on completion of high-profile projects 5+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering or business intelligence  Lab126 is part of the Amazon.com, Inc. group of companies and is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer-Minority/Women/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.   - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A1216254 Show more

Description  Amazon's Sub-Same Day (SSD) delivery program is designed to get customers their stuff as quickly as possible – currently in as quickly as five hours. With ultra-fast delivery becoming increasingly important, we are looking for an experienced Senior Supply Chain Manager to operate, optimize and scale the SSD Supply Chain to support continued expansion of the business.  In this role, you will use analytical, technical, program management, and operations management skills to operate the supply chain in close coordination with partner teams across Amazon. Through high performance execution, you will find opportunities to further optimize Amazon’s world-class logistics infrastructure and adapt it to meet the unique challenges of the ultra-fast delivery business. You will identify opportunities to improve the customer experience while reducing the cost of fulfillment. You will own creating new initiatives, scaling existing processes, and optimizing daily execution to support rapid growth of the business. You must have a strong record of being able to navigate, lead and deliver results in an ambiguous environment.      #gsfsupplychain       Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Description  Emerging Country Topology and Network Planning team is looking for a talented Senior Program Manager who will create solutions to optimize multi-year inventory planning and placement, along with Fulfillment Center operational execution. Our scope includes all emerging countries and regions including but not limited to Australia, China, Middle East and North Africa, Brazil, and Mexico. As a team player, you have an opportunity to work with some of the best software engineers, WW engineers, operations managers, finance partners, and business leaders across the network to design the optimal network topology solutions with an objective to solve the storage and processing capacity, Delivery experience (DEX) and achieve best customer experience in the most cost efficient way.  This role requires working with cross-functional business teams across the company to jointly define requirements, develop topology and capacity solutions, and manage the timelines for all current and future field operations teams to support project launches. This position involves regular communication with senior management on status, risks/opportunities and daily change control management. Cross-team coordination, project management and executive interaction skills are essential.  This position requires superior analytical thinkers, ability to understand complex data, diving deep through various information sources and working closely with WW engineers, technology partners and local operations team to rapidly iterate and deliver solutions. This position also requires to work across a variety of teams, including but not limited to Design Engineering, Technology, Transportation, Operations, S&OP, Finance, Category, Delivery Experience, Safety/EHS and leadership across countries. Successful candidates must thrive in fast-paced environments which encourage collaborative and creative problem solving and critical thinking.          - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A1133005 Show more

Description  The Global Vendor Management (GVM) team was created to accelerate the growth and the profitability of strategic vendors across all of the Amazon marketplaces. Our team creates solutions to drive a better customer and vendor experience, and enable improved selection and value propositions worldwide. Join one of Amazon’s coolest strategic business development teams, with a rare US based business role in the International Expansions organization. The Global Vendor Management (GVM) Program works with HQ senior leadership from a highly selective group of global Amazon vendors, to support the growth of our mutual business and total relationship success across worldwide Amazon. We are seeking a customer-obsessed individual with supply chain and vendor management skills, to build collaborative relationships with vendor executives and Amazon teams across all Amazon countries and organizations (Retail, Advertising, Devices, AWS, Amazon Business, Logistics, and Sustainability). This is a high visibility role and your work will directly impact how we evolve and grow Amazon’s global business. The role requires working with internal and external business teams to develop solutions that optimize our inbound supply chain network by improving the cost structure, service levels, vendor lead times and quality of the program.  The position will be responsible for designing solutions; developing business cases and managing projects from design to production. Responsibilities include working collaboratively with internal teams and suppliers to identify best in class inbound supply chain network.  You will map the physical and data flows and develop and deliver a roadmap of initiatives necessary to achieve the ideal state in existing and new marketplaces including vendor education. You will also be responsible for prioritizing/delivering initiatives that will reduce lead times and costs across the end to end supply chain with global vendor partners. You will identify areas for improvements and develop metrics to monitor inbound transportation performance. Ability to create models/ tools for profitability-analysis to measure and improve the cost structure by product group and program is a must.  You will lead focused and strategically critical projects across the globe in all areas of the business as required to support Global Supply Chain Operations across key vendors. You will diagnose Amazon processes, recognize supplier needs to be efficient, identify improvement opportunities, prescribe improvement strategies and guide the improvement effort. Considerable judgment is necessary because you will be motivating others to meet the challenges of an extremely deadline-driven environment where explosive growth is occurring while achieving impeccable quality. Description  Amazon Transportation Services (ATS) Middle Mile Partner Management manages best-in-class surface transportation programs for our internal and external customers. Connecting vendors, fulfillment centers, sort centers, air gateways, USPS and final mile delivery stations, if a truck load needs to be moved, we deliver results. Amazon is one of the most recognizable brand names in the world and we distribute over a billion shipments each year to our loyal customers. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, customer-centric, bright, and driven people.  We are looking for an organized self-starter who excels at internal stakeholder management and external third party management to join the ATS Transportation Execution Team. We are seeking Transportation Program Managers to support our network throughout the United States. This person is responsible for managing successful transportation execution and programs across specific nodes. This is a high collaborative role and will require work cross-functionally across various teams to be able to meet deliverables.  The ideal candidate will have experience with cross-organization communications and will ensure key information cascades consistently and smoothly across stakeholder organizations. He or she will also possess excellent analytical and problem solving skills. If you have demonstrated an ability to innovate for the customer and want to create the best-in-class transportation experience, then come join our team.    #NALH       Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started. In Ads Product Experiences, we’re continuing to enable economic opportunity for businesses across the world by building more intention, personalization and simplification into our core advertising products, which generate more than 80% of Facebook’s revenue. This robust portfolio includes desktop and mobile tools, our business design system, governance platform and more. We’re looking for an experienced leader to join our passionate, highly collaborative team. You’ll manage content strategists working on this focus area within Ads and Business Products, and help guide the success of the team through coaching, goal setting and building relationships with cross-functional stakeholders. This role requires someone who is known for flexibility and creativity and is excited to lead in a flat organization that values collaboration and communication. You should have experience leading in a way that is authentic, objective, empathic and inspiring. You approach management as an opportunity to help people develop their strengths and make an impact, and recognize when to adapt your leadership style to match people’s unique needs in different situations. You are a natural at building influence in cross-functional partnerships and creating a path to success for the people you manage. You thrive in a flat, fast-moving organization where you can use lightweight processes, creative ideas and quick iteration to have a huge impact. You should also be excited about staying hands-on with product content strategy, guiding and scaling UX quality for web and mobile experiences.   Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Description  At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online around the world, this is your chance to make history. Eliminating borders for buyers and sellers, The Global Mile team facilitates Amazon's expansion into a rapidly growing list of countries, creating new logistical benchmarks and "firsts" through disruptive innovation. The multicultural, multilingual team works with merchants, sellers, providers, governments and trade officials from the busiest to the most remote locations around the world, applying a global perspective with a local approach. Our mission is “Every supplier. Every location. Every customer on Earth”. A key enabler of our global strategy is developing a strong procurement organization. The primary objective of the procurement organization is to support the growth of Global Mile inbound and export programs by building and managing global contracts, negotiating commercial agreements, and strategically managing vendors and their performance globally. We are looking for a results-driven Procurement Strategy Manager for our team. You will own the management of global supply chain contracts, including the supporting functions of vendor purchase order creation, management and alignment of contractual and commercial terms, and managing contract renewals, amendments and updates to contracts in a vendor management platform. You will also support in financial analysis during sourcing events or renewals. You may also participate in supplier management KPI and procurement reporting, negotiations of key contractual terms, and configuring tools for sourcing events.  The ideal candidate will be an analytical leader with procurement experience in complex, international, or technical environments. The individual needs strong communication skills and the experience to influence and support cross-functional stakeholder groups across all levels of the organization. The ideal candidate takes initiative and demonstrates ownership in driving business goals, while being agile to manage change in a rapidly growing division.         Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. If so, lets talk.    Join the largest startup and proven global leader in the Security industry to protect our planet from emerging cyber threats. Tell the world how you and IBM Security fight to defend businesses, institutions and governments across 130 countries. Make a difference in everyday lives by safeguarding our most valuable information from corporate intellectual property to your family photos. Be a part of IBM’s rich history of innovation and research to deliver solutions built on the foundation of over 3,500 security patents. Are you ready to put on your cape and help us fight the bad guys?  IBM Security is seeking a Campaign Manager for one of our key campaign segments, Identity and Access Management, (IAM). In this role you will develop, lead and execute end-to-end marketing campaign strategies that are client-centric, data-driven and always evolving to help drive business at IBM. Keys to this role include developing an IAM campaign that creates a strong digital experience, collaborating w/ team members to optimize digital content, messaging, and keywords to improve organic discovery, and partner w/ colleagues to update paid media plan to target and progress potential clients throughout their buyer's journey. You will work closely with the geography teams to provide guidance on campaign execution and share recommendations and best practices                        Show more

The candidate will be required to work closely with banking counterparties and external investment managers to develop existing relationships and establish new relationships as necessary. Description  We are looking for a Sr. Financial Analyst to help define how Prime Video will evaluate its content investments going forward.  Specifically, this role will partner with finance peers, economists, data scientists, and content acquisition managers, in order to establish and operationalize a new framework for determining the economic value of a TV series or film (both licensed and produced content) to Amazon. This will involve not only defining KPIs, but also setting in place guardrails and mechanisms for how said KPIs are utilized.  This work is highly complex (i.e. it is an economic valuation approach) and highly influential (i.e. it will impact our future content decision making) and as such we're looking for a candidate with a proven track record of influencing business strategy, leading projects, and dealing with ambiguous problems.  This role may also support US as well as WW content licensing decisions, including but not limited to: projecting performance of opportunities, determining willingness to pay for opportunities, and coming up with selection goals.         Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation   - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A1282272 Show more

Description  Amazon seeks an experienced Sr. Financial Analyst to play a key role on the Amazon Devices Finance Team. Over the past decade Amazon has developed a number of market-leading, innovative, and fast-growing digital and mobile businesses including Kindle, Fire Tablets, Fire TV and Echo/Alexa Family of Devices. This is an exciting opportunity for an entrepreneurial minded candidate who wants to work in a start-up like environment who is passionate about hardware and its impact on Amazon’s broader ecosystem and is interested in supporting the global Fire Tablet Device and digital content businesses.  The successful candidate will be the Finance partner to the Fire Tablet sales, marketing, and engagement teams, Search Bus Dev, and support monetization opportunities across multiple 2P teams. The role will heavily influence business strategy, diving deep into the P&L, and owning the financial models and forecasts that support key business decisions in a timely, accurate, and actionable manner. This role requires a self-starter with strong business modeling skills, a keen attention to detail, ability to work in a fast-paced environment and good track record of influencing business partners. This job has regular interaction with various business units across Amazon and requires strong interpersonal and communication skills. The candidate must have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies (including statistical concepts) while dealing with financial data from multiple sources and be able to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions. If so, lets talk.  IBM Cloud Integration is seeking a Senior Product Marketing Manager for our Automation portfolio, focused on Robotic Process Automation, the fastest growing software segment according to Gartner. This role will directly support IBM’s recent WDG Automation acquisition globally and own the broader RPA message for all of IBM. You will be responsible for the external positioning of our product offerings, corresponding point of view and messaging, inbound and outbound marketing activities, and market views. In this role, you will develop strategic marketing plans for IBM offerings through market research, competitive analysis, customer engagement, and business planning. You will work closely with clients, offering management, development and sales to launch new offerings and craft the market facing messaging and positioning of our existing portfolio. You will conceive and develop innovative marketing programs that drive demand and sales results.  You will be the expert in buyer personas - how the target audience buys and their buying criteria - and will transfer that knowledge to the sales channel. As a champion in the market, you will help drive our IBM Automation value proposition and gain insights that enable you to contribute to our broader go-to-market strategy. You will be client centric, data driven and agile to the core to deliver optimal business outcomes. Attention to detail and an eye for quality, along with the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into differentiated outcomes and benefits is crucial. Enterprises today are in a constant challenge of managing the deployment of their applications, while driving innovation, ensuring security and applying governance policies across the business environment. Complex, hybrid IT environments have become increasingly difficult to manage via manual processes and cracks in those processes can put organizations at risk of outages or data breaches.  With an open Management Platform powered by Artificial Intelligence (AI) enterprises can automate labor-intensive processes to achieve proactive incident resolution, and embrace an integrated DevSecOps model, freeing IT Operations teams and Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) to innovate in the open, hybrid cloud environment. Description  Amazon’s Devices organization is seeking an experienced finance leader with corporate finance experience who has an operationally focused mindset, is a big thinker and is interested being part of a fast paced, global organization.  This role is expected to build a deep understanding of all aspects of financial planning, reporting and analytics, as well as building tools to streamline and automate current processes.  The successful candidate will be strategic in thinking, analytical in approach, and have a demonstrated ability to influence the decisions of the business through effective communication, financial analyses, logical reasoning, and the creation of alternatives.    The successful candidate will have shown experience in past roles influencing business owners and supporting decision making in rapidly evolving environments. The candidate must have the aptitude to incorporate new approaches and methodologies, including statistical concepts, while dealing with big data. Excellent business and communication skills are a must to develop and define key business questions and to build data sets that answer those questions. You should be able to work with business customers to understand the requirements and implement financial solutions.  This role requires a self-starter with excellent business modeling skills, a keen attention to detail, ability to work in a fast-paced environment and good track record of influencing decisions. This role also has regular interaction with various business units across Amazon and requires exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Enterprises today are in a constant challenge of managing the deployment of their applications, while driving innovation, ensuring security and applying governance policies across the business environment. Complex, hybrid IT environments have become increasingly difficult to manage via manual processes and cracks in those processes can put organizations at risk of outages or data breaches.  With an open Management Platform powered by Artificial Intelligence (AI) enterprises can automate labor-intensive processes to achieve proactive incident resolution, and embrace an integrated DevSecOps model, freeing IT Operations teams and Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) to innovate in the open, hybrid cloud environment.  IBM Hybrid Cloud is seeking a Product Marketing Manager (PMM) to support the latest offering, Watson AIOPs and IBM Multicloud Management Pak. This person will be responsible for the external positioning of our offering, inbound and outbound marketing activities and market analysis. In this role, you will develop strategic marketing plans for IBM through market research, competitive analysis, customer engagement and business planning. You will work closely with clients, offering management, development and sales teams to craft the market facing messaging and positioning of the current offering as well as forward-looking concepts and roadmap items. Your messaging skills will help to craft inspiring and forward–looking value propositions and messaging that resonates with the buying audience to drive demand and sales results.  You will be the expert in buyer personas - how the target audience buys and their buying criteria - and will transfer that knowledge to the sales channel. As a champion in the market, you will help drive our IBM Hybrid Cloud value proposition and gain insights that enable you to contribute to our broader go-to-market strategy. You will be client centric, data driven and agile to the core to deliver optimal business outcomes. Attention to detail and an eye for quality, along with the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into differentiated outcomes and benefits is crucial.    Discover what you can do at IBM.     IBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to solve some of the world's most complex problems, help our clients achieve success and build collaborative work environments for IBMers. Description  Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will work directly with stakeholders, finance counterparts and engineering leaders to plan and forecast Headcount for several very complex Lab 126 businesses. The successful candidate will have demonstrated ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously and drive projects to completion. Description  The Amazon Studios Financial Planning & Analysis team is looking for an experience Senior Financial Analyst. We are looking for a motivated candidate who has operated successfully in a fast-paced, global, results-oriented environment and has the ability to influence the decisions of senior business leaders through effective verbal and written communication, logical reasoning, and the presentation of analyses. In this role you will own financial reporting packages that drive business insights and actions. In addition, you will be responsible for financial analyses related to new, strategic business opportunities. You will also collaborate with business leaders to set goals and craft strategic operating plans. A successful candidate will be a self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity; dives deep into data to find the root cause of problems, creates action plans to take advantage of business opportunities, is detail oriented and has the ability to work well with cross-functional teams. IBM Hybrid Cloud is seeking a Product Marketing Manager (PMM) to support the latest offering, Watson AIOPs and IBM Multicloud Management Pak. This person will be responsible for the external positioning of our offering, inbound and outbound marketing activities and market analysis. In this role, you will develop strategic marketing plans for IBM through market research, competitive analysis, customer engagement and business planning. You will work closely with clients, offering management, development and sales teams to craft the market facing messaging and positioning of the current offering as well as forward-looking concepts and roadmap items. Your messaging skills will help to craft inspiring and forward–looking value propositions and messaging that resonates with the buying audience to drive demand and sales results.  You will be the expert in buyer personas - how the target audience buys and their buying criteria - and will transfer that knowledge to the sales channel. As a champion in the market, you will help drive our IBM Hybrid Cloud value proposition and gain insights that enable you to contribute to our broader go-to-market strategy. You will be client centric, data driven and agile to the core to deliver optimal business outcomes. Attention to detail and an eye for quality, along with the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into differentiated outcomes and benefits is crucial.    Discover what you can do at IBM.     IBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to solve some of the world's most complex problems, help our clients achieve success and build collaborative work environments for IBMers.  What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.  IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries. This is an exciting opportunity to join at an early stage one of the most innovative businesses at Amazon. As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will work directly with business leaders to identify opportunities and deliver results.  The successful candidate will have proven experience in past roles influencing decision making and supporting business owners in rapidly evolving environments. This role requires a self starter with strong modeling skills, a keen attention to detail, and an ability to manage multiple projects effectively. This role also has regular interaction with executives and various business units across Amazon and therefore requires strong interpersonal and communication skills. IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is the largest professional services organization in the world, with 80,000+ professionals operating in all of IBM’s 170 countries, generating approximately $27BN a year in revenue. With global reach, pragmatic strategies, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, GBS empowers clients to reinvent their business models and gain competitive edge in the cognitive era. As part of its continuous evolution to future-proof its business model and deliver outsized impact for clients, GBS is investing in a number of growth platforms, service lines and practices including Enterprise Strategy and Talent & Transformation.  BM Global Business Services (GBS) is the largest professional services organization in the world, with 80,000+ professionals operating in all of IBM’s 170 countries, generating approximately $27BN a year in revenue. With global reach, pragmatic strategies, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, GBS empowers clients to reinvent their business models and gain competitive edge in the cognitive era. As part of its continuous evolution to future-proof its business model and deliver outsized impact for clients, GBS is investing in a number of growth platforms, service lines and practices including Enterprise Strategy and Talent & Transformation.    Enterprise Strategy is a global management consulting practice comprised of 800+ professionals globally, operating in 20+ countries , and have extensive experience at top management consulting firms.  The primary role of Enterprise Strategy is to serve as the “tip of the spear” for IBM’s engagement with senior business leaders, bringing together IBM’s unique capabilities across strategy, innovation, design, data analytics, cognitive computing and technology platforms to develop and deliver high-impact transformation programs. Enterprise Strategy capabilities include business strategy development and activation, connected operations and next generation operating model strategies, technology and data strategies, and talent reinvention and transformation enablement.    Talent and Transformation is a global innovation unit that leads the market in human-centric, digital and AI solutions that enable clients to execute a range of talent, workforce and HR solutions at scale, while delivering on three vectors – efficiency and optimization, effectiveness, and engagement.  The Talent and Transformation Innovation Unit is comprised of over 6000 professionals globally, and have extensive advisory, CHRO, technology, and business process outsourcing experience. Talent and Transformation capabilities include workforce transformation and the future of work; HR reinvention, shared services, outsourcing and technology; employee engagement and culture transformation; organizational change management; talent strategies and microservices; and learning strategies and platforms.        The candidate will play a leadership role in all aspects of building the Talent and Transformation Strategy practice. Description  Amazon seeks an entrepreneurial, analytical, and highly motivated Financial Analyst with a passion to dive into large-scale data sets to surface insights and create infrastructure solutions. This role will be a member of the North America Customer Fulfillment (NACF) Reporting team and partner directly with Finance teams supporting Fulfillment Centers.    The NACF Reporting team will own a key stake in the Network’s centralization effort and deliver a reporting structure for Variable Cost, Fixed Cost, and Operational metrics. Description  Prime Video is seeking a highly motivated, results-oriented individual with a passion for growing a business focused on unique and inspiring entertainment that delivers for our customers worldwide. The Senior Brand Manager will be responsible for executing consumer and trade campaigns on- and off-Amazon that build awareness for and deeper engagement with Prime Video global tentpole event series. They will lead development of integrated communication plans to launch new programming, support awards campaigns, as well as oversee planning for sustained annual and franchise engagement, including working with and guiding teams to build media plans, advertising creative, promotions and partnerships, digital and social media programs, complementary in-market events, campaign analysis, tracking, business development and more.  The Senior Brand Manager will develop and launch campaigns and engagement programs that impact millions of customers globally. This role will work closely with internal teams including development, media, creative, awards, partnerships and promotions, social, international, research, legal, events and PR, as well as partner with external strategy and creative agencies. The successful candidate will have a proven track record for driving output and results, working autonomously to set a roadmap and goals for performance as well as have substantial experience working with executive producers and industry partners. This person should possess a blended balance of strategist, project manager, producer, creative, relationship builder, franchise manager and analyst. Critical to success will be relationships with companies, talent and external studios who may be partners on the project(s).  Core Responsibilities    Manage the process start to finish for strategy, development and execution of year-round integrated marketing plans across both consumer and awards.
